Verse: No creature is there crawling on the earth, no bird flying with its wings, but they are nations like unto yourselves. We have neglected nothing in the Book; then to their Lord they shall be mustered.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And those who cry lies to Our signs are deaf and dumb, dwelling in the shadows. Whomsoever God will, He leads astray, and whomsoever He will, He sets him on a straight path.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’What think you? If God’s chastisement comes upon you, or the Hour comes upon you, will you call upon any other than God if you speak truly?’

Name: Cattle
Verse: No; upon Him you will call, and He will remove that for which you call upon Him if He Will, and you will forget that you associate with Him.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Indeed We sent to nations before thee, and We seized them with misery and hardship that haply they might be humble;

Name: Cattle
Verse: if only, when Our might came upon them, they had been humble! But their hearts were hard, and Satan decked out fair to them what they were doing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: So, when they forgot what they were reminded of; We opened unto them the gates of everything until; when they rejoiced in what they were given, We seized them suddenly, and behold, they were sore confounded.

Name: Cattle
Verse: So the last remnant of the people who did evil was cut off. Praise belongs to God the Lord of all Being.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’What think you? If God seizes your hearing and sight, and sets a seal upon your hearts, who is a god other than God to give it back to you?’ Behold how We turn about the signs! Yet thereafter they are turning away.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’What think you? If God’s chastisement comes upon you, suddenly or openly, shall any be destroyed, except the people of the evildoers?’

Name: Cattle
Verse: We do not send the Envoys, except good tidings to bear, and warning; whoever believes and makes amends -- no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.

Name: Cattle
Verse: But those who cry lies to Our signs, them the chastisement shall visit, for that they were ungodly.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’I do not say to you, "I possess the treasuries of God"; I know not the Unseen. And I say not to you, "I am an angel"; I only follow what is revealed to me. Say: ’Are the blind and the seeing man equal? Will you not reflect?’

Name: Cattle
Verse: And warn therewith those who fear they shall be mustered to their Lord; they have, apart from God, no protector and no intercessor; haply they will be godfearing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And do not drive away those who call upon their Lord at morning and evening desiring His countenance; nothing of their account falls upon thee, and nothing of thy account falls upon them, that thou shouldst drive them away, and so become one of the evildoers.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Even so We have tried some of them by others that they may say, Are these the ones God has been gracious to among us?’ Knows not God very well the thankful?

Name: Cattle
Verse: And when those who believe in Our signs come to thee, say, ’Peace be upon you. Your Lord has prescribed for Himself mercy. Whosoever of you does evil in ignorance, and thereafter repents and makes amends, He is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Thus We distinguish Our signs, that the sinners’ way may be manifest.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’I am forbidden to serve those you call on apart from God.’ Say: ’I do not follow your caprices, or else I had gone astray, and would not be of the right-guided.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’I stand upon a clear sign from my Lord, and you have cried lies to it. Not with me is that you seek to hasten; the judgment is God’s alone. He relates the truth, and He is the Best of deciders.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’If what you seek to hasten were with me, the matter between you and me would be decided; and God knows very well the evildoers.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: With Him are the keys of the Unseen; none knows them but He. He knows what is in land and sea; not a leaf falls, but He knows it. Not a grain in the earth’s shadows, not a thing, fresh or withered, but it is in a Book Manifest.

Name: Cattle
Verse: It is He who recalls you by night, and He knows what you work by day; then He raises you up therein, that a stated term may be determined; then unto Him shall you return, then He will tell you of what you have been doing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: He is the Omnipotent over His servants. He sends recorders over you till, when any one of you is visited by death, Our messengers take him and they neglect not.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Then they are restored to God their Protector, the True. Surely His is the judgment; He is the swiftest of reckoners.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’Who delivers you from the shadows of land and sea? You call upon Him humbly and secretly, "Truly, if Thou deliverest from these, we shall be among the thankful."

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’God delivers you from them and from every distress; then you assign Him associates.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’He is able to send forth upon you chastisement, from above you or from under your feet, or to confuse you in sects and to make you taste the violence of one another.’ Behold how We turn about the signs; haply they will understand.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Thy people have cried it lies; yet it is the truth. Say: ’I am not a guardian over you.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Every tiding has its time appointed; you will surely know.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: When thou seest those who plunge into Our signs, turn away from them until they plunge into some other talk; or if Satan should make thee forget, do not sit, after the reminding, with the people of the evildoers.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Nothing of their account falls upon those that are godfearing; but a reminding; haply they will be godfearing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Leave alone those who take their religion for a sport and a diversion, and whom the present life has deluded. Remind hereby, lest a soul should be given up to destruction for what it has earned; apart from God, it has no protector and no intercessor; though it offer any equivalent, it shall not be taken from it. Those are they who are given up to destruction for what they have earned; for them awaits a draught of boiling water and a painful chastisement, for that they were unbelievers.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’Shall we call, apart from God, on that which neither profits nor hurts us, and shall we be turned back on our heels after that God has guided us? -- Like one lured to bewilderment in the earth by Satans, though he has friends who call him to guidance, "Come to us!" Say: ’God’s guidance is the true guidance, and we are commanded to surrender to the Lord of all Being,

Name: Cattle
Verse: and: "Perform the prayer, and fear Him; it is unto Him you shall be mustered."

Name: Cattle
Verse: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in truth; and the day He says ’Be’, and it is; His saying is true, and His is the Kingdom the day the Trumpet is blown; He is Knower of the Unseen and the visible; He is the All-wise, the All-aware.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And when Abraham said to his father Azar, ’Takest thou idols for gods? I see thee, and thy people, in manifest error.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: So We were showing Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and earth, that he might be of those having sure faith.

Name: Cattle
Verse: When night outspread over him he saw a star and said, ’This is my Lord.’ But when it set he said, ’I love not the setters.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: When he saw the moon rising, he said, ’This is my Lord.’ But when it set he said, ’If my Lord does not guide me I shall surely be of the people gone astray.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: When he saw the sun rising, he said, ’This is my Lord; this is greater!’ But when it set he said, ’O my people, surely I am quit of that you associate.

Name: Cattle
Verse: I have turned my face to Him who originated the heavens and the earth, a man of pure faith; I am not of the idolaters.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: His people disputed with him. He said, ’Do you dispute with me concerning God, and He has guided me? I fear not what you associate with Him, except my Lord will aught. My Lord embraces all things in His knowledge; will you not remember?

Name: Cattle
Verse: How should I fear what you have associated, seeing you fear not that you have associated with God that whereon He has not sent down on you any authority?’ Which of the two parties has better title to security, if you have any knowledge?

Name: Cattle
Verse: Those who believe, and have not confounded their belief with evildoing -- to them belongs the true security; they are rightly guided.

Name: Cattle
Verse: That is Our argument, which We bestowed upon Abraham as against his people. We raise up in degrees whom We will; surely thy Lord is All-wise, All-knowing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And We gave to him Isaac and Jacob -- each one We guided, And Noah We guided before; and of his seed David and Solomon, Job and Joseph, Moses and Aaron -- even so We recompense the good-doers --

Name: Cattle
Verse: Zachariah and John, Jesus and Elias; each was of the righteous;

Name: Cattle
Verse: Ishmael and Elisha, Jonah and Lot-each one We preferred above all beings;

Name: Cattle
Verse: and of their fathers, and of their seed, and of their brethren; and We elected them, and We guided them to a straight path.

Name: Cattle
Verse: That is God’s guidance; He guides by it whom He will of His servants; had they been idolaters, it would have failed them, the things they did.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Those are they to whom We gave the Book, the Judgment, the Prophethood; so if these disbelieve in it, We have already entrusted it to a people who do not disbelieve in it.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Those are they whom God has guided; so follow their guidance. Say: ’I ask of you no wage for it; it is but a reminder unto all beings.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: They measured not God with His true measure when they said, ’God has not sent down aught on any mortal.’ Say: ’Who sent down the Book that Moses brought as a light and a guidance to men? You put it into parchments, revealing them, and hiding much; and you were taught that you knew not, you and your fathers.’ Say: ’God.’ Then leave them alone, playing their game of plunging.

Name: Cattle
Verse: This is a Book We have sent down, blessed and confirming that which was before it, and for thee to warn the Mother of Cities and those about her; and those who believe in the world to come believe in it, and watch over their prayers.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie, or says,, ’To me it has been revealed’, when naught has been revealed to him, or he who says, ’I will send down the like of what God has sent down’? If thou couldst only see when the evildoers are in the agonies of death, and the angels are stretching out their hands: ’Give up your souls! Today you shall be recompensed with the chastisement of humiliation for what you said untruly about God, waxing proud against His signs.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: ’Now you have come to Us one by one, as We created you upon the first time, and you have left what We conferred on you behind your backs. We do not see with you your intercessors, those you asserted to be associates in you; the bond between you is now broken; that which you ever asserted has now gone astray from you.

Name: Cattle
Verse: It is God who splits the grain and the date-stone, brings forth the living from the dead; He brings forth the dead too from the living. So that then is God; then how are you perverted?

Name: Cattle
Verse: He splits the sky into dawn, and has made the night for a repose, and the sun and moon for a reckoning. That is the ordaining of the All-mighty, the All-knowing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: It is He who has appointed for you the stars, that by them you might be guided in the shadows of land and sea. We have distinguished the signs for a people who know.

Name: Cattle
Verse: It is He who produced you from one living soul, and then a lodging-place, and then a repository. We have distinguished the signs for a people who understand.

Name: Cattle
Verse: It is He who sent down out of heaven water, and thereby We have brought forth the shoot of every plant, and then We have brought forth the green leaf of it, bringing forth from it close-compounded grain, and out of the palm-tree, from the spathe of it, dates thick-lustered, ready to the hand, and gardens of vines, olives, pomegranates, like each to each, and each unlike to each. Look upon their fruits when they fructify and ripen! Surely, in all this are signs for a people who do believe.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Yet they ascribe to God, as associates, the jinn, though He created them; and they impute to Him sons and daughters without any knowledge. Glory be to Him! High be He exalted above what they describe!

Name: Cattle
Verse: The Creator of the heavens and the earth -- how should He have a son, seeing that He has no consort, and He created all things, and He has knowledge of everything?

Name: Cattle
Verse: That then is God your Lord; there is no god but He, the Creator of everything. So serve Him, for He is Guardian over everything.

Name: Cattle
Verse: The eyes attain Him not, but He attains the eyes; He is the All-subtle, the All-aware.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Clear proofs have come to you from your Lord. Whoso sees clearly, it is to his own gain, and whoso is blind, it is to his own loss; I am not a watcher over you.

Name: Cattle
Verse: So We turn about the signs, that they may say, ’Thou hast studied’; and that We may make it clear to a people having knowledge.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Follow thou what has been revealed to thee from thy Lord; there is no god but He; and turn thou away from the idolaters.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Had God willed, they were not idolaters; and We have not appointed thee a watcher over them, neither art thou their guardian.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Abuse not those to whom they pray, apart from God, or they will abuse God in revenge without knowledge. So We have decked out fair to every nation their deeds; then to their Lord they shall return, and He will tell them what they have been doing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: They have sworn by God the most earnest oaths if a sign comes to them they will believe in it. Say: ’Signs are only with God.’ What will make you realize that, when it comes, they will not believe?

Name: Cattle
Verse: We shall turn about their hearts and their eyes, even as they believed not in it the first time; and We shall leave them in their insolence wandering blindly.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Though We had sent down the angels to them, and the dead had spoken with them, had We mustered against them every thing, face to face, yet they would not have been the ones to believe, unless God willed; but most of them are ignorant.

Name: Cattle
Verse: So We have appointed to every Prophet an enemy -- Satans of men and jinn, revealing tawdry speech to each other, all as a delusion; yet, had thy Lord willed, they would never have done it. So leave them to their forging,

Name: Cattle
Verse: and that the hearts of those who believe not in the world to come may incline to it, and that they may be well-pleased with it, and that they may gain what they are gaining.

Name: Cattle
Verse: What, shall I seek after any judge but God? For it is He who sent down to you the Book well-distinguished; and those whom We have given the Book know it is sent down from thy Lord with the truth; so be not thou of the doubters.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Perfect are the words of thy Lord in truthfulness and justice; no man can change His words; He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: If thou obeyest the most part of those on earth they will lead thee astray from the path of God; they follow only surmise, merely conjecturing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Thy Lord knows very well who goes astray from His path; He knows very well the right-guided.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Eat of that over which God’s Name has been mentioned, if you believe in His signs.

Name: Cattle
Verse: How is it with you, that you do not eat of that over which God’s Name has been mentioned, seeing that He has distinguished for you that He has forbidden you, unless you are constrained to it? But surely, many lead astray by their caprices, without any knowledge; thy Lord knows very well the transgressors.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Forsake the outward sin, and the inward surely the earners of sin shall be recompensed for what they have earned.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And eat not of that over which God’s Name has not been mentioned; it is ungodliness. The Satans inspire their friends to dispute with you; if you obey them, you are idolaters.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Why, is he who was dead, and We gave him life, and appointed for him a light to walk by among the people as one whose likeness is in the shadows, and comes not forth from them? So it is decked out fair to the unbelievers the things they have done.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And even so We appointed in every city great ones among its sinners, to devise there; but they devised only against themselves, and they were not aware.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And when a sign came to them, they said, ’We will not believe until we are given the like of what God’s Messengers were given.’ God knows very well where to place His Message; and humiliation in God’s sight shall befall the sinners, and a terrible chastisement, for what they devised.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Whomsoever God desires to guide, He expands his breast to Islam; whomsoever He desires to lead astray, He makes his breast narrow, tight, as if he were climbing to heaven. So God lays abomination upon those who believe not.

Name: Cattle
Verse: This is the path of thy Lord; straight; We have distinguished the signs to a people who remember.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Theirs is the abode of peace with their Lord, and He is their Protector for that they were doing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: On the day when He shall muster them all together: ’Company of jinn, you have made much of mankind.’ Then their friends among mankind will say, ’Our Lord, we have profited each of the other, and we have reached the term determined by Thee for us. He will say: ’The Fire is your lodging, therein to dwell forever’ - except as God will; surely thy Lord is All-wise, All-knowing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: So We make the evildoers friends of each other for what they have earned.

Name: Cattle
Verse: ’Company of jinn and mankind, did not Messengers come to you from among you, relating to you My signs and warning you of the encounter of this your day?’ They shall say, ’We bear witness against ourselves.’ They were deluded by the present life, and they bear witness against themselves that they were unbelievers.

Name: Cattle
Verse: That is because thy Lord would never destroy the cities unjustly, while their inhabitants were heedless.

Name: Cattle
Verse: All have degrees according to what they have done; thy Lord is not heedless of the things they do.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Thy Lord is All-sufficient, Merciful. If He will, He can put you away, and leave after you, to succeed you, what He will, as He produced you from the seed of another people.

Name: Cattle
Verse: The thing you are promised, that will surely come; you cannot frustrate it.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’O my people, act according to your station; I am acting. And assuredly you will know who shall possess the Abode Ultimate. Surely the evildoers will not prosper.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: They appoint to God, of the tillage and cattle that He multiplied, a portion, saying, ’This is for God’ -- so they assert -- ’and this is for our associates.’ So what is for their associates reaches not God; and what is for God reaches their associates. Evil is their judgment!

Name: Cattle
Verse: Thus those associates of theirs have decked out fair to many idolaters to slay their children, to destroy them, and to confuse their religion for them. Had God willed, they would not have done so; so leave them to their forging.

Name: Cattle
Verse: They say, ’These are cattle and tillage sacrosanct; none shall eat them, but whom we will’-- so they assert -- ’and cattle whose backs have been forbidden, and cattle over which they mention not the Name of God.’ All that they say, forging against God; He will assuredly recompense them for what they were forging.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And they say, ’What is within the bellies of these cattle is reserved for our males and forbidden to our spouses; but if it be dead, then they all shall be partners in it.’ He will assuredly recompense them for their describing; surely He is All-wise, All-knowing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Losers are they who slay their children in folly, without knowledge, and have forbidden what God has provided them, forging against God; they have gone astray, and are not right-guided.

Name: Cattle
Verse: It is He who produces gardens trellised, and untrellised, palm-trees, and crops diverse in produce, olives, pomegranates, like each to each, and each unlike to each. Eat of their fruits when they fructify, and pay the due thereof on the day of its harvest; and be not prodigal; God loves not the prodigal.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And of the cattle, for burthen and for slaughter, eat of what God has provided you; and follow not the steps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Eight couples: two of sheep, of goats two. Say: ’Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females? Or what the wombs of the two females contain? Tell me with knowledge, if you speak truly.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Of camels two, of oxen two. Say: ’Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females? Or what the wombs of the two females contain? Or were you witnesses when God charged you with this? Then who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie, in order that he may lead mankind astray without any knowledge? Surely God guides not the people of the evildoers.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’I do not find, in what is revealed to me, aught forbidden to him who eats thereof except it be carrion, or blood outpoured, or the flesh of swine -- that is an abomination -- or an ungodly thing that has been hallowed to other than God; yet whoso is constrained, not desiring nor transgressing, surely thy Lord is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: And to those of Jewry We have forbidden every beast with claws; and of oxen and sheep We have forbidden them the fat of them, save what their backs carry, or their entrails, or what is mingled with bone; that We recompensed them for their insolence; surely We speak truly.

Name: Cattle
Verse: So, if they cry thee lies, say: ’Your Lord is of mercy all-embracing, and His might will never be turned back from the people of the sinners.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: The idolaters will say, ’Had God willed, we would not have been idolaters, neither our fathers, nor would we have forbidden aught.’ Even so the people before them cried lies until they tasted Our might. Say: ’Have you any knowledge, for you to bring forth for us? You follow only surmise, merely conjecturing.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’To God belongs the argument conclusive; for had He willed, He would have guided you all.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’Produce your witnesses, those who testify God has forbidden this.’ Then if they testify, bear not witness with them; and do not thou follow the caprices of those who cried lies to Our signs, and who believe not in the world to come, and ascribe equals to their Lord.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’Come, I will recite what your Lord has forbidden you: that you associate not anything with Him, and to be good to your parents, and not to slay your children because of poverty; We will provide you and them and that you approach not any indecency outward or inward, and that you slay not the soul God has forbidden, except by right. That then He has charged you with; haply you will understand.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And that you approach not the property of the orphan, save in the fairer manner, until he is of age. And fill up the measure and the balance with justice. We charge not any soul save to its capacity. And when you speak, be just, even if it should be to a near kinsman. And fulfil God’s covenant. That then He has charged you with; haply you will remember.

Name: Cattle
Verse: And that this is My path, straight; so do you follow it, and follow not divers paths lest they scatter you from His path. That then He has charged you with; haply you will be godfearing.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Then We gave Moses the Book, complete for him who does good, and distinguishing every thing, and as a guidance and a mercy; haply they would believe in the encounter with their Lord.

Name: Cattle
Verse: This is a Book We have sent down, blessed; so follow it, and be godfearing; haply so you will find mercy;

Name: Cattle
Verse: lest you should say, ’The Book was sent down only upon two parties before us, and we have indeed been heedless of their study’;

Name: Cattle
Verse: or lest you say, ’If the Book had been sent down upon us, we had surely been more rightly guided than they.’ Yet indeed a clear sign has come to you from your Lord, and a guidance and a mercy; and who does greater evil than he who cries lies to God’s signs, and turns away from them? We shall surely recompense those who turn away from Our signs with an evil chastisement for their turning away.

Name: Cattle
Verse: What, do they look for the angels to come to them, nothing less, or that thy Lord should come, or that one of thy Lord’s signs should come? On the day that one of thy Lord’s signs comes it shall not profit a soul to believe that never believed before, or earned some good in his belief. Say: ’Watch and wait; We too are waiting.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Those who have made divisions in their religion and become sects, thou art not of them in anything; their affair is unto God, then He will tell them what they have been doing.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Whoso brings a good deed shall have ten the like of it; and whoso brings an evil deed shall only be recompensed the like of it; they shall not be wronged.

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’As for me, my Lord has guided me to a straight path, a right religion, the creed of Abraham, a man of pure faith; he was no idolater.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’My prayer, my ritual sacrifice, my living, my dying -- all belongs to God, the Lord of all Being.

Name: Cattle
Verse: No associate has He. Even so I have been commanded, and I am the first of those that surrender.’

Name: Cattle
Verse: Say: ’Shall I seek after a Lord other than God, who is the Lord of all things?’ Every soul earns only to its own account, no soul laden bears the load of another. Then to your Lord shall you return, and He will tell you of that whereon you were at variance.

Name: Cattle
Verse: It is He who has appointed you viceroys in the earth, and has raised some of you in rank above others, that He may try you in what He has given you. Surely thy Lord is swift in retribution; and surely He is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Alif Lam Mim Sad

Name: The Heights
Verse: A Book sent down to thee -- so let there be no impediment in thy breast because of it -- to warn thereby, and as a reminder to believers:

Name: The Heights
Verse: Follow what has been sent down to you from your Lord, and follow no friends other than He; little do you remember.

Name: The Heights
Verse: How many a city We have destroyed! Our might came upon it at night, or while they took their ease in the noontide,

Name: The Heights
Verse: and they but cried, when Our might came upon there, ’We were evildoers.’;

Name: The Heights
Verse: So We shall question those unto whom a Message was sent, and We shall question the Envoys,

Name: The Heights
Verse: and We shall relate to them with knowledge; assuredly We were not absent.

Name: The Heights
Verse: The weighing that day is true; he whose scales are heavy -- they are the prosperers,

Name: The Heights
Verse: and he whose scales are light -- they have lost their soul for wronging Our signs.

Name: The Heights
Verse: We have established you in the earth and there appointed for you livelihood; little thanks you show.

Name: The Heights
Verse: We created you, then We shaped you, then We said to the angels: ’Bow yourselves to Adam’; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis -- he was not of those that bowed themselves.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said He, ’What prevented thee to bow thyself, when I commanded thee?’ Said he, ’I am better than he; Thou createdst me of fire, and him Thou createdst of clay.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said He, ’Get thee down out of it; it is not for thee to wax proud here, so go thou forth; surely thou art among the humbled.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said he, ’Respite me till the day they shall be raised.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said He, ’Thou art among the ones that are respited.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said he, ’Now, for Thy perverting me, I shall surely sit in ambush for them on Thy straight path;

Name: The Heights
Verse: then I shall come on them from before them and from behind them, from their right hands and their left hands; Thou wilt not find most of them thankful.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said He, ’Go thou forth from it, despised and banished. Those of them that follow thee -- I shall assuredly fill Gehenna with all of you.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: ’O Adam, inherit, thou and thy wife, the Garden, and eat of where you will, but come not nigh this tree, lest you be of the evildoers.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Then Satan whispered to them, to reveal to them that which was hidden from them of their shameful parts. He said, ’Your Lord has only prohibited you from this tree lest you become angels, or lest you become immortals.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And he swore to them, ’Truly, I am for you a sincere adviser.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: So he led them on by delusion; and when they tasted the tree, their shameful parts revealed to them, so they took to stitching upon themselves leaves of the Garden. And their Lord called to them, ’Did not I prohibit you from this tree, and say to you, "Verily Satan is for you a manifest foe"?’

Name: The Heights
Verse: They said, ’Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if Thou dost not forgive us, and have mercy upon us, we shall surely be among the lost.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said He, ’Get you down, each of you an enemy to each. In the earth a sojourn shall be yours, and enjoyment for a time.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said He, ’Therein you shall live, and therein you shall die, and from there you shall be brought forth.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Children of Adam! We have sent down on you a garment to cover your shameful parts, and feathers; and the garment of godfearing -- that is better; that is one of God’s signs; haply they will remember.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Children of Adam! Let not Satan tempt you as he brought your parents out of the Garden, stripping them of their garments to show them their shameful parts. Surely he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you see them not. We have made the Satans the friends of those who do not believe.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And whenever they commit an indecency they say, ’We found our fathers practising it, and God has commanded us to do it.’ Say: ’God does not command indecency; what, do you say concerning God such things as you know not?’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Say: ’My Lord has commanded justice. Set your faces in every place of worship and call on Him, making your religion sincerely His. As He originated you so you will return;

Name: The Heights
Verse: a part He guided, and a part justly disposed to error -- they have taken Satans for friends instead of God, and think them guided.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Children of Adam! Take your adornment at every place of worship; and eat and drink, but be you not prodigal; He loves not the prodigal.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Say: ’Who has forbidden the ornament of God which He brought forth for His servants, and the good things of His providing?’ Say: ’These, on the Day of Resurrection, shall be exclusively for those who believed in this present life. So We distinguish the signs for a people who know.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Say: ’My Lord has only forbidden indecencies, the inward and the outward, and sin, and unjust insolence, and that you associate with God that for which He sent down never authority, and that you say concerning God such as you know not.

Name: The Heights
Verse: To every nation a term; when their term comes they shall not put it back by a single hour nor put it forward.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Children of Adam! If there should come to you Messengers from among you, relating to you My signs, then whosoever is godfearing and makes amends -- no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And those that cry lies to Our signs, and wax proud against them -- those shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, therein dwelling forever.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie, or cries lies to His signs? Those - their portion of the Book shall reach them; till, when Our messengers come to them, to take them away, they say, ’Where is that you were calling on, beside God?’ They will say, ’They have gone astray from us, and they will bear witness against themselves that they were unbelievers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: He will say, ’Enter among nations that passed away before you, jinn and mankind, into the Fire.’ Whenever any nation enters, it curses its sister-nation; till, when they have all successively come there, the last of them shall say to the first of them, ’O our Lord, these led us astray; so give them a double chastisement of the Fire.’ He will say, ’Unto each a double, but you know not.

Name: The Heights
Verse: The first of them shall say to the last of them, ’You have no superiority over us, then; so taste the chastisement for what you have been earning.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Those that cry lies to Our signs and wax proud against them the gates of heaven shall not be opened to them, nor shall they enter Paradise until the camel passes through the eye of the needle. Even so We recompense the sinners;

Name: The Heights
Verse: Gehenna shall be their cradle, above them coverings. Even so We recompense the evildoers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- We charge not any soul, save according to its capacity; those are the inhabitants of Paradise, therein dwelling forever;

Name: The Heights
Verse: We shall strip away all rancour that is in their breasts; and underneath them rivers flowing; and they will say, ’Praise belongs to God, who guided us unto this; had God not guided us, we had surely never been guided. Indeed, our Lord’s Messengers came with the truth.’ And it will be proclaimed: ’This is your Paradise; you have been given it as your inheritance for what you did.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: The inhabitants of Paradise will call to the inhabitants of the Fire: ’We have found that. which our Lord promised us true; have you found what your Lord promised you true?’ ’Yes,’ they will say. And then a herald shall proclaim between them: ’God’s curse is on the evildoers

Name: The Heights
Verse: who bar from God’s way, desiring to make it crooked, disbelieving in the world to come.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And between them is a veil, and on the Ramparts are men knowing each by their mark, who shall call to the inhabitants of Paradise: ’Peace be upon you! They have not entered it, for all their eagerness.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when their eyes are turned towards the inhabitants of the Fire they shall say, ’Our Lord, do not Thou assign us with the people of the evildoers.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And the dwellers on the Battlements shall call to certain men they know by their sign: ’Your amassing has not availed you, neither your waxing proud.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Are these the ones that you swore God would never reach with mercy?’ ’Enter Paradise; no fear upon you, nor shall you sorrow.

Name: The Heights
Verse: The inhabitants of the Fire shall call to the inhabitants of Paradise: ’Pour on us water, or of that God has provided you!’ They will say: ’God has forbidden them to the unbelievers

Name: The Heights
Verse: who have taken their religion as a diversion and a sport, and whom the present life has deluded.’ -- Therefore today We forget them as they forgot the encounter of this their day, and that they denied Our signs.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And We have brought to them a Book that We have well distinguished, resting on knowledge, a guidance and a mercy unto a people that believe.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Do they look for aught else but its interpretation? The day its interpretation comes, those who before forgot it shall say, ’Indeed, our Lord’s Messengers came with the truth. Have we then any intercessors to intercede for us, or shall we be returned, to do other than that we have done?’ They have indeed lost their souls, and that which they were forging has gone astray from them.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Surely your Lord is God, who created the heavens and the earth in six days -- then sat Himself upon the Throne, covering the day with the night it pursues urgently -- and the sun, and the moon, and the stars subservient, by His command. Verily, His are the creation and the command. Blessed be God, the Lord of all Being.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Call on your Lord, humbly and secretly; He loves not transgressors.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Do not corruption in the land, after it has been set, right; and call on Him fearfully, eagerly -- surely the mercy of God is nigh to the good-doers;

Name: The Heights
Verse: It is He who looses the winds, bearing good tidings before His mercy, till, when they are charged with heavy clouds, We drive it to a dead land and therewith send down water, and bring forth, therewith all the fruits. Even so We shall bring forth the dead; haply you will remember.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And the good land -- its vegetation comes forth by the leave of its Lord, and the corrupt -- it comes forth but scantily. Even so We turn about the signs for a people that are thankful.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And We sent Noah to his people; and he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other’ than He; truly, I fear for you the chastisement of a dreadful day.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said the Council of his people, ’We see thee in manifest error.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said he, ’My people, there is no error in me; but I am a Messenger from the Lord of all Being.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: I deliver to you the Messages of my Lord, and I advise you sincerely; for I know from God that you know not.

Name: The Heights
Verse: What, do you wonder that a reminder from your Lord should come to you by the lips of a man from among you? That he may warn you, and you be godfearing, haply to find mercy.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: But they cried him lies; so We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark, and We drowned those who cried lies to Our signs; assuredly they were a blind people.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And to Ad their brother Hood; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He; will you not be godfearing?’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, ’We see thee in folly, and we think that thou art one of the liars.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said he, ’My people, there is no folly in me; but I am a Messenger from the Lord of all Being.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: I deliver to you the Messages of my Lord; I am your adviser sincere, faithful.

Name: The Heights
Verse: What, do you wonder that a reminder from your Lord should come to you by the lips of a man from among you? That he may warn you; and remember when He appointed you as successors after the people of Noah, and increased you in stature broadly; remember God’s bounties; haply you will prosper.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: They said, ’Why, hast thou come to us that we may serve God alone, and forsake that our fathers served? Then bring us that thou promisest us, if thou speakest truly.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said he, ’Anger and wrath from your Lord have fallen upon you. What, do you dispute with me regarding names you have named, you and your fathers, touching which God has sent down never authority? Then watch and wait; I shall be with you watching and waiting.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: So We delivered him, and those with him, by a mercy from Us; and We cut off the last remnant of those who cried lies to Our signs and were not believers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And to Thamood their brother Salih; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He; there has now come to you a clear sign from your Lord -- this is the She-camel of God, to be a sign for you. Leave her that she may eat in God’s earth, and do not touch her with evil, lest you be seized by a painful chastisement.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And remember when He appointed you successors after Ad, and lodged you in the land, taking to yourselves castles of its plains, and hewing its mountains into houses. Remember God’s bounties, and do not mischief in the earth, working corruption.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said the Council of those of his people who waxed proud to those that were abased, to those of them who believed, ’Do you know that Salih is an Envoy from his Lord?’ They said, ’In the Message he has been sent with we are believers.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said the ones who waxed proud, ’As for us, we are unbelievers in the thing in which you believe.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: So they hamstrung the She-camel and turned in disdain from the commandment of their Lord, saying, ’O Salih, bring us that thou promisest us, if thou art an Envoy.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: So the earthquake seized them, and morning found them in their habitation fallen prostrate.

Name: The Heights
Verse: So he turned his back on them, and said, ’O my people, I have delivered to you the Message of my Lord, and advised you sincerely; but you do not love sincere advisers.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And Lot, when he said to his people, ’What, do you commit such indecency as never any being in all the world committed before you?

Name: The Heights
Verse: See, you approach men lustfully instead of women; no, you are a people that do exceed.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And the only answer of his people was that they said, ’Expel them from your city; surely they are folk that keep themselves clean!’

Name: The Heights
Verse: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife; she was one of those that tarried.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And We rained down upon them a rain; so behold thou, how was the end of the sinners!

Name: The Heights
Verse: And to Midian their brother Shuaib; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He; there has now come to you a clear sign from your Lord. So fill up the measure and the balance, and diminish not the goods of the people; and do not corruption in the land, after it has been set right; that is better for you, if you are believers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And do not sit in every path, threatening and barring from God’s way those who believe in Him, desiring to make it crooked. And remember when you were few, and He multiplied you; and behold, how was the end of the workers of corruption.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And if there is a party of you who believe in the Message I have been sent with, and a party who believe not, be patient till God shall judge between us; He is the best of judges.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said the Council of those of his people who waxed proud, ’We will surely expel thee, O Shuaib, and those who believe with thee, from our city, unless you return into our creed.’ He said, ’What, even though we detest it?

Name: The Heights
Verse: We should have forged against God a lie if we returned into your creed; after God delivered us from it. It is not for us to return into it, unless God our Lord so will. Our Lord embraces all things in His knowledge. In God we have put our trust. Our Lord, give true deliverance between us and our people; Thou art the best of deliverers.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said the Council of those of his people who disbelieved, ’Now, if you follow Shuaib, assuredly in that case you will be losers.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: So the earthquake seized them, and morning found them in their habitation fallen prostrate,

Name: The Heights
Verse: those who cried lies to Shuaib, as if never they dwelt there; those who cried lies to Shuaib, they were the losers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: So he turned his back on them, and said, ’O my people, I have delivered to you the Messages of my Lord, and advised you sincerely; how should I grieve for a people of unbelievers?’

Name: The Heights
Verse: We have sent no Prophet to any city but that We seized its people with misery and hardship, that haply they might be humble;

Name: The Heights
Verse: then We gave them in the place of evil good, till they multiplied, and said, ’Hardship and happiness visited our fathers.’ So We seized them suddenly, unawares.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Yet had the peoples of the cities believed and been godfearing, We would have opened upon them blessings from heaven and earth; but they cried lies, and so We seized them for what they earned.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Do the people of the cities feel secure Our might shall not come upon them at night while they are sleeping?

Name: The Heights
Verse: Do the people of the cities feel secure Our might shall not come upon them in daylight while they are playing?

Name: The Heights
Verse: Do they feel secure against God’s devising? None feels secure against God’s devising but the people of the lost.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Is it not a guidance to those who inherit the earth after those who inhabited it that, did We will, We would smite them because of their sins, sealing their hearts so they do not hear?

Name: The Heights
Verse: Those cities We relate to thee tidings of; their Messengers came to them with the clear signs, but they were not the ones to believe in that they had cried lies before; so God seals the hearts of the unbelievers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: We found no covenant in the most part of them; indeed, We found the most part of them ungodly.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Then We sent, after them, Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his Council, but they did them wrong; so behold thou, how was the end of the workers of corruption!

Name: The Heights
Verse: Moses said, ’Pharaoh, I am a Messenger from the Lord of all Being,

Name: The Heights
Verse: worthy to say nothing regarding God except the truth. I have brought a clear sign to you from your Lord; so send forth with me the Children of Israel.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said he, ’If thou hast brought a sign, produce it, if thou speakest truly.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: So he cast his staff; and behold, it was a serpent manifest.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it was white to the beholders.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said the Council of the people of Pharaoh, ’Surely this man is a cunning sorcerer

Name: The Heights
Verse: who desires to expel you from your land; what do you command?’

Name: The Heights
Verse: They said, ’Put him and his brother off a while, and send among the cities musterers,

Name: The Heights
Verse: to bring thee every cunning sorcerer.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And the sorcerers came to Pharaoh, saying, ’We shall surely have a wage, if we should be the victors?’

Name: The Heights
Verse: He said, ’Yes, indeed; and you shall be among the near-stationed.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: They said, ’Moses, wilt thou cast, or shall we be the casters?’

Name: The Heights
Verse: He said, ’You cast.’ And when they cast they put a Spell upon the people’s eyes, and called forth fear of them, and produced a mighty sorcery.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And We revealed to Moses: ’Cast thy staff!’ And lo, it forthwith swallowed up their lying invention.

Name: The Heights
Verse: So the truth came to pass, and false was proved what they were doing.

Name: The Heights
Verse: So they were vanquished there, and they turned about, humbled.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And the sorcerers were cast down, bowing themselves.

Name: The Heights
Verse: They said, ’We believe in the Lord of all Being,

Name: The Heights
Verse: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said Pharaoh, ’You have believed in Him before I gave you leave. Surely this is a device you have devised in the city that you may expel its people from it. Now you shall know!

Name: The Heights
Verse: I shall assuredly cut off alternately your hands and feet, then I shall crucify you all together.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: They said, ’Surely unto our Lord we are turning.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Thou takest vengeance upon us only because we have believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us. Our Lord, pour out upon us patience, and gather us unto Thee surrendering.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Then said the Council of the people of Pharaoh, ’Wilt thou leave Moses and his people to work corruption in the land, and leave thee and thy gods?’ Said he, ’We shall slaughter their sons and spare their women; surely we are triumphant over them!’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said Moses to his people, ’Pray for succour to God, and be patient; surely the earth is God’s and He bequeaths it to whom He will among His servants. The issue ultimate is to the godfearing.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: They said, ’We have been hurt before thou camest to us, and after thou camest to us.’ He said, ’Perchance your Lord will destroy your enemy, and will make you successors in the land, so that He may behold how you shall do.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Then seized We Pharaoh’s people with years of dearth, and scarcity of fruits, that haply they might remember.

Name: The Heights
Verse: So, when good came to them, they said, ’This belongs to us’; but if any evil smote them, they would augur ill by Moses and those with him. Why, surely their ill augury was with God; but the most of them knew not.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And they said, ’Whatsoever sign thou bringest to us, to cast a spell upon us, we will not believe thee.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: So We let loose upon them the flood and the locusts, the lice and the frogs, the blood, distinct signs; but they waxed proud and were a sinful people.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when the wrath fell upon them, they said, ’Moses, pray to thy Lord for us by the covenant He has made with thee. If thou removest from us the wrath, surely we will believe thee, and send forth with thee the Children of Israel.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: But when We removed from them the wrath unto a term that they should come to, lo, they broke their troth.

Name: The Heights
Verse: So We took vengeance on them, and drowned them in the sea, for that they cried lies to Our signs and heeded them not.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And We bequeathed upon the people that were abased all the east and the west of the land We had blessed; and perfectly was fulfilled the most fair word of thy Lord upon the Children of Israel, for that they endured patiently; and We destroyed utterly the works of Pharaoh and his people, and what they had been building.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And We brought the Children of Israel over the sea, and they came upon a people cleaving to idols they had. They said, ’Moses, make for us a god, as they have gods.’ Said he, ’You are surely a people who are ignorant.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Surely this they are engaged upon shall be shattered, and void is what they have been doing.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: He said, ’What, shall I seek a god for you other than God, who has preferred you above all beings?’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when We delivered you from the folk of Pharaoh who were visiting you with evil chastisement, slaying your sons, and sparing your women -- and in that was a grievous trial from your Lord.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And We appointed with Moses thirty nights and We completed them with ten, so the appointed time of his Lord was forty nights; and Moses said to his brother Aaron, ’Be my successor among my people, and put things right, and do not follow the way of the workers of corruption.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when Moses came to Our appointed time and his Lord spoke with him, he said, ’Oh my Lord, show me, that I may behold Thee!’ Said He, ’Thou shalt not see Me; but behold the mountain -- if it stays fast in its place, then thou shalt see Me.’ And when his Lord revealed Him to the mountain He made it crumble to dust; and Moses fell down swooning. So when he awoke, he said, ’Glory be to Thee! I repent to Thee; I am the first of the believers.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Said He, ’Moses, I have chosen thee above all men for My Messages and My Utterance; take what I have given thee, and be of the thankful.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And We wrote for him on the Tablets of everything an admonition, and a distinguishing of everything: ’So take it forcefully, and command thy people to take the fairest of it. I shall show you the habitation of the ungodly.

Name: The Heights
Verse: I shall turn from My signs those who wax proud in the earth unjustly; though they see every sign, they will not believe in it, and though they see the way of rectitude they will not take it for a way, and though they see the way of error, they will take it for a way. That, because they have cried lies to Our signs and heeded them not.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Those who cry lies to Our signs, and the encounter in the world to come -- their works have failed; shall they be recompensed, except according to the things they have done?

Name: The Heights
Verse: And the people of Moses took to them, after him, of their ornaments a Calf -- a mere body that lowed. Did they not see it spoke not to them, neither guided them upon any way? Yet they took it to them, and were evildoers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when they smote their hands, and saw that they had gone astray, they said, ’If our Lord has not mercy on us, and forgives us not, surely we shall be of the lost.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and sorrowful, he said, ’Evilly have you done in my place, after me; what, have you outstripped your Lord’s commandment?’ And he cast down the Tablets, and laid hold of his brother’s head, dragging him to him. He said, ’Son of my mother, surely the people have abased me, and well nigh slain me. Make not my enemies to gloat over me, and put me not among the people of the evildoers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: He said, ’O my Lord, forgive me and my brother and enter us into Thy mercy; Thou art the most merciful of the merciful.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: ’Surely those who took to themselves the Calf -- anger shall overtake them from their Lord, and abasement in this present life; so We recompense those who are forgers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And those who do evil deeds, then repent thereafter and believe, surely thereafter thy Lord is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when Moses’ anger abated in him, he took the Tablets and in the inscription of them was guidance, and mercy unto all those who hold their Lord in awe.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And Moses chose of his people seventy men for Our appointed time; and when the earthquake seized them, he said, ’My Lord, hadst Thou willed Thou wouldst have destroyed them before, and me. Wilt Thou destroy us for what the foolish ones of us have done? It is only Thy trial, whereby Thou leadest astray whom Thou wilt, and guidest whom Thou wilt. Thou art our Protector; so forgive us, and have mercy on us, for Thou art the best of forgivers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And prescribe for us in this world good, and in the world to come; we have repented unto Thee.’ Said He, ’My chastisement -- I smite with it whom I will; and My mercy embraces all things, and I shall prescribe it for those who are godfearing and pay the alms, and those who indeed believe in Our signs,

Name: The Heights
Verse: those who follow the Messenger, ’the Prophet of the common folk, whom they find written down with them in the Torah and the Gospel, bidding them to honour, and forbidding them dishonour, making lawful for them the good things and making unlawful for them the corrupt things, and relieving them of their loads, and the fetters that were upon them. Those who believe in him and succour him and help him, and follow the light that has been sent down with him -- they are the prosperers.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Say: ’O mankind, I am the Messenger of God to you all, of Him to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth. There is no god but He. He gives life, and makes to die. Believe then in God, and in His Messenger, the Prophet of the common folk, who believes in God and His words, and follow him; haply so you will be guided.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Of the people of Moses there is a nation who guide by the truth, and by it act with justice.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And We cut them up into twelve tribes, nations. And We revealed to Moses, when his people asked him for water: ’Strike with thy staff the rock’; and there gushed forth from it twelve fountains all the people knew now their drinking-place. And We outspread the cloud to overshadow them, and We sent down manna and quails upon them: ’Eat of the good things wherewith We have supplied you.’ And they worked no wrong upon Us, but themselves they wronged.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when it was said to them, ’Dwell in this township and eat of it wherever you will; and say, Unburdening; and enter in at the gate, prostrating; We will forgive you your transgressions, and increase the good-doers.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Then the evildoers of them substituted a saying other than that which had been said to them; so We sent down upon them wrath out of heaven for their evildoing.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And question them concerning the township which was bordering the sea, when they transgressed the Sabbath, when their fish came to them on the day of their Sabbath, swimming shorewards, but on the day they kept not Sabbath, they came not unto them. Even so We were trying them for their ungodliness.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when a certain nation of them said, ’Why do you admonish a people God is about to destroy or to chastise with a terrible chastisement?’ They said, ’As an excuse to your Lord; and haply they will be godfearing.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: So, when they forgot that they were reminded of; We delivered those who were forbidding wickedness, and We seized the evildoers with evil chastisement for their ungodliness.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when they turned in disdain from that forbidding We said to them, ’Be you apes, miserably slinking!’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when Thy Lord proclaimed He would send forth against them, unto the Day of Resurrection, those who should visit them with evil chastisement. Surely thy Lord is swift in retribution; surely He is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And We cut them up into nations in the earth, some of them righteous, and some of them otherwise; and We tried them with good things and evil, that haply they should return.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And there succeeded after them a succession who inherited the Book, taking the chance goods of this lower world, and saying, ’It will be forgiven us’; and if chance goods the like of them come to them, they will take them. Has not the compact of the Book been taken touching them, that they should say concerning God nothing but the truth? And they have studied what is in it; and the Last Abode is better for those who are godfearing. Do you not understand?

Name: The Heights
Verse: And those who hold fast to the Book, and perform the prayer -- surely We leave not to waste the wage of those who set aright.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when We shook the mountain above them as if it were a canopy, and they supposed it was about to fall on them: ’Take forcefully what We have given you, and remember what is in it; haply you will be godfearing.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when thy Lord took from the Children of Adam, from their loins, their seed, and made them testify touching themselves, ’Am I not your Lord?’ They said, ’Yes, we testify’-- lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection, ’As for us, we were heedless of this,’

Name: The Heights
Verse: or lest you say, ’Our fathers were idolaters aforetime, and we were seed after them. What, wilt Thou then destroy us for the deeds of the vain-doers?’

Name: The Heights
Verse: So We distinguish the signs; and haply they will return.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And recite to them the tiding of him to whom We gave Our signs, but he cast them off; and Satan followed after him, and he became one of the perverts.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And had We willed, We would have raised him up thereby; but he inclined towards the earth and followed his lust. So the likeness of him is as the likeness of a dog; if thou attackest it it lolls its tongue out, or if thou leavest it, it lolls its tongue out. That is that people’s likeness who cried lies to Our signs. So relate the story; haply they will reflect.

Name: The Heights
Verse: An evil likeness is the likeness of the people who cried lies to Our signs, and themselves were wronging.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Whomsoever God guides, he is rightly guided; and whom He leads astray -- they are the losers.

Name: The Heights
Verse: We have created for Gehenna many jinn and men: they have hearts, but understand not with them; they have eyes, but perceive not with them; they have ears, but they hear not with them. They are like cattle; nay, rather they are further astray. Those -- they are the heedless.

Name: The Heights
Verse: To God belong the Names Most Beautiful; so call Him by them, and leave those who blaspheme His Names -- they shall assuredly be recompensed for the things they did.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Of those We created are a nation who guide by the truth, and by it act with justice.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And those who cry lies to Our signs We will draw them on little by little whence they know not;

Name: The Heights
Verse: and I respite them -- assuredly My guile is sure.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Have they not reflected? No madness is in their comrade; he is naught but a plain warner.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Or have they not considered the dominion of the heaven and of the earth, and what things God has created, and that it may be their term is already nigh? In what manner of discourse then will they after this believe?

Name: The Heights
Verse: Whomsoever God leads astray, no guide he has; He leaves them in their insolence blindly wandering.

Name: The Heights
Verse: They will question thee concerning the Hour, when it shall berth. Say: ’The knowledge of it is only with my Lord; none shall reveal it at its proper time, but He. Heavy is it in the heavens and the earth; it will not come on you but suddenly!’ They will question thee, as though thou art well-informed of it. Say: ’The knowledge of it is only with God, but most men know not.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Say: ’I have no power to profit for myself; or hurt, but as God will. Had I knowledge of the Unseen I would have acquired much good, and evil would not have touched me. I am only a warner, and a bearer of good tidings, to a people believing.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: It is He who created you out of one living soul, and made of him his spouse that he might rest in her. Then, when he covered her, she bore a light burden and passed by with it; but when it became heavy they cried to God their Lord, ’If Thou givest us a righteous son, we indeed shall be of the thankful.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: Thereafter, when He gave them a righteous son, they assigned Him associates in that He had given them; but God is high exalted above that they associate.

Name: The Heights
Verse: What, do they associate that which creates nothing and themselves are created,

Name: The Heights
Verse: and that have no power to help them, neither they help themselves?

Name: The Heights
Verse: If you call them to guidance they will not follow you; equal it is to you whether you call them, or whether you are silent.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Those on whom you call apart from God, are servants the likes of you; call them and let them answer you, if you speak truly.

Name: The Heights
Verse: What, have they feet wherewith they walk, or have they hands wherewith they lay hold, or have they eyes wherewith they see, or have they ears wherewith they give ear? Say: ’Call you then to your associates; then try your guile on me, and give me no respite.

Name: The Heights
Verse: My Protector is God who sent down the Book, and He takes into His protection the righteous.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And those on whom you call, apart from God, have no power to help you, neither they help themselves.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: If you call them to the guidance they do not hear; and thou seest them looking at thee, unperceiving.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Take the abundance, and bid to what is honourable, and turn away from the ignorant.

Name: The Heights
Verse: If a provocation from Satan should provoke thee, seek refuge in God; He is All-hearing, All-seeing.

Name: The Heights
Verse: The godfearing, when a visitation of Satan troubles them, remember, and then see clearly;

Name: The Heights
Verse: and their brothers they lead on into error, then they stop not short.

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when thou bringest them not a sign, they say, ’Why hast thou not chosen one?’ Say: ’I follow only what is revealed to me from my Lord; this is clear testimony from your Lord, guidance, and mercy for a people of believers.’

Name: The Heights
Verse: And when the Koran is recited, give you ear to it and be silent; haply so you will find mercy.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Remember thy Lord in thy soul, humbly and fearfully, not loud of voice, at morn and eventide. Be not thou among the heedless.

Name: The Heights
Verse: Surely those who are with thy Lord wax not too proud to serve Him; they chant His praise, and to Him they bow.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: They will question thee concerning the spoils. Say: ’The spoils belong to God and the Messenger; so fear you God, and set things right between you, and obey you God and His Messenger, if you are believers.’

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Those only are believers who, when God is mentioned, their hearts quake, and when His signs are recited to them, it increases them in faith, and in their Lord they put their trust,

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: those who perform the prayer, and expend of what We have provided them,

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: those in truth are the believers; they have degrees with their Lord, and forgiveness, and generous provision.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: As thy Lord brought thee forth from thy house with the truth, and a part of the believers were averse to it,

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: disputing with thee concerning the truth after it had become clear, as though they were being driven into death with their eyes wide open.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And when God promised you one of the two parties should be yours, and you were wishing that the one not accoutred should be yours; but God was desiring to verify the truth by His words, and to cut off the unbelievers to the last remnant,

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: and that He might verify the truth and prove untrue the untrue, though the sinners were averse to it.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: When you were calling upon your Lord for succour, and He answered you, ’I shall reinforce you with a thousand angels riding behind you.’

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: God wrought this not, save as good tidings and that your hearts thereby might be at rest; help comes only from God; surely God is All-mighty, All-wise.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: When He was causing slumber to overcome you as a security from Him, and sending down on you water from heaven, to purify you thereby, and to put away from you the defilement of Satan, and to strengthen your hearts, and to confirm your feet.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: When thy Lord was revealing to the angels, ’I am with you; so confirm the believers. I shall cast into the unbelievers’ hearts terror; so smite above the necks, and smite every finger of them!’

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: That, because they had made a breach with God and with His Messenger; and whosoever makes a breach with God and with His Messenger, surely God is terrible in retribution.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: That for you; therefore taste it; and that the chastisement of the Fire is for the unbelievers.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: O believers, when you encounter the unbelievers marching to battle, turn not your backs to them.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Whoso turns his back that day to them, unless withdrawing to fight again or removing to join another host, he is laden with the burden of God’s anger, and his refuge is Gehenna -- an evil homecoming!

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: You did not slay them, but God slew them; and when thou threwest, it was not thyself that threw, but God threw, and that He might confer on the believers a fair benefit; surely God is All-hearing, All-knowing.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: That for you; and that God weakens the unbelievers’ guile.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: f victory you are seeking, victory has already come upon you; and if you give over, it is better for you. But if you return, We shall return, and your host will avail you nothing though it be numerous; and that God is with the believers.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: O believers, obey God and His Messenger, and do not turn away from Him, even as you are listening;

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: and be not as those who say, ’We hear,’ and they hear not.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Surely the worst of beasts in God’s sight are those that are deaf and dumb and do not understand.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: If God had known of any good in them He would have made them hear; and if He had made them hear, they would have turned away, swerving aside.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: O believers, respond to God and the Messenger when He calls you unto that which will give you life; and know that God stands between a man and his heart, and that to Him you shall be mustered.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And fear a trial which shall surely not smite in particular the evildoers among you; and know that God is terrible in retribution.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And remember when you were few and abased in the land, and were fearful that the people would snatch you away; but He gave you refuge, and confirmed you with His help, and provided you with the good things, that haply you might be thankful.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: O believers, betray not God and the Messenger, and betray not your trusts and that wittingly;

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: and know that your wealth and your children are a trial, and that with God is a mighty wage

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: O believers, if you fear God, He will assign you a salvation, and acquit you of your evil deeds, and forgive you; and God is of bounty abounding.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And when the unbelievers were devising against thee, to confine thee, or slay thee, or to expel thee, and were devising, and God was devising; and God is the best of devisers.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And When Our signs were being recited to them, they said, ’We have already heard; if we wished, we could say the like of this; this is naught but the fairy-tales of the ancients.’

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And when they said, ’O God, if this be indeed the truth from Thee, then rain down upon us stones out of heaven, or bring us a painful chastisement.’

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: But God would never chastise them, with thee among them; God would never chastise them as they begged forgiveness.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: But what have they now, that God should not chastise them, when they are barring from the Holy Mosque, not being its protectors? Its only protectors are the godfearing; but most of them know not.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And their prayer at the House is nothing but a whistling and a clapping of hands -- therefore taste you now the chastisement for your unbelief!

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: The unbelievers expend their wealth to bar from God’s way, and still they will expend it, till it is an anguish for them, then be overthrown, and the unbelievers will be mustered into Gehenna,

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: that God may distinguish the corrupt from the good, and place the corrupt one upon another, and so heap them up all together, and put them in Gehenna; those are the losers.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Say to the unbelievers, if they give over He will forgive them what is past; but if they return, the wont of the ancients is already gone!

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Fight them, till there is no persecution and the religion is God’s entirely; then if they give over, surely God sees the things they do;

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: but if they turn away, know that God is your Protector -- an excellent Protector, an excellent Helper!

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Know that, whatever booty you take, the fifth of it is God’s, and the Messenger’s, and the near kinsman’s, and the orphans’, and for the needy, and the traveller, if you believe in God and that We sent down upon Our servant on the day of salvation,. the day the two hosts encountered; and God is powerful over everything;

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: when you were on the nearer bank, and they were on the farther bank, and the cavalcade was below you; and had you made tryst together, you would have surely failed the tryst; but that God might determine a matter that was done, that whosoever perished might perish by a clear sign, and by a clear sign he might live who lived; and surely God is All-hearing, All-knowing.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: When God showed thee them in thy dream as few; and had He shown them as many you would have lost heart, and quarrelled about the matter; but God saved; He knows the thoughts in the breasts.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: When God showed you them in your eyes as few, when you encountered, and made you few in their eyes, that God might determine a matter that was done; and unto God all matters are returned.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: O believers, whensoever you encounter a host, then stand firm, and remember God frequently; haply so you will prosper.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And obey God, and His Messenger, and do not quarrel together, and so lose heart, and your power depart; and be patient; surely God is with the patient.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Be not as those who went forth from their habitations swaggering boastfully to show off to men, and barring from God’s way; and God encompasses the things they do.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And when Satan decked out their deeds fair to them, and said, ’Today no man shall overcome you, for I shall be your neighbour.’ But when the two hosts sighted each other, he withdrew upon his heels, saying, ’I am quit of you; for I see what you do not see. I fear God; and God is terrible in retribution.’

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: When the hypocrites, and those in whose hearts was sickness, said, ’Their religion has deluded them’; but whosoever puts his trust in God, surely God is All-mighty, All-wise.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: If thou couldst only see when the angels take the unbelievers, beating their faces and their backs: ’Taste the chastisement of the burning --

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: that, for what your hands have forwarded, and for that God is never unjust unto His servants.’

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Like Pharaoh’s folk, and the people before him, who disbelieved in God’s signs; God seized them because of their sins; God is strong, terrible in retribution.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: That is because God would never change His favour that He conferred on a people until they changed what was within themselves; and that God is All-hearing, All-knowing.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Like Pharaoh’s folk, and the people before him, who cried lies to the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them because of their sins, and We drowned the folk of Pharaoh; and all were evildoers.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Surely the worst of beasts in God’s sight are the unbelievers, who will not believe,

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: those of them with whom thou hast made compact then they break their compact every time, not being godfearing.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: So, if thou comest upon them anywhere in the war, deal with them in such wise as to scatter the ones behind them; haply they will remember.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And if thou fearest treachery any way at the hands of a people, dissolve it with them equally; surely God loves not the treacherous.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And thou art not to suppose that they who disbelieve have outstripped Me; they cannot frustrate My will.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Make ready for them whatever force and strings of horses you can, to terrify thereby the enemy of God and your enemy, and others besides them that you know not; God knows them. And whatsoever you expend in the way of God shall be repaid you in full; you will not be wronged.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And if they incline to peace, do thou incline to it; and put thy trust in God; He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And if they desire to trick thee, God is sufficient for thee; He has confirmed thee with His help, and with the believers,

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: and brought their hearts together. Hadst thou expended all that is in the earth, thou couldst not have brought their hearts together; but God brought their hearts together; surely He is All-mighty, All-wise.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: O Prophet, God suffices thee, and the believers who follow thee.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: O Prophet, urge on the believers to fight. If there be twenty of you, patient men, they will overcome two hundred; if there be a hundred of you, they will overcome a thousand unbelievers, for they are a people who understand not.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Now God has lightened it for you, knowing that there is weakness in you. If there be a hundred of you, patient men, they will overcome two hundred; if there be of you a thousand, they will overcome two thousand by the leave of God; God is with the patient.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: It is not for any Prophet to have prisoners until he make wide slaughter in the land. You desire the chance goods of the present world, and God desires the world to come; and God is All-mighty, All-wise.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Had it not been for a prior prescription from God, there had afflicted you, for what you took, a mighty chastisement.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Eat of what you have taken as booty, such as is lawful and good; and fear you God; surely God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: O Prophet, say to the prisoners in your hands: ’If God knows of any good in your hearts He will give you better than what has been taken from you, and He will forgive you; surely God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.’
