Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And if they desire treachery against thee, they have tricked God before; but He has given thee power over them; and God is All-knowing, All-wise.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: Those who believe, and have emigrated and struggled with their possessions and their selves in the way of God, and those who have given refuge and help -- those are friends one of another. And those who believe, but have not emigrated -- you have no duty of friendship towards them till they emigrate; yet if they ask you for help, for religion’s sake, it is your duty to help them, except against a people between whom and you there is a compact; and God sees the things you do.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: As for the unbelievers, they are friends one of another. Unless you do this, there will be persecution in the land and great corruption.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And those who believe, and have emigrated and struggled in the way of God. those who have given refuge and help those in truth are the believers, and theirs shall be forgiveness and generous provision.

Name: Spoils of War
Verse: And those who have believed afterwards and emigrated, and struggled with you -- they belong to you; but those related by blood are nearer to one another in the Book of God; surely God has knowledge of everything.

Name: Repentance
Verse: An acquittal, from God and His Messenger, unto the idolaters with whom you made covenant:

Name: Repentance
Verse: ’Journey freely in the land for four months; and know that you cannot frustrate the will of God, and that God degrades the unbelievers.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: A proclamation, from God and His Messenger, unto mankind on the day of the Greater Pilgrimage: ’God is quit, and His Messenger, of the idolaters. So if you repent, that will be better for you; but if you turn your backs; know that you cannot frustrate the will of God. And give thou good tidings to the unbelievers of a painful chastisement;

Name: Repentance
Verse: excepting those of the idolaters with whom you made covenant, then they failed. you naught neither lent support to any man against you. With them fulfil your covenant till their term; surely God loves the godfearing.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Then, when the sacred months are drawn away, slay the idolaters wherever you find them, and take them, and confine them, and lie in wait for them at every place of ambush. But if they repent, and perform the prayer, and pay the alms, then let them go their way; God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And if any of the idolaters seeks of thee protection, grant him protection till he hears the words of God; then do thou convey him to his place of security -- that, because they are a people who do not know.

Name: Repentance
Verse: How should the idolaters have a covenant with God and His Messenger? -- excepting those with whom you made covenant at the Holy Mosque; so long as they go straight with you, do you go straight with them; surely God loves the godfearing.

Name: Repentance
Verse: How? If they get the better of you, they will not observe towards you any bond or treaty, giving you satisfaction with their mouths but in their hearts refusing; and the most of them are ungodly.

Name: Repentance
Verse: They have sold the signs of God for a small price, and have barred from His way; truly evil is that they have been doing,

Name: Repentance
Verse: observing neither bond nor treaty towards a believer; they are the transgressors.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Yet if they repent, and perform the prayer, and pay the alms, then they are your brothers in religion; and We distinguish the signs for a people who know.

Name: Repentance
Verse: But if they break their oaths after their covenant and thrust at your religion, then fight the leaders of unbelief; they have no sacred oaths; haply they will give over.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Will you not fight a people who broke their oaths and purposed to expel the Messenger, beginning the first time against you? Are you afraid of them? You would do better to be afraid of God, if you are believers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Fight them, and God will chastise them at your hands and degrade them, and He will help you against them, and bring healing to the breasts of a people who believe,

Name: Repentance
Verse: and He will remove the rage within their hearts; and God turns towards whomsoever He will; God is All-knowing, All-wise

Name: Repentance
Verse: Or did you suppose you would be left in peace, and God knows not as yet those of you who have struggled, and taken not -- apart from God and His Messenger and the believers -- any intimate? God is aware of what you do.

Name: Repentance
Verse: It is not for the idolaters to inhabit God’s places of worship, witnessing against themselves unbelief; those -- their works have failed them, and in the Fire they shall dwell forever.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Only he shall inhabit God’s places of worship who believes in God and the Last Day, and performs the prayer, and pays the alms, and fears none but God alone; it may be that those will be among the guided.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Do you reckon the giving of water to pilgrims and the inhabiting of the Holy Mosque as the same as one who believes in God and the Last Day and struggles in the way of God? Not equal are they in God’s sight; and God guides not the people of the evildoers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Those who believe, and have emigrated, and have struggled in the way of God with their possessions and their selves are mightier in rank with God; and those -- they are the triumphant;

Name: Repentance
Verse: their Lord gives them good tidings of mercy from Him and good pleasure; for them await gardens wherein is lasting bliss,

Name: Repentance
Verse: therein to dwell forever and ever; surely with God is a mighty wage.

Name: Repentance
Verse: O believers, take not your fathers and brothers to be your friends, if they prefer unbelief to belief; whosoever of you takes them for friends, those -- they are the evildoers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Say: ’If your fathers, your sons, your brothers, your wives, your clan, your possessions that you have gained, commerce you fear may slacken, dwellings you love -- if these are dearer to you than God and His Messenger, and to struggle in His way, then wait till God brings His command; God guides not the people of the ungodly.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: God has already helped you on many fields, and on the day of Hunain, when your multitude was pleasing to you, but it availed you naught, and the land for all its breadth was strait for you, and you turned about, retreating.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Then God sent down upon His Messenger His Shechina, and upon the believers, and He sent down legions you did not see, and He chastised the unbelievers; and that is the recompense of the unbelievers;

Name: Repentance
Verse: then God thereafter turns towards whom He will; God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: Repentance
Verse: O believers, the idolaters are indeed unclean; so let them not come near the Holy Mosque after this year of theirs. If you fear poverty, God shall surely enrich you of His bounty, if He will; God is All-knowing; All-wise.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Fight those who believe not in God and the Last Day and do not forbid what God and His Messenger have forbidden -- such men as practise not the religion of truth, being of those who have been given the Book -- until they pay the tribute out of hand and have been humbled.

Name: Repentance
Verse: The Jews say, ’Ezra is the Son of God’; the Christians say, ’The Messiah is the Son of God.’ That is the utterance of their mouths, conforming with the unbelievers before them. God assail them! How they are perverted!

Name: Repentance
Verse: They have taken their rabbis and their monks as lords apart from God, and the Messiah, Mary’s son -- and they were commanded to serve but One God; there is no god but He; glory be to Him, above that they associate --

Name: Repentance
Verse: desiring to extinguish with their mouths God’s light; and God refuses but to perfect His light, though the unbelievers be averse.

Name: Repentance
Verse: It is He who has sent His Messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth, that He may uplift it above every religion, though the unbelievers be averse.

Name: Repentance
Verse: O believers, many of the rabbis and monks indeed consume the goods of the people in vanity and bar from God’s way. Those who treasure up gold and silver, and do not expend them in the way of God -- give them the good tidings of a painful chastisement,

Name: Repentance
Verse: the day they shall be heated in the fire of Gehenna and therewith their foreheads and their sides and their backs shall be branded: ’This is the thing you have treasured up for yourselves; therefore taste you now what you were treasuring!’

Name: Repentance
Verse: The number of the months, with God, is twelve in the Book of God, the day that He created the heavens and the earth; four of them are sacred. That is the right religion. So wrong not each other during them. And fight the unbelievers totally even as they fight you totally and know that God is with the godfearing.

Name: Repentance
Verse: The month postponed is an increase of unbelief whereby the unbelievers go astray; one year they make it profane, and hallow it another, to agree with the number that God has hallowed, and so profane what God has hallowed. Decked out fair to them are their evil deeds; and God guides not the people of the unbelievers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: O believers, what is amiss with you, that when it is said to you, ’Go forth in the way of God,’ you sink down heavily to the ground? Are you so content with this present life, rather than the world to come? Yet the enjoyment of this present life, compared with the world to come, is a little thing.

Name: Repentance
Verse: If you go not forth, He will chastise you with a painful chastisement, and instead of you He will substitute another people; and you will not hurt Him anything, for God is powerful over everything.

Name: Repentance
Verse: If you do not help him, yet God has helped him already, when the unbelievers drove him forth the second of two, when the two were in the Cave, when he said to his companion, ’Sorrow not; surely God is with us.’ Then God sent down on him His Shechina, and confirmed him with legions you did not see; and He made the word of the unbelievers the lowest; and God’s word is the uppermost; God is All-mighty, All-wise.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Go forth, light and heavy! Struggle in God’s way with your possessions and your selves; that is better for you, did you know.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Were it a gain near at hand, and an easy journey, they would have followed thee; but the distance was too far for them. Still they will swear by God, ’Had we been able, we would have gone out with you,’ so destroying their souls; and God knows that they are truly liars.

Name: Repentance
Verse: God pardon thee! Why gavest thou them leave, till it was clear to thee which of them spoke the truth, and thou knewest the liars?

Name: Repentance
Verse: Those who believe in God and the Last Day ask not leave of thee, that they may struggle with their possessions and their selves; and God knows the godfearing.

Name: Repentance
Verse: They only ask leave of thee who believe not in God and the Last Day, those whose hearts are filled with doubt, so that in their doubt they go this way and that.

Name: Repentance
Verse: If they had desired to go forth, they would have made some preparation for it; but God was averse that they should be aroused, so He made them pause, and it was said to them, ’Tarry you with the tarriers.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: Had they gone forth among you, they would only have increased you in trouble, and run to and fro in your midst, seeking to stir up sedition between you; and some of you would listen to them; and God knows the evildoers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: They sought to stir up sedition already before, and turned things upside down for thee, until the truth came, and God’s command appeared, though they were averse.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Some of them there are that say, ’Give me leave and do not tempt me.’ Have not such men fallen into temptation? And surely Gehenna encompasses the unbelievers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: If good fortune befalls thee, it vexes them; but if thou art visited by an affliction, they say, ’We took our dispositions before’, and turn away, rejoicing.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Say: ’Naught shall visit us but what God has prescribed for us; He is our Protector; in God let the believers put all their trust.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: Say: ’Are you awaiting for aught to come to us but one of the two rewards most fair? We are awaiting in your case too, for God to visit you with chastisement. from Him, or at our hands; so await; we are awaiting with you.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: Say: ’Expend willingly, or unwillingly, it shall not be accepted from you; you are surely a people ungodly.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: And naught prevents that their expendings should be accepted from them, but that they believe not in God and His Messenger, and perform not the prayer save lazily, and that they expend not without they are averse.

Name: Repentance
Verse: So let not their possessions or their children please thee; God only desires thereby to chastise them in this present life, and that their souls should depart while they are unbelievers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: They swear by God that they belong with you, but they are not of you they are a people that are afraid.

Name: Repentance
Verse: If they could find a shelter, or some caverns, or any place to creep into, they would turn about and bolt away to it.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Some of them find fault with thee touching the freewill offerings; if they are given a share of them they are well-pleased, but if they are given none then they are angry.

Name: Repentance
Verse: O were they well-pleased with what God and His Messenger have brought them, saying, ’Enough for us is God; God will bring us of His bounty, and His Messenger; to God we humbly turn.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: The freewill offerings are for the poor and needy, those who work to collect them, those whose hearts are brought together, the ransoming of slaves, debtors, in God’s way, and the traveller; so God ordains; God is All-knowing, All-wise.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And some of them hurt the Prophet, saying, ’He is an ear!’ Say: ’An ear of good for you; he believes in God, and believes the believers, and he is a mercy to the believers among you. Those who hurt God’s Messenger -- for them awaits a painful chastisement.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: They swear to you by God, to please you; but God and His Messenger -- more right is it they should please Him, if they are believers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Do they not know that whosoever opposes God and His Messenger -- for him awaits the fire of Gehenna, therein to dwell forever? That is the mighty degradation.

Name: Repentance
Verse: The hypocrites are afraid, lest a sura should be sent down against them, telling thee what is in their hearts. Say: ’Mock on; God will bring forth what you fear.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: And if thou questionest them, then assuredly they will say, ’We were only plunging and playing.’ Say: ’What, then were you mocking God, and His signs, and His Messenger?

Name: Repentance
Verse: Make no excuses. You have disbelieved after your believing. If We forgive one party of you, We will chastise another party for that they were sinners.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: The hypocrites, the men and the women, are as one another; they bid to dishonour, and forbid honour; they keep their hands shut; they have forgotten God, and He has forgotten them. The hypocrites -- they are the ungodly.

Name: Repentance
Verse: God has promised the hypocrites, men and women, and the unbelievers, the fire of Gehenna, therein to dwell foreover. That is enough for them; God has cursed them; and there awaits them Like a lasting chastisement.

Name: Repentance
Verse: those before you, who were stronger than you in might, and more abundant in wealth and children; they took enjoyment in their share; so do you take enjoyment in your share, as those before you took enjoyment in their share. You have plunged as they plunged. Those -- their works have failed in this world and in the world to come; those -- they are the losers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Has there not come to you the tidings of those who were before you -- the people of Noah, Ad, Thamood, the people of Abraham, the men of Midian and the subverted cities? Their Messengers came to them with the clear signs God would not wrong them, but themselves they wronged.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And the believers, the men and the women, are friends one of the other; they bid to honour, and forbid dishonour; they perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and they obey God and His Messenger. Those -- upon them God will have mercy; God is All-mighty, All-wise.

Name: Repentance
Verse: God has promised the believers, men and women, gardens underneath which rivers flow, forever therein to dwell, and goodly dwelling-places in the Gardens of Eden; and greater, God’s good pleasure; that is the mighty triumph.

Name: Repentance
Verse: O Prophet, struggle with the unbelievers and hypocrites, and be thou harsh with them; their refuge is Gehenna -- an evil homecoming!

Name: Repentance
Verse: They swear by God that they said nothing, but they indeed said the word of unbelief and disbelieved, after they had surrendered. They purposed what they never attained to, and they took revenge only that God enriched them, and His Messenger, of His bounty. So if they repent it will be better for them; if they turn away, God will chastise them with a painful chastisement in this world and the next; on the earth they have no protector or helper.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And some of them have made covenant with God: ’If He gives us of His bounty, we will make offerings and be of the righteous.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: Nevertheless, when He gave them of His bounty they were niggardly of it, and turned away, swerving aside.

Name: Repentance
Verse: So as a consequence He put hypocrisy into their hearts, until the day they meet Him, for that they failed God in that they promised Him and they were liars.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Did they not know that God knows their secret and what they conspire together, and that God knows the things unseen?

Name: Repentance
Verse: Those who find fault with the believers who volunteer their freewill offerings, and those who find nothing but their endeavour they deride -- God derides them; for them awaits a painful chastisement.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Ask pardon for them, or ask not pardon for them; if thou askest pardon for them seventy times, God will not pardon them; that, because they disbelieved in God and His Messenger; God guides not the people of the ungodly.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Those who were left behind rejoiced in tarrying behind the Messenger of God, and were averse to struggle with their possessions and their selves in the way of God. They said, ’Go not forth in the heat.’ Say: ’Gehenna’s fire is hotter, did they but understand.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: Therefore let them laugh little, and weep much, in recompense for what they have been earning.

Name: Repentance
Verse: So, if God returns thee to a party of them and they ask leave of thee to go forth, say: ’You shall not go forth with me ever, and you shall not fight with me any enemy. You were well-pleased to tarry the first time, so now tarry with those behind.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: And pray thou never over any one of them when he is dead, nor stand over his grave; they disbelieved in God and His Messenger, and died while they were ungodly.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And let not their possessions and their children please thee; God only desires thereby to chastise them in this present world, and that their souls should depart while they are unbelievers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And when a sura is sent down, saying, ’Believe in God, and struggle with His Messenger,’ the affluent among them ask leave of thee, saying, ’Let us be with the tarriers.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: They are well-pleased to be with those behind, and a seal has been set upon their hearts, so the they understand not.

Name: Repentance
Verse: But Messenger, and the believers with him, have struggled with their possessions and their selves, and those -- for them await the good things; those -- they are the prosperers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: God has prepared for them gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein to dwell forever; that is the mighty triumph.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And the Bedouins came with their excuses, asking for leave; those who lied to God and His Messenger tarried; there shall befall the unbelievers of them a painful chastisement.

Name: Repentance
Verse: There is no fault in the weak and the sick and those who find nothing to expend, if they are true to God and to His Messenger. There is no way against the good-doers -- God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate --

Name: Repentance
Verse: neither against those who, when they came to thee, for thee to mount them, thou saidst to them, ’I find not whereon to mount you’; they turned away, their eyes overflowing with tears of sorrow, because they found nothing to expend.

Name: Repentance
Verse: The way is open only against those who ask leave of thee, being rich; they are well-pleased to be with those behind; God has set a seal on their hearts, so they know not.

Name: Repentance
Verse: They will excuse themselves to you, when you return to them. Say: ’Do not excuse yourselves; we will not believe you. God has already told us tidings of you. God will surely see your work, and His Messenger, then you will be returned to Him who knows the unseen and the visible, and He will tell you what you were doing.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: They will swear to you by God, when you turn back to them, that you may turn aside from them. So turn aside from them, for they are an abomination, and their refuge is Gehenna -- a recompense for what they have been earning.

Name: Repentance
Verse: They will swear to you, that you may be well-pleased with them; but if you are well-pleased with them, God will surely not be well-pleased with the people of the ungodly.

Name: Repentance
Verse: The Bedouins are more stubborn in unbelief and hypocrisy, and apter not to know the bounds of what God has sent down on His Messenger; and God is All-knowing, All-wise.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Some of the Bedouins take what they expend for a fine, and await the turns of fortune to go against you. Theirs shall be the evil turn; God is All-hearing, All-knowing.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And some of the Bedouins believe in God and the Last Day, and take what they expend for offerings bringing them near to God, and the prayers of the Messenger. Surely they are an offering for them, and God will admit them into His mercy; God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And the Outstrippers, the first of the Emigrants and the Helpers, and those who followed them in good-doing -- God will be well-pleased with them and they are well-pleased with Him; and He has prepared for them gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein to dwell forever and ever; that is the mighty triumph.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And some of the Bedouins who dwell around you are hypocrites; and some of the people of the City are grown bold in hypocrisy. Thou knowest them not; but We know them, and We shall chastise them twice, then they will be returned to a mighty chastisement.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And other have confessed their sins; they have mixed a righteous deed with another evil. It may be that God will turn towards them; God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Take of their wealth a freewill offering, to purify them and to cleanse them thereby, and pray for them; thy prayers are a comfort for them; God is All-hearing, All-knowing.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Do they not know that God is He who accepts repentance from His servants, and takes the freewill offerings, and that God -- He turns, and is All-compassionate?

Name: Repentance
Verse: Say: ’Work; and God will surely see your work, and His Messenger, and the believers, and you will be returned to Him who knows the unseen and the visible, and He will tell you what you were doing.’

Name: Repentance
Verse: And others are deferred to God’s commandment, whether He chastises them, or turns towards them; God is All-knowing, All-wise.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And those who have taken a mosque in opposition and unbelief, and to divide the believers, and as a place of ambush for those who fought God and His Messenger aforetime -- they will swear ’We desired nothing but good’; and God testifies they are truly liars.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Stand there never. A mosque that was founded upon godfearing from the first day is worthier for thee to stand in; therein are men who love to cleanse themselves; and God loves those who cleanse themselves.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Why, is he better who founded his building upon the fear of God and His good pleasure, or he who founded his building upon the brink of a crumbling bank that has tumbled with him into the fire of Gehenna? And God guides not the people of the evildoers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: The buildings they have built will not cease to be a point of doubt within their hearts, unless it be that their hearts are cut into pieces; God is All-knowing, All-wise.

Name: Repentance
Verse: God has bought from the believers their selves and their possessions against the gift of Paradise; they fight in the way of God; they kill, and are killed; that is a promise binding upon God in the Torah, and the Gospel, and the Koran; and who fulfils his covenant truer than God? So rejoice in the bargain you have made with Him; that is the mighty triumph.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Those who repent, those who serve, those who pray, those whojourney, those who bow, those who prostrate themselves, those who bid to honour and forbid dishonour, those who keep God’s hounds -- and give thou good tidings to the believers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: It is not for the Prophet and the believers to ask pardon for the idolaters, even though they be near kinsmen, after that it has become clear to them that they will be the inhabitants of Hell.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Abraham asked not pardon for his father except because of a promise he had made to him; and when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he declared himself quit of him; Abraham was compassionate, clement.

Name: Repentance
Verse: God would never lead a people astray after that He has guided them, until He makes clear to them as to what they should be godfearing; surely God knows everything.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Surely to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth; He gives life, and makes to die; and you have not, apart from God, either protector or helper.

Name: Repentance
Verse: God has turned towards the Prophet and the Emigrants and the Helpers who followed him in the hour of difficulty, after the hearts of a part of them well-nigh swerved aside; then He turned towards them; surely He is Gentle to them, and All-compassionate.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And to the three who were left behind, until, when the earth became strait for them, for all its breadth, and their souls became strait for them, and they thought that there was no shelter from God except in Him, then He turned towards them, that they might also turn; surely God turns, and is All-compassionate.

Name: Repentance
Verse: O believers, fear God, and be with the truthful ones.

Name: Repentance
Verse: It is not for the people of the City and for the Bedouins who dwell around them to stay behind God’s Messenger, and to prefer their lives to his; that is because they are smitten neither by thirst, nor fatigue, nor emptiness in the way of God, neither tread they any tread enraging the unbelievers, nor gain any gain from any enemy, but a righteous deed is thereby written to their account; God leaves not to waste the wage of the good-doers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Nor do they expend any sum, small or great, nor do they traverse any valley, but it is written to their account, that God may recompense them the best of what they were doing.

Name: Repentance
Verse: It is not for the believers to go forth totally; but why should not a party of every section of them go forth, to become learned in religion, and to warn their people when they return to them, that haply they may beware?

Name: Repentance
Verse: O believers, fight the unbelievers who are near to you; and let them find in you a harshness; and know that God is with the godfearing.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Whenever a sura is sent down to thee, some of them say, ’Which of you has this increased in belief?’ As for the believers, them it has increased in belief, and they are joyful.

Name: Repentance
Verse: But as for those in whose heart is sickness, them it has increased in abomination added to their abomination, and they have died while they were unbelievers.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Do they not see that they are tried every year once or twice? Yet still they do not repent, nor do they remember.

Name: Repentance
Verse: And whenever a sura is sent down, they look one at another: ’Does anyone see you?’ Then they turn away. God has turned away their hearts, for that they are a people who do not understand.

Name: Repentance
Verse: Now there has come to you a Messenger from among yourselves; grievous to him is your suffering; anxious is he over you, gentle to the believers, compassionate.

Name: Repentance
Verse: So if they turn their backs, say: ’God is enough for me. There is no god but He. In Him I have put my trust. He is the Lord of the Mighty Throne.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Alif Lam Ra. Those are the signs of the Wise Book.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Was it a wonder to the people that We revealed to a man from among them: ’Warn the people, and give thou good tidings to the believers that they have a sure footing with their Lord’? The unbelievers say, ’This is a manifest sorcerer.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Surely your Lord is God, who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then sat Himself upon the Throne, directing the affair. Intercessor there is none, save after His leave that then is God, your Lord; so serve Him. Will you not remember?

Name: Jonah
Verse: To Him shall you return, all together -- God’s promise, in truth. He originates creation, then He brings it back again that He may recompense those who believe and do deeds of righteousness, justly. And those who disbelieve -- for them awaits a draught of boiling water, and a painful chastisement, for their disbelieving.

Name: Jonah
Verse: It is He who made the sun a radiance, and the moon a light, and determined it by stations, that you might know the number of the years and the reckoning. God created that not save with the truth, distinguishing the signs to a people who know.

Name: Jonah
Verse: In the alternation of night and day, and what God has created in the heavens and the earth -- surely there are signs for a godfearing people.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Surely those who look not to encounter Us and are well-pleased with the present life and are at rest in it, and those who are heedless of Our signs,

Name: Jonah
Verse: those -- their refuge is the Fire, for that they have been earning.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Surely those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness, their Lord will guide them for their belief; beneath them rivers flowing in gardens of bliss;

Name: Jonah
Verse: their cry therein, ’Glory to Thee, O God,’ their greeting, ’Peace,’ and their cry ends, ’Praise belongs to God, the Lord of all Being.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: If God should hasten unto men evil as they would hasten good, their term would be already decided for them. But We leave those, who look not to encounter Us, in their insolence wandering blindly.

Name: Jonah
Verse: When affliction visits a man, he calls Us on his side, or sitting, or standing; but when We have removed his affliction from him, he passes on, as if he never called Us to an affliction that visited him. So decked out fair to the prodigal is that they have been doing.

Name: Jonah
Verse: We destroyed the generations before you when they did evil, and their Messengers came to them with the clear signs, but they would not believe; so We recompense the people of the sinners.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Then We appointed you viceroys in the earth after them, that We might behold how you would do.

Name: Jonah
Verse: And when Our signs are recited to them, clear signs, those who look not to encounter Us say, ’Bring a Koran other than this, or alter it.’ Say: ’It is not for me to alter it of my own accord. I follow nothing, except what is revealed to me. Truly I fear, if I should rebel against my Lord, the chastisement of a dreadful day.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’Had God willed I would not have recited it to you, neither would He have taught you it; I abode among you a lifetime before it -- will you not understand?’

Name: Jonah
Verse: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie, or cries lies to His signs? Surely the sinners do not prosper.

Name: Jonah
Verse: They serve, apart from God, what hurts them not neither profits them, and they say, ’These are our intercessors with God.’ Say: ’Will you tell God what He knows not either in the heavens or in the earth?’ Glory be to Him! High be He exalted above that they associate!

Name: Jonah
Verse: Mankind were only one nation, then they fell into variance. But for a word that preceded from thy Lord, it had been decided between them already touching their differences.

Name: Jonah
Verse: They say, ’Why has a sign not been sent down upon him from his Lord?’ Say: ’The Unseen belongs only to God. Then watch and wait; I shall be with you watching and waiting.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: When We let the people taste mercy after hardship has visited them, lo, they have a device concerning Our signs. Say: ’God is swifter at devising; surely Our messengers are writing down what you are devising.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: It is He who conveys you on the land and the sea; and when you are in the ship -- and the ships run with them with a fair breeze, and they rejoice in it, there comes upon them a strong wind, and waves come on them from every side, and they think they are encompassed; they call upon God, making their religion His sincerely: ’If Thou deliverest us from these, surely we shall be among the thankful.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Nevertheless when He has delivered them behold, they are insolent in the earth, wrongfully. O men, your insolence is only against yourselves; the enjoyment of this present life, then unto Us you shall return, then We shall tell you what you were doing.

Name: Jonah
Verse: The likeness of this present life is as water that We send down out of heaven, and the plants of the earth mingle with it whereof men and cattle eat, till, when the earth has taken on its glitter and has decked itself fair, and its inhabitants think they have power over it, Our command comes upon it by night or day, and We make it stubble, as though yesterday it flourished not. Even so We distinguish the signs for a people who reflect.

Name: Jonah
Verse: And God summons to the Abode of Peace, and He guides whomsoever He will to to a straight path;

Name: Jonah
Verse: the good-doers the reward most fair and a surplus; neither dust nor abasement shall overspread their faces. Those are the inhabitants of Paradise, therein dwelling forever.

Name: Jonah
Verse: And for those who have earned evil deeds the recompense of an evil deed shall be the like of it; abasement shall overspread them, neither have they any defender from God, as if their faces were covered with strips of night shadowy. Those are the inhabitants of the Fire, therein dwelling forever.

Name: Jonah
Verse: And the day We shall muster them all, then We shall say to those who associate other gods with God: ’Get you to your place, you and your associates!’ Then We shall set a space between them, and their associates will say, ’Not us you were serving.

Name: Jonah
Verse: God is a sufficient witness between us and you; assuredly we were heedless of your service.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: There every soul shall prove its past deeds; and they shall be restored to God, their Protector, the True, and there shall go astray from them that they were forging.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’Who provides you out of heaven and earth, or who possesses hearing and sight, and who brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and who directs the affair?’ They will surely say, ’God.’ Then say: ’Will you not be godfearing?’

Name: Jonah
Verse: That then is God, your Lord, the True; what is there, after truth, but error? Then how are you turned about?

Name: Jonah
Verse: Thus the word of thy Lord is realized against the ungodly that they believe not.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’Is there any of your associates who originates creation, then brings it back again?’ Say: ’God -- He originates creation, then brings it back again; so how are you perverted?’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’Is there any of your associates who guides to the truth?’ Say: ’God -- He guides to the truth; and which is worthier to be followed -- He who guides to the truth, or he who guides not unless he is guided? What then ails you, how you judge?’

Name: Jonah
Verse: And the most of them follow only surmise, and surmise avails naught against truth. Surely God knows the things they do.

Name: Jonah
Verse: This Koran could not have been forged apart from God; but it is a confirmation of what is before it, and a distinguishing of the Book, wherein is no doubt, from the Lord of all Being.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Or do they say, ’Why, he has forged it’? Say: ’Then produce a sura like it, and call on whom you can, apart from God, if you speak truly.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: No; but they have cried lies to that whereof they comprehended not the knowledge, and whose interpretation has not yet come to them. Even so those that were before them cried lies; then behold how was the end of the evildoers!

Name: Jonah
Verse: And some of them believe in it, and some believe not in it. Thy Lord knows very well those who do corruption.

Name: Jonah
Verse: If they cry lies to thee, then do thou say: ’I have my work, and you have your work; you are quit of What I do, and I am quit of what you do.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: And some of them give ear to thee; what, wilt thou make the deaf to hear, though they understand not?

Name: Jonah
Verse: And some of them look unto thee; what, wilt thou then guide the blind, though they do not see?

Name: Jonah
Verse: Surely God wrongs not men anything, but themselves men wrong.

Name: Jonah
Verse: And the day He shall muster them, as if they had not tarried but an hour of the day, mutually recognizing one another; lost will be those who cried lies to the encounter with God, and were not guided.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Whether We show thee a part of that We promise them, or We call thee unto Us, to Us they shall return; then God is witness of the things they do

Name: Jonah
Verse: Every nation has its Messenger; then, when their Messenger comes, justly the issue is decided between them, and they are not wronged.

Name: Jonah
Verse: They say, ’When will this promise be, if you speak truly?’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’I have no power to profit for myself, or hurt, but as God will. To every nation a term; when their term comes they shall not put it back by a single hour nor put it forward.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’Have you considered? If His chastisement comes upon you by night or day, what part of it will the sinners seek to hasten?

Name: Jonah
Verse: What, when it has come to pass, will you then believe in it? Now, when already you seek to hasten it!’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Then it will be said to the evildoers: ’Taste the chastisement of eternity! Are you recompensed for aught but that you have been earning?’

Name: Jonah
Verse: They ask thee to tell them, ’Is it true?’ Say: ’Yes, by my Lord! It is true; you cannot frustrate Him.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: If every soul that has done evil possessed all that is in the earth, he would offer it for his ransom; and they will be secretly remorseful when they see the chastisement, and justly the issue is decided between them, and they are not wronged.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Why, surely to God belongs everything that is in the heavens and earth. Why, surely God’s promise is true; but the most of them have no knowledge

Name: Jonah
Verse: He gives life, and makes to die, and to Him you shall be returned.

Name: Jonah
Verse: O men, now there has come to you an admonition from your Lord, and a healing for what is in the breasts, and a guidance, and a mercy to the believers.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’In the bounty of God, and His mercy -- in that let them rejoice; it is better than that they amass.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’Have you considered the provision God has sent down for you, and you have made some of it unlawful, and some lawful?’ Say: ’Has God given you leave, or do you forge against God?’

Name: Jonah
Verse: What will they think, who forge falsehood against God; on the Day of Resurrection? God is bountiful to men; but most of them are not thankful.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Thou art not upon any occupation, neither recitest thou any Koran of it, nor do you any work, without that We are witnesses over you when you press on it; and not so much as the weight of an ant in earth or heaven escapes from thy Lord, neither is aught smaller than that, or greater, but in a Manifest Book.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Surely God’s friends -- no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Those who believe, and are godfearing --

Name: Jonah
Verse: for them is good tidings in the present life and in the world to come. There is no changing the words of God; that is the mighty triumph.

Name: Jonah
Verse: And do not let their saying grieve thee; the glory belongs altogether to God; He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Why, surely to God belongs everyone that is in the heavens and in the earth; they follow, who call upon associates, apart from God -- they follow nothing but surmise, merely conjecturing.

Name: Jonah
Verse: It is He who made for you the night to repose in it, and the day, to see; surely in that are signs for a people who have ears.

Name: Jonah
Verse: They say, ’God has taken to Him a son. Glory be to Him! He is All-sufficient; to Him belongs all that is in the heavens and in the earth; you have no authority for this. What, do you say concerning God that you know not?

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’Those who forge against God falsehood shall not prosper.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Some enjoyment in this world; then unto Us they shall return; then We shall let them taste the terrible chastisement, for that they were unbelievers.

Name: Jonah
Verse: And recite to them the story of Noah when he said to his people, ’My people, if my standing here is grievous to you and my reminding you of the signs of God, in God have I put my trust; so resolve on your affair, with your associates, then let not your affair be a worry to you, but make decision unto me, and respite me not.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Then if you turn your backs, I have not asked you for any wage; my wage falls only on God, and I have been commanded to be of those that surrender.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: But they cried him lies; so We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark, and We appointed them as viceroys, and We drowned those who cried lies to Our signs; then behold how was the end of them that were warned!

Name: Jonah
Verse: Then We sent forth, after him, Messengers to their people, and they brought them the clear signs; but they were not men to believe in that they had cried lies to before. So We seal the hearts of the transgressors.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Then We sent forth, after them, Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his Council with Our signs, but they waxed proud, and were a sinful people.

Name: Jonah
Verse: So, when the truth came to them from Us, they said, ’Surely this is a manifest sorcery.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Moses said, ’What, do you say this to the truth, when it has come to you? Is this a sorcery? But sorcerers do not prosper.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: They said, ’Art thou come to us to turn us from that we found our fathers practising, and that the domination in the land might belong to you two? We do not believe you.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Pharaoh said, ’Bring me every cunning sorcerer.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Then, when the sorcerers came, Moses said to them, ’Cast you down what you will cast.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Then, when they had cast, Moses said, ’What you have brought is sorcery; God will assuredly bring it to naught. God sets not right the work of those who do corruption.

Name: Jonah
Verse: God verifies the truth by His words, though sinners be averse.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: So none believed in Moses, save a seed of his people, for fear of Pharaoh and their Council, that they would persecute them; and Pharaoh was high in the land, and he was one of the prodigals.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Moses said, ’O my people, if you believe in God, in Him put your trust, if you have surrendered.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: They said, ’In God we have put our trust. Our Lord, make us not a temptation to the people of the evildoers,

Name: Jonah
Verse: and deliver us by Thy mercy from the people of the unbelievers.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: And We revealed to Moses and his brother, ’Take you, for your people, in Egypt certain houses; and make your houses a direction for men to pray to; and perform the prayer; and do thou give good tidings to the believers.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Moses said, ’Our Lord, Thou hast given to Pharaoh and his Council adornment and possessions in this present life. Our Lord, let them go astray from Thy way; Our Lord, obliterate their possessions, and harden their hearts so that they do not believe, till they see the painful chastisement.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: He said, ’Your prayer is answered; so go you straight, and follow not the way of those that know not.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: And We brought the Children of Israel over the sea; and Pharaoh and his hosts followed them insolently and impetuously till, when the drowning overtook him, he said, ’I believe that there is no god but He in whom the Children of Israel believe; I am of those that surrender.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: ’Now? And before thou didst rebel, being of those that did corruption.

Name: Jonah
Verse: So today We shall deliver thee with thy body, that thou mayest be a sign to those after thee. Surely many men are heedless of Our signs.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: And We settled the Children of Israel in a sure settlement, and We provided them with good things; so they differed not until the knowledge came to them. Surely thy Lord will decide between them on the Day of Resurrection touching their differences.

Name: Jonah
Verse: So, if thou art in doubt regarding what We have sent down to thee, ask those who recite the Book before thee. The truth has come to thee from thy Lord; so be not of the doubters,

Name: Jonah
Verse: nor be of those who cry lies to God’s signs so as to be of the losers.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Those against whom thy Lord’s word is realized will not believe,

Name: Jonah
Verse: though every sign come to them, till they see the painful chastisement.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Why was there never a city that believed, and its belief profited it? -- Except the people of Jonah; when they believed, We removed from them the chastisement of degradation in this present life, and We gave unto them enjoyment for a time.

Name: Jonah
Verse: And if thy Lord had willed, whoever is in the earth would have believed, all of them, all together. Wouldst thou then constrain the people, until they are believers?

Name: Jonah
Verse: It is not for any soul to believe save by the leave of God; and He lays abomination upon those who have no understanding.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’Behold what is in the heavens and in the earth!’ But neither signs nor warnings avail a people who do not believe.

Name: Jonah
Verse: So do they watch and wait for aught but the like of the days of those who passed away before them? Say: ’Then watch and wait; I shall be with you watching and waiting.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Then We shall deliver Our Messengers and the believers. Even so, as is Our bounden duty, We shall deliver the believers.

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’O men, if you are in doubt regarding my religion, I serve not those you serve apart from God, but I serve God, who will gather you to Him, and I am commanded to be of the believers, and:

Name: Jonah
Verse: "Set thy face to the religion, a man of pure faith, and be thou not of the idolaters;

Name: Jonah
Verse: and do not call, apart from God, on that which neither profits nor hurts thee, for if thou dost, then thou wilt surely be of the evildoers.

Name: Jonah
Verse: And if God visits thee with affliction, none can remove it but He; and if He desires any good for thee, none can repel His bounty; He causes it to fall upon whomsoever He will of His servants." He is the All-forgiving, the All-compassionate.’

Name: Jonah
Verse: Say: ’O men, the truth has come to you from your Lord. Whosoever is guided is guided only to his own gain, and whosoever goes astray, it is only to his own loss. I am not a guardian over you.

Name: Jonah
Verse: And follow thou what is revealed to thee; and be thou patient until God shall judge; and He is the best of judges.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Alif Lam Ra. A Book whose verses are set clear, and then distinguished, from One All-wise, All-aware:

Name: Hûd
Verse: ’Serve you none but God’ (I am to you a warner from Him and a bearer of good tidings)

Name: Hûd
Verse: and: ’Ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him, and He will give you fair enjoyment unto a term stated, and He will give of His bounty to every man of grace. But if you should turn your backs I fear for you the chastisement of a mighty day;

Name: Hûd
Verse: to God shall you return; He is powerful over everything.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: Behold, they fold their breasts, to hide them from Him; behold, when they wrap themselves in their garments He knows what they secrete and what they publish; surely He knows all the thoughts within the breasts.

Name: Hûd
Verse: No creature is there crawling on the earth, but its provision rests on God; He knows its lodging-place and its repository. All is in a Manifest Book.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And it is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and His Throne was upon the waters -- that He might try you, which one of you is fairer in works. And if thou sayest, ’you shall surely be raised up after death,’ the unbelievers will say, ’This is naught but a manifest sorcery.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And if We postpone the chastisement from them till a reckoned moment they will say ’What is detaining it?’ Surely, the day it shall come to them, it shall not be turned aside from them, and they shall be encompassed by that they mocked at.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And if We let a man taste mercy from Us, and then We wrest it from him, he is desperate, ungrateful.

Name: Hûd
Verse: But if We let him taste prosperity after hardship that has visited him, he will say, ’The evils have gone from me’; behold, he is joyous, boastful --

Name: Hûd
Verse: save such as are patient, and do deeds of righteousness; for them awaits forgiveness and a mighty wage.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Perchance thou art leaving part of what is revealed to thee, and thy breast is straitened by it, because they say, ’Why has a treasure not been sent down upon him, or an angel not come with him?’ Thou art only a warner; and God is a Guardian over everything.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Or do they say, ’He has forged it’? Say: ’Then bring you ten suras the like of it, forged; and call upon whom you are able, apart from God, if you speak truly.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: Then, if they do not answer you, know that it has been sent down with God’s knowledge, and that there is no god but He. So have you surrendered?

Name: Hûd
Verse: Whoso desires the present life and its adornment, We will pay them in full for their works therein, and they shall not be defrauded there;

Name: Hûd
Verse: those are they for whom in the world to come there is only the Fire; their deeds there will have failed, and void will be their works.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And what of him who stands upon a clear sign from his Lord, and a witness from Him recites it, and before him is the Book of Moses for an ensample and a mercy? Those believe in it; but whosoever disbelieves in it, being one of the partisans, his promised land is the Fire. So be thou not in doubt of it; it is the truth from thy Lord, but most men do not believe.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie? Those shall be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, ’Those are they who lied against their Lord.’ Surely the curse of God shall rest upon the evildoers

Name: Hûd
Verse: who bar from God’s way, desiring to make it crooked; they disbelieve in the world to come;

Name: Hûd
Verse: they are unable to frustrate Him on earth and they have no protectors, apart from God. For them the chastisement shall be doubled; they could not hear, neither did they see.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Those are they that have lost their souls, and that they forged has gone astray from them;

Name: Hûd
Verse: they without doubt will be the greatest losers in the world to come.

Name: Hûd
Verse: But those who believe, and do righteous deeds, and have humbled themselves unto their Lord -- they shall be the inhabitants of Paradise, therein dwelling forever.

Name: Hûd
Verse: The likeness of the two parties is as the man blind and deaf, and the man who sees and hears; are they equal in likeness? Will you not remember?

Name: Hûd
Verse: And We sent Noah to his people: ’I am for you a warner, and a bearer of good tidings:

Name: Hûd
Verse: Serve you none but God. I fear for you the chastisement of a painful day.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, ’We see thee not other than a mortal like ourselves, and we see no? any following thee but the vilest of us, inconsiderately. We do not see you have over us any superiority; no, rather we think you are liars.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, ’O my people, what think you? If I stand upon a clear sign from my Lord, and He has given me mercy from Him, and it has been obscured for you, shall we compel you to it while you are averse to it?

Name: Hûd
Verse: O my people, I do not ask of you wealth for this; my wage falls only upon God. I will not drive away those who believe; they shall surely meet their Lord. But I see you are an ignorant people.

Name: Hûd
Verse: O my people, who would help me against God, if I drive you away?

Name: Hûd
Verse: Will you not remember? I do not say to you, "I possess the treasuries of God"; I know not the Unseen; and I do not say, "I am an angel." Nor do I say to those your eyes despise, "God will not give them any good"; God knows best what is in their hearts. ’Surely in that case I should be among the evildoers.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, ’Noah, thou hast disputed with us and make much disputation with us. Then bring us that thou promisest us, if thou speakest truly.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, ’God will bring you it if He will; you cannot frustrate Him.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And my sincere counsel will not profit you, if I desire to counsel you sincerely, if God desires to pervert you; He is your Lord, and unto Him you shall be returned.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: (Or do they say, ’He has forged it’? Say: ’If I have forged it, upon me falls my sin; and I am quit of the sins you do.’)

Name: Hûd
Verse: And it was revealed to Noah, saying, ’None of thy people shall believe but he who has already believed; so be thou not distressed by that they may be doing.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Make thou the Ark under Our eyes, and as We reveal; and address Me not concerning those who have done evil; they shall be drowned.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: So he was making the Ark; and whenever a council of his people passed by him they scoffed at him, He said, ’If you scoff at us, we shall surely scoff at you, as you scoff

Name: Hûd
Verse: and you shall know to whom will come a chastisement degrading him, and upon whom there shall alight a lasting chastisement.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: Until, when Our command came, and the Oven boiled, We said, ’Embark in it two of every kind, and thy family -- except for him against whom the word has already been spoken and whosoever believes.’ And there believed not with him except a few.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, ’Embark in it! In God’s Name shall be its course and its berthing. Surely my Lord is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: So it ran with them amid waves like mountains; and Noah called to his son, who was standing apart, ’Embark with us, my son, and be thou not with the unbelievers!’

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, ’I will take refuge in a mountain, that shall defend me from the water.’ Said he, ’Today there is no defender from God’s command but for him on whom He has mercy.’ And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And it was said, ’Earth, swallow thy waters; and, heaven, abate!’ And the waters subsided, the affair was accomplished, and the Ark settled on El-Judi, and it was said: ’Away with the people of the evildoers!’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And Noah called unto his Lord, and said, ’O my Lord, my son is of my family, and Thy promise is surely the truth. Thou art the justest of those that judge.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: Said He, ’Noah, he is not of thy family; it is a deed not righteous. Do not ask of Me that whereof thou hast no knowledge. I admonish thee, lest thou shouldst be among the ignorant.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, ’My Lord, I take refuge with Thee, lest I should ask of Thee that whereof I have no knowledge; for if Thou forgivest me not, and hast not mercy on me, I shall be among the losers.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: It was said, ’Noah, get thee down in peace from Us, and blessings upon thee and on the nations of those with thee; and nations -- We shall give them enjoyment, then there shall visit them from Us a painful chastisement.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: (That is of the tiding’s of the Unseen, that We reveal to thee; thou didst not know it, neither thy people, before this. So be patient; the issue ultimate is to the godfearing.)

Name: Hûd
Verse: And to Ad their brother Hood; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He; you are but forgers.

Name: Hûd
Verse: O my people, I do not ask of you a wage for this; my wage falls only upon Him who did originate me; will you not understand?

Name: Hûd
Verse: And, O my people, ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him, and He will loose heaven in torrents upon you, and He will increase you in strength unto your strength; and turn not your backs as sinners.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, ’Hood, thou hast not brought us a clear sign, and we will not leave our gods for what thou sayest; we do not believe thee.

Name: Hûd
Verse: We say nothing, but that one of our gods has smitten thee with some evil.’ He said, ’I call God to witness; and witness you, that I am quit of that you associate

Name: Hûd
Verse: apart from Him; so try your guile on me, all together, then you shall give me no respite.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Truly, I have put my trust in God, my Lord and your Lord; there is no creature that crawls, but He takes it by the forelock. Surely my Lord is on a straight path.

Name: Hûd
Verse: But if you turn your backs, I have delivered to you that I was sent with unto you, and my Lord will make a people other than you successors; you will not hurt Him anything. My Lord is Guardian over everything.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And when Our command came, We delivered Hood and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, and delivered them from a harsh chastisement.

Name: Hûd
Verse: That was Ad; they denied the signs of their Lord, and rebelled against His Messengers, and followed the command of every froward tyrant.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And there was sent following after them in this world a curse, and upon the Day of Resurrection: ’Surely Ad disbelieved in their Lord: so away with Ad, the people of Hood!’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And to Thamood their brother Salih; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He. It is He who produced you from the earth and has given you to live therein; so ask forgiveness of Him, then repent to Him; surely my Lord is nigh, and answers prayer.

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, ’Salih, thou hast hitherto been a source of hope among us. What, dost thou forbid us to serve that our fathers served? Truly we are in doubt, concerning what thou callest us to, disquieting.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, ’O my people, what think you? If I stand upon a clear sign from my Lord, and He has given me mercy from Him, who shall help me against God if I rebel against Him? You would do nothing for me, except increase my loss.

Name: Hûd
Verse: O my people, this is the She-camel of God, to be a sign for you. Leave her that she may eat in God’s earth, and touch her not with evil, lest you’ be seized by a nigh chastisement.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: But they hamstrung her; and he said, ’Take your joy in your habitation three days -- that is a promise not to be belied.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And when Our command came, We delivered Salih and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, and from the degradation of that day; thy Lord is the All-strong, the All-mighty.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And the evildoers were seized by the Cry, and morning found them in their habitations fallen prostrate

Name: Hûd
Verse: as if they never dwelt there: ’Surely Thamood disbelieved in their Lord, so away with Thamood!’

Name: Hûd
Verse: Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings; they said, ’Peace!’ ’Peace,’ he said; and presently he brought a roasted calf.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And when he saw their hands not reaching towards it, he was suspicious of them and conceived a fear of them. They said, ’Fear not; we have been sent to the people of Lot.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And his wife was standing by; she laughed, therefore We gave her the glad tidings of Isaac, and, after Isaac, of Jacob.

Name: Hûd
Verse: She said, ’Woe is me! Shall I bear, being an old woman, and this my husband is an old man? This assuredly is a strange thing.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, ’What, dost thou marvel at God’s command? The mercy of God and His blessings be upon you, O people of the House! Surely He is All-laudable, All-glorious.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: So, when the awe departed from Abraham and the good tidings came to him, he was disputing with Us concerning the people of Lot;

Name: Hûd
Verse: Abraham was clement, compassionate, penitent.

Name: Hûd
Verse: ’O Abraham, turn away from this; thy Lord’s command has surely come, and there is coming upon them a chastisement not to be turned back.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was troubled on their account and distressed for them, and he said, ’This is a fierce day.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And his people came to him, running towards him; and erstwhile they had been doing evil deeds. He said, ’O my people, these are my daughters; they are cleaner for you. So fear God, and do not degrade me in my guests. What, is there not one man among you of a right mind?’

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, ’Thou knowest we have no right to thy daughters, and thou well knowest what we desire.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, ’O would that I had power against you, or might take refuge in a strong pillar!’

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, ’Lot, we are messengers of thy Lord. They shall not reach thee; so set forth, thou with thy family, in a watch of the night, and let not any one of you turn round, excepting thy wife; surely she shall be smitten by that which smites them. Their promised time is the morning; is the morning not nigh?’

Name: Hûd
Verse: So when Our command came, We turned it uppermost nethermost, and rained on it stones of baked clay, one on another,

Name: Hûd
Verse: marked with thy Lord, and never far from the evildoers.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And to Midian their brother Shuaib; he said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He. And diminish not the measure and the balance. I see you are prospering; and I fear for you the chastisement of an encompassing day.

Name: Hûd
Verse: O my people, fill up the measure and the balance justly, and do not diminish the goods of the people, and do not mischief in the land, working corruption.

Name: Hûd
Verse: God’s remainder is better for you, if you are believers. And I am not a guardian over you.

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, ’Shuaib, does thy prayer command thee that we should leave that our fathers served, or to do as we will with our goods? Thou art the clement one, the right-minded.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, ’O my people, what think you? If I stand upon a clear sign from my Lord, and He has provided me with fair provision from Him -- and I desire not to come behind you, betaking me to that I forbid you; I desire only to set things right, so far as I am able. My succour is only with God; in Him I have put my trust, and to Him I turn, penitent.

Name: Hûd
Verse: O my people, let not the breach with me move you, so that there smite you the like of what smote the people of Noah, or the people of Hood, or the people of Salih; and the people of Lot are not far away from you.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him; surely my Lord is All-compassionate, All-loving.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, ’Shuaib, we do not understand much of what thou sayest. Truly we see thee weak among us; but for thy tribe we would have stoned thee; for thou art not strong against us.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, ’O my people, is my tribe stronger against you than God? And Him -- have you taken Him as something to be thrust behind you? My Lord encompasses the things you do.

Name: Hûd
Verse: O my people, act according to your station; I am acting; and certainly you will know to whom will come the chastisement degrading him, and who is a liar. And be upon the watch; I shall be with you, watching.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And when Our command came, We delivered Shuaib and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, and the evildoers were seized by the Cry, and morning found them in their habitations fallen prostrate

Name: Hûd
Verse: as if they had never dwelt there: ’So away with Midian, even as Thamood was done away!’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And We sent Moses with Our signs, and a manifest authority,

Name: Hûd
Verse: to Pharaoh and his Council; but they followed Pharaoh’s command, and Pharaoh’s command was not right-minded.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He shall go before his people on the Day of Resurrection, and will have led them down to the Fire-evil the watering-place to be led down to!

Name: Hûd
Verse: And there was sent following after them in this world a curse, and upon the Day of Resurrection -- evil the offering to be offered!

Name: Hûd
Verse: That is of the tidings of the cities We relate to thee; some of them are standing and some stubble.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And We wronged them not, but they wronged themselves; their gods availed them not that they called upon, apart from God, anything, when the command of thy Lord came; and they increased them not, save in destruction.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Such is the seizing of thy Lord, when He seizes the cities that are evildoing; surely His seizing is painful, terrible.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Surely in that is a sign for him who fears the chastisement in the world to come; that is a day mankind are to be gathered to, a day to witness,

Name: Hûd
Verse: and We shall not postpone it, save to a term reckoned;

Name: Hûd
Verse: the day it comes, no soul shall speak save by His leave; some of them shall be wretched and some happy.

Name: Hûd
Verse: As for the wretched, they shall be in the Fire, wherein there shall be for them moaning and sighing, therein dwelling forever,

Name: Hûd
Verse: so long as the heavens and earth abide, save as thy Lord will; surely thy Lord accomplishes what He desires.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And as for the happy, they shall be in Paradise, therein dwelling forever, so long as the heavens and earth abide, save as thy Lord will -- for a gift unbroken.

Name: Hûd
Verse: So be thou not in doubt concerning what these men serve; they serve only as their fathers served before; and We shall surely pay them in full their portion undiminished.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And We gave Moses the Book; and there was difference regarding it, and but for a word that preceded from thy Lord, it had been decided between them; and they are in doubt of it disquieting.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Surely each one of them -- thy Lord will pay them in full for their works; He is aware of the things they do.

Name: Hûd
Verse: So go thou straight, as thou hast been commanded, and whoso repents with thee; and be you not insolent; surely He sees the things you do.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And lean not on the evildoers, so that the Fire touches you -- you have no protectors apart from God -- and then you will not be helped.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And perform the prayer at the two ends of the day and nigh of the night; surely the good deeds will drive away the evil deeds. That is a remembrance unto the mindful.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And be thou patient; God will not leave to waste the wage of the good-doers.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Or if there had been, of the generations before you, men of a remainder forbidding corruption in the earth -- except a few of those whom We delivered of them; but the evildoers followed the ease they were given to exult in and became sinners.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Yet thy Lord would never destroy the cities unjustly, while as yet their people were putting things right.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Had thy Lord willed, He would have made mankind one nation; but they continue in their differences

Name: Hûd
Verse: excepting those on whom thy Lord has mercy. To that end He created them, and perfectly is fulfilled the word of thy Lord: ’I shall assuredly fill Gehenna with jinn and men all together.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And all that We relate to thee of the tidings of the Messengers is that whereby We strengthen thy heart; in these there has come to thee the truth and an admonition, and a reminder to the believers.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And say to the unbelievers: ’Act you according to your station; we are acting.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And watch and wait; we are also watching and waiting.’

Name: Hûd
Verse: To God belongs the Unseen in the heavens and the earth. To Him the whole matter shall be returned; so serve Him, and put thy trust in Him. Thy Lord is not heedless of the things you do.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Alif Lam Ra. Those are the signs of the Manifest Book.

Name: Joseph
Verse: We have sent it down as an Arabic Koran; haply you will understand.

Name: Joseph
Verse: We will relate to thee the fairest of stories in that We have revealed to thee this Koran, though before it thou wast one of the heedless.

Name: Joseph
Verse: When Joseph said to his father, ’Father, I saw eleven stars, and the sun and the moon; I saw them bowing down before me.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ’O my son, relate not thy vision to thy brothers, lest they devise against thee some guile. Surely Satan is to man a manifest enemy.

Name: Joseph
Verse: So will thy Lord choose thee, and teach thee the interpretation of tales, and perfect His blessing upon thee and upon the House of Jacob, as He perfected it formerly on thy fathers Abraham and Isaac; surely thy Lord is All-knowing, All-wise.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: (In Joseph and his brethren were signs for those who ask questions.)

Name: Joseph
Verse: When they said, ’Surely Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we, though we are a band. Surely our father is in manifest error.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Kill you Joseph, or cast him forth into some land, that your father’s face may be free for you, and thereafter you may be a righteous people.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: One of them said, ’No, kill not Joseph, but cast him into the bottom of the pit and some traveller will pick him out, if you do aught.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ’Father, what ails thee, that thou trustest us not with Joseph? Surely we are his sincere well-wishers.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Send him forth with us tomorrow, to frolic and play; surely we shall be watching over him.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ’It grieves me that you should go with him, and I fear the wolf may eat him, while you are heedless of him.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ’If the wolf eats him, and we a band, then are we losers!’

Name: Joseph
Verse: So when they went with him, and agreed to put him in the bottom of the well, and We revealed to him, ’Thou shalt tell them of this their doing when they are unaware.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: And they came to their father in the evening, and they were weeping.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ’Father, we went running races, and left Joseph behind with our things; so the wolf ate him. But thou wouldst never believe us, though we spoke truly.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: And they brought his shirt with false blood on it. He said, ’No; but your spirits tempted you to do somewhat. But come, sweet patience! And God’s succour is ever there to seek against that you describe.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then came travellers, and they sent one of them, a water-drawer, who let down his bucket. ’Good news!’ he said. ’Here is a young man.’ So they hid him as merchandise; but God knew what they were doing.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then they sold him for a paltry price, a handful of counted dirhams; for they set small store by him.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He that bought him, being of Egypt, said to his wife, ’Give him goodly lodging, and it may be that he will profit us, or we may take him for our own son.’ So We established Joseph in the land, and that We might teach him the interpretation of tales. God prevails in His purpose, but most men know not.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And when he was fully grown, We gave him judgment and knowledge. Even so We recompense the good-doers.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Now the woman in whose house he was solicited him, and closed the doors on them. ’Come,’ she said, ’take me!’ ’God be my refuge,’ he said. ’Surely my lord has given me a goodly lodging. Surely the evildoers do not prosper.

Name: Joseph
Verse: For she desired him; and he would have taken her, but that he saw the proof of his Lord. So was it, that We might turn away from him evil and abomination; he was one of Our devoted servants.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They raced to the door; and she tore his shirt from behind. They encountered her master by the door. She said, ’What is the recompense of him who purposes evil against thy folk, but that he should be imprisoned, or a painful chastisement?’

Name: Joseph
Verse: Said he, ’It was she that solicited me’; and a witness of her folk bore witness, ’If his shirt has been torn from before then she has spoken truly, and he is one of the liars;

Name: Joseph
Verse: but if it be that his shirt has been torn from behind, then she has lied, and he is one of the truthful.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: When he saw his shirt was torn from behind he said, ’This is of your women’s guile; surely your guile is great.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Joseph, turn away from this; and thou, woman, ask forgiveness of thy crime; surely thou art one of the sinners.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: Certain women that were in the city said, ’The Governor’s wife has been soliciting her page; he smote her heart with love; we see her in manifest error.

Name: Joseph
Verse: When she heard their sly whispers, she sent to them, and made ready for them a repast, then she gave to each one of them a knife. ’Come forth, attend to them,’ she said. And when they saw him, they so admired him that they cut their hands, saying, ’God save us! This is no mortal; he is no other but a noble angel.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: ’So now you see, she said. ’This is he you blamed me for. Yes, I solicited him, but he abstained. Yet if he will not do what I command him, he shall be imprisoned, and be one of the humbled.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ’My Lord, prison is dearer to me than that they call me to; yet if Thou turnest not from me their guile, then I shall yearn towards them, and so become one of the ignorant.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: So his Lord answered him, and He turned away from him their guile; surely He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then it seemed good to them, after they had seen the signs, that they should imprison him for a while.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And there entered the prison with him two youths. Said one of them, ’I dreamed that I was pressing grapes. Said the other, ’I dreamed that I was carrying on my head bread, that birds were eating of. Tell us its interpretation; we see that thou art of the good-doers.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ’No food shall come to you for your sustenance, but ere it comes to you I shall tell you its interpretation. That I shall tell you is of what God has taught me. I have forsaken the creed of a people who believe not in God and who moreover are unbelievers in the world to come.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And I have followed the creed of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. Not ours is it to associate aught with God. That is of God’s bounty to us, and to men; but most men are not thankful.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Say, which is better, my fellow-prisoners -- many gods at variance, or God the One, the Omnipotent?

Name: Joseph
Verse: That which you serve, apart from Him, is nothing but names yourselves have named, you and your fathers; God has sent down no authority touching them. Judgment belongs only to God; He has commanded that you shall not serve any but Him. That is the right religion; but most men know not.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Fellow-prisoners, as for one of you, he shall pour wine for his lord; as for the other, he shall be crucified, and birds will eat of his head. The matter is decided whereon you enquire.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then he said to the one he deemed should be saved of the two, ’Mention me in thy lord’s presence.’ But Satan caused him to forget to mention him to his master, so that he continued in the prison for certain years.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And the king said, ’I saw in a dream seven fat kine, and seven lean ones devouring them; likewise seven green ears of corn, and seven withered. My counsellors, pronounce to me upon my dream, if you are expounders of dreams.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: ’A hotchpotch of nightmares!’ they said. ’We know nothing of the interpretation of nightmares.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then said the one who had been delivered, remembering after a time, ’I will myself tell you its interpretation; so send me forth.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: ’Joseph, thou true man, pronounce to us regarding seven fat kine, that seven lean ones were devouring, seven green ears of corn, and seven withered; haply I shall return to the men, haply they will know.’

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ’You shall sow seven years after your wont; what you have harvested leave in the ear, excepting a little whereof you eat.

Name: Joseph
