Verse: And We said to the Children of Israel after him, ’Dwell in the land; and when the promise of the world to come comes to pass, We shall bring you a rabble.’

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: With the truth We have sent it down, and with the truth it has come down; and We have sent thee not, except good tidings to bear, and warning;

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: and a Koran We have divided, for thee to recite it to mankind at intervals, and We have sent it down successively.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ’Believe in it, or believe not; those who were given the knowledge before it when it is recited to them, fall down upon their faces prostrating,

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: and say, "Glory be to our Lord! Our Lord’s promise is performed."

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And they fall down upon their faces weeping; and it increases them in humility.’

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ’Call upon God, or call upon the Merciful; whichsoever you call upon, to Him belong the Names Most Beautiful.’ And be thou not loud in thy prayer, nor hushed therein, but seek thou for a way between that.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And say: ’Praise belongs to God, who has not taken to Him a son, and who has not any associate in the Kingdom, nor any protector out of humbleness.’ And magnify Him with repeated magnificats.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Praise belongs to God who has sent down upon His servant the Book and has not assigned unto it any crookedness;

Name: The Cave
Verse: right, to warn of great violence from Him, and to give good tidings unto the believers, who do righteous deeds, that theirs shall be a goodly wage

Name: The Cave
Verse: therein to abide for ever,

Name: The Cave
Verse: and to warn those who say, ’God has taken to Himself a son’;

Name: The Cave
Verse: they have no knowledge of it, they nor their fathers; a monstrous word it is, issuing out of their mouths; they say nothing but a lie.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Yet perchance, if they believe not in this tiding, thou wilt consume thyself, following after them, of grief.

Name: The Cave
Verse: We have appointed all that is on the earth for an adornment for it, and that We may try which of them is fairest in works;

Name: The Cave
Verse: and We shall surely make all that is on it barren dust.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Or dost thou think the Men of the Cave and Er-Rakeem were among Our signs a wonder?

Name: The Cave
Verse: When the youths took refuge in the Cave saying, ’Our lord, give us mercy from Thee, and furnish us with rectitude in our affair.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then We smote their ears many years in the Cave.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Afterwards. We raised them up again, that We might know which of the two parties would better calculate the while they had tarried.

Name: The Cave
Verse: We will relate to thee their tidings truly. They were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And We strengthened their hearts, when they stood up and said, ’Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and earth; we will not call upon any god, apart from Him, or then we had spoken outrage.

Name: The Cave
Verse: These our people have taken to them other gods, apart from Him. Ah, if only they would bring some clear authority regarding them! But who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie?

Name: The Cave
Verse: So, when you have gone apart from them and that they serve, excepting God, take refuge in the Cave, and your Lord will unfold to you of His mercy, and will furnish -- you with a gentle issue of your affair.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: And thou mightest have seen the sun, when it rose, inclining from their Cave towards the right, and, when it set, passing them by on the left, while they were in a broad fissure of the Cave. That was one of God’s signs; whomsoever God guides, he is rightly guided, and whomsoever He leads astray, thou wilt not find for him a protector to direct.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Thou wouldst have thought them awake, as they lay sleeping, while We turned them now to the right, now to the left,’ and their dog ’stretching its paws on the threshold. Hadst thou observed them surely thou wouldst have .turned thy back on them in flight, and been filled with terror of them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And even so We raised them up again that they might question one another. One of them said, ’How long have you tarried?’ They said, ’We have tarried a day, or part of a day.’ They said, ’Your Lord knows very well how long you have tarried. Now send one of you forth with this silver to the city, and let him look for which of them has purest food, and bring you provision thereof; let him be courteous, and apprise no man of you.

Name: The Cave
Verse: If they should get knowledge of you they will stone you, or restore you to their creed, then you will not prosper ever.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And even so We made them stumble upon them, that they might know that God’s promise is true, and that the Hour -- there is no doubt of it. When they were contending among themselves of their affair then they said, ’Build over them a building; their Lord knows of them very well.’ Said those who prevailed over their affair, ’We will raise over them a place of worship.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: (They will say, ’Three; and ’their dog was the fourth of them.’ They will say, ’Five; and their dog was the sixth of them, guessing at the Unseen. They will say, ’Seven; and their dog was the eighth of them.’ Say: ’My Lord knows very well their number, and none knows them, except a few.’ So do not dispute with them, except in outward disputation, and ask not any of them for a pronouncement on them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And do not say, regarding anything, ’I am going to do that tomorrow,’

Name: The Cave
Verse: but only, ’If God will’; and mention thy Lord, when thou forgettest, and say, ’It may be that my Lord will guide me unto something nearer to rectitude than this.’)

Name: The Cave
Verse: And they tarried in the Cave three hundred years, and to that they added nine more.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say: ’God knows very well how long they tarried. To Him belongs the Unseen in the heavens and in the earth. How well He sees! How well He hears! They have no protector, apart from Him, and He associates in His government no one.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Recite what has been revealed to thee of the Book of thy Lord; no man can change His words. Apart from Him, thou wilt find no refuge.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And restrain thyself with those who call upon their Lord at morning and evening, desiring His countenance, and let not thine eyes turn away from them, desiring the adornment of the present life; and obey not him whose heart We have made neglectful of Our remembrance so that he follows his own lust, and his affair has become all excess.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say: ’The truth is from your Lord; so let whosoever will believe, and let whosoever will disbelieve.’ Surely We have prepared for the evildoers a fire, whose pavilion encompasses them; if they call for succour, they will be succoured with water like molten copper, that shall scald their faces -- how evil a potion, and how evil a resting-place!

Name: The Cave
Verse: Surely those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- surely We leave not to waste the wage of him who does good works;

Name: The Cave
Verse: those -- theirs shall be Gardens of Eden, underneath which rivers flow; therein they shall be adorned with bracelets of gold, and they shall be robed in green garments of silk and brocade, therein reclining upon couches -- O, how excellent a reward! And O, how fair a resting-place!

Name: The Cave
Verse: And strike for them a similitude: two men. To one of them We assigned two gardens of vines, and surrounded them with palm-trees, and between them We set a sown field;

Name: The Cave
Verse: each of the two gardens yielded its produce and failed naught in any wise; and We caused to gush amidst them a river.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So he had fruit; and he said to his fellow, as he was conversing with him, ’I have more abundance of wealth than thou and am mightier in respect of men.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And he entered his garden, wronging himself; he said, ’I do not think that this will ever perish;

Name: The Cave
Verse: I do not think that the Hour is coming; and if I am indeed returned to my Lord, I shall surely find a better resort than this.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said his fellow, as he was conversing with him, ’What, disbelievest thou in Him who created thee of dust, then of a sperm-drop, then shaped thee as a man?

Name: The Cave
Verse: But lo, He is God, my Lord, and I will not associate with my Lord any one.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Why, when thou wentest into thy garden, didst thou not say, "As God will; there is no power except in God"? If thou seest me, that I am less than thou in wealth and children,

Name: The Cave
Verse: yet it may be that my Lord will give me better than thy garden, and loose on it a thunderbolt out of heaven, so that in the morning it will be a slope of dust,

Name: The Cave
Verse: or in the morning the water of it will be sunk into the earth, so that thou wilt not be able to seek it out.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: And his fruit was all encompassed, and in the morning he was wringing his hands for that he had expended upon it, and it was fallen down upon its trellises, and he was saying, ’Would I had not associated with my Lord any one!’

Name: The Cave
Verse: But there was no host to help him, apart from God, and he was helpless.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Thereover protection belongs only to God the True; He is best rewarding, best in the issue.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And strike for them the similitude of the present life: it is as water that We send down out of heaven, and the plants of the earth mingle with it; and in the morning it is straw the winds scatter; and God is omnipotent over everything.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Wealth and sons are the adornment of the present world; but the abiding things, the deeds of righteousness, are better with God in reward, and better in hope.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And on the day We shall set the mountains in motion, and thou seest the earth coming forth, and We muster them so that We leave not so much as one of them behind;

Name: The Cave
Verse: and they shall be presented before their Lord in ranks -- ’You have come to Us, as We created you upon the first time; nay, you asserted We should not appoint for you a tryst.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: And the Book shall be set in place; and thou wilt see the sinners fearful at what is in it, and saying, ’Alas for us! How is it with this Book, that it leaves nothing behind, small or great, but it has numbered it?’ And they shall find all they wrought present, and thy Lord shall not wrong anyone.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And when We said to the angels, ’Bow yourselves to Adam’; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis; he was one of the jinn, and committed ungodliness against his Lord’s command. What, and do you take him and his seed to be your friends, apart from Me, and they an enemy to you? How evil is that exchange for the evildoers!

Name: The Cave
Verse: I made them not witnesses of the creation of the heavens and earth, neither of the creation of themselves; I would not ever take those who lead others astray to be My supporters.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And on the day He shall say, ’Call on My associates whom you asserted’; and then they shall call on them, but they will not answer them, and We shall set a gulf between them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then the evildoers will see the Fire, and think that they are about to fall into it, and will find no escape from it.

Name: The Cave
Verse: We have indeed turned about for men in this Koran every manner of similitude; man is the most disputatious of things.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And naught prevented men from believing when the guidance came unto them, and seeking their Lord’s forgiveness, but that the wont of the ancients should come upon them, or that the chastisement should come upon them face to face.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And We send not the Envoys, but good tidings to bear, and warning. Yet do the unbelievers dispute with falsehood, that they may rebut thereby the truth. They have taken My signs, and what they are warned of, in mockery.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And who does greater evil than he who, being reminded of the signs of his Lord, turns away from them and forgets what his hands have forwarded? Surely We have laid veils on their hearts lest they understand it, and in their ears heaviness; and though thou callest them to the guidance, yet they will not be guided ever.

Name: The Cave
Verse: But thy Lord is the All-forgiving, full of mercy. If He should take them to task for that they have earned, He would hasten for them the chastisement; but they have a tryst, from which they will find no escape.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And those cities, We destroyed them when they did evil, and appointed for their destruction a tryst.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And when Moses said to his page, ’I will not give up until I reach the meeting of the two seas, though I go on for many years.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then, when they reached their meeting, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the sea, burrowing.

Name: The Cave
Verse: When they had passed over, he said to his page, ’Bring us our breakfast; indeed, we have encountered weariness from this our journey.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, ’What thinkest thou? When we took refuge in the rock, then I forgot the fish-and it was Satan himself that made me forget it so that I should not remember it -- and so it took its way into the sea in a manner marvellous.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said he, ’This is what we were seeking!’ And so they returned upon their tracks, retracing them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then they found one of Our servants unto whom We had given mercy from Us, and We had taught him knowledge proceeding from Us.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Moses said to him, ’Shall I follow thee so that thou teachest me, of what thou hast been taught, right judgment.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said he, ’Assuredly thou wilt not be able to bear with me patiently.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And how shouldst thou bear patiently that thou hast never encompassed in thy knowledge?’

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, ’Yet thou shalt find me, if God will, patient; and I shall not rebel against thee in anything.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said he, ’Then if thou followest me, question me not on anything until I myself introduce the mention of it to thee.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: So they departed; until, when they embarked upon the ship, he made a hole in it. He said, ’What, hast thou made a hole in it so as to drown its passengers? Thou hast indeed done a grievous thing.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said he, ’Did I not say that thou couldst never bear with me patiently?’

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, ’Do not take me to task that I forgot, neither constrain me to do a thing too difficult.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: So they departed; until, when they met a lad, he slew him. He said, ’What, hast thou slain a soul innocent, and that not to retaliate for a soul slain? Thou hast indeed done a horrible thing.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said he, ’Did I not say that thou couldst never bear with me patiently?’

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, ’If I question thee on anything after this, then keep me company no more; thou hast already experienced excuse sufficient on my part.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: So they departed; until, when they reached the people of a city, they asked the people for food, but they refused to receive them hospitably. There they found a wall about to tumble down, and so he set it up. He said, ’If thou hadst wished, thou couldst have taken a wage for that.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said he, ’This is the parting between me and thee. Now I will tell thee the interpretation of that thou couldst not bear patiently.

Name: The Cave
Verse: As for the ship, it belonged to certain poor men, who toiled upon the sea; and I desired to damage it, for behind them there was a king who was seizing every ship by brutal force.

Name: The Cave
Verse: As for the lad, his parents were believers; and we were afraid he would impose on them insolence and unbelief;

Name: The Cave
Verse: so we desired that their Lord should give to them in exchange one better than he in purity, and nearer in tenderness.

Name: The Cave
Verse: As for the wall, it belonged to two orphan lads in the city, and under it was a treasure belonging to them. Their father was a righteous man; and thy Lord desired that they should come of age and then bring forth their treasure as a mercy from thy Lord. I did it not of my own bidding. This is the interpretation of that thou couldst not bear patiently.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: They will question thee concerning Dhool Karnain. Say: ’I will recite to you a mention of him.

Name: The Cave
Verse: We established him in the land, and We gave him a way to everything;

Name: The Cave
Verse: and he followed a way

Name: The Cave
Verse: until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it setting in a muddy spring, and he found nearby a people. We said, ’O Dhool Karnain, either thou shalt chastise them, or thou shalt take towards them a way of kindness.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, ’As for the evildoer, him we shall chastise, then he shall be returned to his Lord and He shall chastise him with a horrible chastisement.

Name: The Cave
Verse: But as for him who believes, and does righteousness, he shall receive as recompense the reward most fair, and we shall speak to him, of our command, easiness.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then he followed a way

Name: The Cave
Verse: until, when he reached the rising of the sun, he found it rising upon a people for whom We had not appointed any veil to shade them from it.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So; and We encompassed in knowledge what was with him.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then he followed a way

Name: The Cave
Verse: until, when he reached between the two barriers, he found this side of them a people scarcely able to understand speech.

Name: The Cave
Verse: They said, ’O Dhool Karnain, behold, Gog and Magog are doing corruption in the earth; so shall we assign to thee a tribute, against thy setting up a barrier between us and between them?’

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, ’That wherein my Lord has established me is better; so aid me forcefully, and I will set up a rampart between you and between them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Bring me ingots of iron!’ Until, when he had made all level between the two cliffs, he said, ’Blow!’ Until, when he had made it a fire, he said, ’Bring me, that I may pour molten brass on it.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: So they were unable either to scale it or pierce it.

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, ’This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will make it into powder; and my Lord’s promise is ever true.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Upon that day We shall leave them surging on one another, and the Trumpet shall he blown, and We shall gather them together,

Name: The Cave
Verse: and upon that day We shall present Gehenna to the unbelievers

Name: The Cave
Verse: whose eyes were covered against My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.

Name: The Cave
Verse: What, do the unbelievers reckon that they may take My servants as friends, apart from Me? We have prepared Gehenna for the unbelievers’ hospitality.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say: ’Shall We tell you who will be the greatest losers in their works?

Name: The Cave
Verse: Those whose striving goes astray in the present life, while they think that they are working good deeds.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Those are they that disbelieve in the signs of their Lord and the encounter with Him; their works have failed, and on the Day of Resurrection We shall not assign to them any weight.

Name: The Cave
Verse: That is their recompense -- Gehenna for that they were unbelievers and took My signs and My messengers in mockery.

Name: The Cave
Verse: But those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- the Gardens. of Paradise shall be their hospitality,

Name: The Cave
Verse: therein to dwell forever, desiring no removal out of them.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say:. ’If the sea were ink for the Words of my Lord, the sea would be spent before the Words of my Lord are spent, though We brought replenishment the like of it.’

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say: ’I am only a mortal the like of you; it is revealed to me that your God is One God. So let him, who hopes for the encounter with his Lord, work righteousness, and not associate with his Lord’s service anyone.

Name: Mary
Verse: Kaf Ha Ya Ain Sad

Name: Mary
Verse: The mention of thy Lord’s mercy unto His servant Zachariah;

Name: Mary
Verse: when he called upon his Lord secretly

Name: Mary
Verse: saying, ’O my Lord, behold the bones within me are feeble and my head is all aflame with hoariness. And in calling on Thee, my Lord, I have never been hitherto unprosperous.

Name: Mary
Verse: And now I fear my kinsfolk after I am gone; and my wife is barren. So give me, from Thee, a kinsman

Name: Mary
Verse: who shall be my inheritor and the inheritor of the House of Jacob; and make him, my Lord, well-pleasing.’

Name: Mary
Verse: ’O Zachariah, We give thee good tidings of a boy, whose name is John. No namesake have We given him aforetime.’

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, ’O my Lord, how shall I have a son, seeing my wife is barren, and I have attained to the declining of old age?’

Name: Mary
Verse: Said He, ’So it shall be; thy Lord says, "Easy is that for Me, seeing that I created thee aforetime, when thou wast nothing."’

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, ’Lord, appoint to me some sign.’ Said He, ’Thy sign is that thou shall not speak to men, though being without fault, three nights.’

Name: Mary
Verse: So he came forth unto his people from the Sanctuary, then he made signal to them, ’Give you glory at dawn and evening.’

Name: Mary
Verse: ’O John, take the Book forcefully’; and We gave him judgment, yet a little child,

Name: Mary
Verse: and a tenderness from Us, and purity; and he was godfearing,

Name: Mary
Verse: and cherishing his parents, not arrogant, rebellious.

Name: Mary
Verse: ’Peace be upon him, the day he was born, and the day he dies, and the day he is raised up alive!’

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book Mary when she withdrew from her people to an eastern place,

Name: Mary
Verse: and she took a veil apart from them; then We sent unto her Our Spirit that presented himself to her a man without fault.

Name: Mary
Verse: She said, ’I take refuge in the All-merciful from thee!

Name: Mary
Verse: If thou fearest God ... He said, ’I am but a messenger come from thy Lord, to give thee a boy most pure.

Name: Mary
Verse: She said, ’How shall I have a son whom no mortal has touched, neither have I been unchaste?’

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, ’Even so thy Lord has said: "Easy is that for Me; and that We may appoint him a sign unto men and a mercy from Us; it is a thing decreed."’

Name: Mary
Verse: So she conceived him, and withdrew with him to a distant place.

Name: Mary
Verse: And the birthpangs surprised her by the trunk of the palm-tree. She said, ’Would I had died ere this, and become a thing forgotten!’

Name: Mary
Verse: But the one that was below her called to her, ’Nay, do not sorrow; see, thy Lord has set below thee a rivulet.

Name: Mary
Verse: Shake also to thee the palm-trunk, and there shall come tumbling upon thee dates fresh and ripe.

Name: Mary
Verse: Eat therefore, and drink, and be comforted; and if thou shouldst see any mortal, say, "I have vowed to the All-merciful a fast, and today I will not speak to any man.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then she brought the child to her folk carrying him; and they said, ’Mary, thou hast surely committed a monstrous thing!

Name: Mary
Verse: Sister of Aaron, thy father was not a wicked man, nor was thy mother a woman unchaste.’

Name: Mary
Verse: Mary pointed to the child then; but they said, ’How shall we speak to one who is still in the cradle, a little child?’

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, ’Lo, I am God’s servant; God has given me the Book, and made me a Prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: Blessed He has made me, wherever I may be; and He has enjoined me to pray, and to give the alms, so long as I live,

Name: Mary
Verse: and likewise to cherish my mother; He has not made me arrogant, unprosperous.

Name: Mary
Verse: Peace be upon me, the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I am raised up alive!’

Name: Mary
Verse: That is Jesus, son of Mary, in word of truth, concerning which they are doubting.

Name: Mary
Verse: It is not for God to take a son unto Him. Glory be to Him! When He decrees a thing, He but says to it ’Be,’ and it is.

Name: Mary
Verse: Surely God is my Lord, and your Lord; So serve you Him. This is a straight path.

Name: Mary
Verse: But the parties have fallen into variance among themselves; then woe to those who disbelieve for the scene of a dreadful day.

Name: Mary
Verse: How well they will hear and see on the day they come to Us! But the evildoers even today are in error manifest.

Name: Mary
Verse: Warn thou them of the day of anguish, when the matter shall be determined, and they yet heedless and unbelieving.

Name: Mary
Verse: Surely We shall inherit the earth and all that are upon it, and unto Us they shall be returned.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book Abraham; surely he was a true man, a Prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: When he said to his father, ’Father, why worshippest thou that which neither hears nor sees, nor avails thee anything?

Name: Mary
Verse: Father, there has come to me knowledge such as came not to thee; so follow me, and I will guide thee on a level path.

Name: Mary
Verse: Father, serve not Satan; surely Satan is a rebel against the All-merciful.

Name: Mary
Verse: Father, I fear that some chastisement from the All-merciful will smite thee, so that thou becomest a friend to Satan.

Name: Mary
Verse: Said he, ’What, art thou shrinking from my gods, Abraham? Surely, if thou givest not over, I shall stone thee; so forsake me now for some while.’

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, ’Peace be upon thee! I will ask my Lord to forgive thee; surely He is ever gracious to me.

Name: Mary
Verse: Now I will go apart from you and that you call upon, apart from God; I will call upon my Lord, and haply I shall not be, in calling upon my Lord, unprosperous.

Name: Mary
Verse: So, when he went apart from them and that they were serving, apart from God, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each We made a Prophet;

Name: Mary
Verse: and We gave them of Our mercy, and We appointed unto them a tongue of truthfulness, sublime.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book Moses; he was devoted, and he was a Messenger, a Prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: We called to him from the right side Of the Mount, and We brought him near in communion.

Name: Mary
Verse: And We gave him his brother Aaron, of Our mercy, a Prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book Ishmael; he was true to his promise, and he was a Messenger, a Prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: He bade his people to pray and to give the alms, and he was pleasing to his Lord.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book Idris; he was a true man, a Prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: We raised him up to a high place.

Name: Mary
Verse: These are they whom God has blessed among the Prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those We bore with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and chose. When the signs of the All-merciful were recited to them, they fell down prostrate, weeping.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then there succeeded after them a succession who wasted the prayer, and followed lusts; so they shall encounter error

Name: Mary
Verse: save him who repents, and believes, and does a righteous deed; those -- they shall enter Paradise, and they shall not be wronged anything;

Name: Mary
Verse: Gardens of Eden that the All-merciful promised His servants in the Unseen; His promise is ever performed.

Name: Mary
Verse: There they shall hear no idle talk, but only ’Peace.’ There they shall have their provision at dawn and evening.

Name: Mary
Verse: That is Paradise which We shall give as an inheritance to those of Our servants who are godfearing.

Name: Mary
Verse: We come not down, save at the commandment of thy Lord. To Him belongs all that is before us, and all that is behind us, and all between that.

Name: Mary
Verse: And thy Lord is never forgetful, Lord He of the heavens and earth and all that is between them. So serve Him, and be thou patient in His service; knowest thou any that can be named with His Name?

Name: Mary
Verse: Man says, ’What, when I am dead shall I then be brought forth alive?’

Name: Mary
Verse: Will not man remember that We created him aforetime, when he was nothing?

Name: Mary
Verse: Now, by thy Lord, We shall surely muster them, and the Satans, then We shall parade them about Gehenna hobbling on their knees.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then We shall pluck forth from every party whichever of them was the most hardened in disdain of the All-merciful;

Name: Mary
Verse: then We shall know very well those most deserving to burn there.

Name: Mary
Verse: Not one of you there is, but he shall go down to it; that for thy Lord is a thing decreed, determined.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then We shall deliver those that were godfearing; and the evildoers We shall leave there, hobbling on their knees.

Name: Mary
Verse: When Our signs are recited to them as clear signs, the unbelievers say to the believers, ’Which of the two parties is better in station, fairer in assembly?’

Name: Mary
Verse: And how many a generation We destroyed before them, who were fairer in furnishing and outward show!

Name: Mary
Verse: Say: ’Whosoever is in error, let the All-merciful prolong his term for him! Till, when they see that they were threatened, whether the chastisement, or the Hour, then they shall surely know who is worse in place, and who is weaker in hosts.’

Name: Mary
Verse: And God shall increase those who were guided in guidance; and the abiding things, the deeds of righteousness, are better with thy Lord in reward, and better in return

Name: Mary
Verse: Hast thou seen him who disbelieves in Our signs and says, ’Assuredly I shall be given wealth and children’?

Name: Mary
Verse: What, has he observed the Unseen, or taken a covenant with the All-merciful?

Name: Mary
Verse: No, indeed! We shall assuredly write down all that he says, and We shall prolong for him the chastisement;

Name: Mary
Verse: and We shall inherit from him that he says, and he shall come to Us alone.

Name: Mary
Verse: And they have taken to them other gods apart from God, that they might be for them a might.

Name: Mary
Verse: No, indeed! They shall deny their service, and they shall be against them pitted.

Name: Mary
Verse: Hast thou not seen how We sent the Satans against the unbelievers, to prick them?

Name: Mary
Verse: So hasten thou not against them; We are only numbering for them a number.

Name: Mary
Verse: On the day that We shall muster the godfearing to the All-merciful with pomp

Name: Mary
Verse: and drive the evildoers into Gehenna herding,

Name: Mary
Verse: having no power of intercession, save those who have taken with the All-merciful covenant.

Name: Mary
Verse: And they say, ’The All-merciful has taken unto Himself a son.

Name: Mary
Verse: You have indeed advanced something hideous!

Name: Mary
Verse: The heavens are wellnigh rent of it and the earth split asunder, and the mountains wellnigh fall down crashing for

Name: Mary
Verse: that they have attributed to the All-merciful a son;

Name: Mary
Verse: and it behoves not the All-merciful to take a son.

Name: Mary
Verse: None is there in the heavens and earth but he comes to the All-merciful as a servant;

Name: Mary
Verse: He has indeed counted them, and He has numbered them exactly.

Name: Mary
Verse: Every one of them shall come to Him upon the Day of Resurrection, all alone.

Name: Mary
Verse: Surely those who believe and do deeds of righteousness -- unto them the All-merciful shall assign love.

Name: Mary
Verse: Now We have made it easy by thy tongue that thou mayest bear good tidings thereby to the godfearing, and warn a people stubborn.

Name: Mary
Verse: And how many a generation We destroyed before them! Dost thou perceive so much as one of them, or hear of them a whisper?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Ta Ha

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: We have not sent down the Koran upon thee for thee to be unprosperous,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: but only as a reminder to him who tears,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: a revelation from Him who created the earth and the high heavens;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: the All-compassionate sat Himself upon the Throne; to Him belongs

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: all that is in the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and all that is underneath the soil.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Be thou loud in thy speech, yet surely He knows the secret and that yet more hidden.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: God -- there is no god but He. To Him belong the Names Most Beautiful.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Hast thou received the story of Moses?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: When he saw a tire, and said to his family, ’Tarry you here; I observe a fire. Perhaps I shall bring you a brand from it, or I shall find at the fire guidance.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: When he came to it, a voice cried, ’Moses,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: I am thy Lord; put off thy shoes; thou art in the holy valley, Towa.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: I Myself have chosen thee; therefore give thou ear to this revelation.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Verily I am God; there is no god but I; therefore serve Me, and perform the prayer of My remembrance.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: The Hour is coming; I would conceal it that every soul may be recompensed for its labours.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Let none bar thee from it, that believes not in it but follows after his own caprice, or thou wilt perish.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: What is that, Moses, thou hast in thy right hand?’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’Why, it is my staff,’ said Moses. ’I lean upon it, and with it I beat down leaves to feed my sheep; other uses also I find in it.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Said He, ’Cast it down, Moses!’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: and he cast it down, and behold it was a serpent sliding.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Said He, ’Take it, and fear not; We will restore it to its first state.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Now clasp thy hand to thy arm-pit; it shall come forth white, without evil. That is a second sign.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So We would show thee some of Our greatest signs.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Go to Pharaoh; he has waxed insolent.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’Lord, open my breast,’ said Moses,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’and do Thou ease for me my task.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Unloose the knot upon my tongue, t

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: hat they may understand my words.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Appoint for me of my folk a familiar,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Aaron, my brother;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: by him confirm my strength,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: and associate him with me in my task.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So shall we glorify Thee,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: and remember Thee abundantly.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Surely Thou seest into us.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Said He, ’Thou art granted, Moses, thy petition.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Already another time We favoured thee,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: when We revealed what was revealed unto thy mother:

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: "Cast him into the ark, and cast him into the river, and let the river throw him up on the shore. An enemy of Mine and his shall take him." And I loaded on thee love from Me, and to be formed in My sight,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: when thy sister went out, saying, "Shall I point you to one to have charge of him?" So We returned thee to thy mother that she might rejoice, and not sorrow. Then thou slewest; a living soul, and We delivered thee out of grief, and We tried thee with many trials. Many years among the people of Midian thou didst sojourn, then camest hither, Moses, according to a decree.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: I have chosen thee for My service;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: go therefore, thou and thy brother; with My signs, and neglect not to remember Me.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Go to Pharaoh, for he has waxed insolent;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: yet speak gently to him, that haply he may be mindful, or perchance fear.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’O our Lord,’ said Moses and Aaron, ’truly we fear he may exceed against us, or wax insolent.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’Fear not,’ said He. ’Surely I shall be with you, hearing and seeing.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So go you both to Pharaoh, and say, "We are the Messengers of thy Lord, so send forth with us the Children of Israel and chastise them not; we have brought thee a sign from thy Lord; and peace be upon him who follows the guidance!

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: It has been revealed to us that chastisement shall light upon him who cries lies and turns his back."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Pharaoh said, ’Who is your Lord, Moses?’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, ’Our Lord is He who gave everything its creation, then guided it.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Pharaoh said, ’And what of the former generations?’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Said Moses, ’The knowledge of them is with my Lord, in a Book; my Lord goes not astray, nor forgets --

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He who appointed the earth to be a cradle for you, and therein threaded roads for you, and sent down water out of heaven, and therewith We have brought forth divers kinds of plants.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Do you eat, and pasture your cattle! Surely in that are signs for men possessing reason.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Out of the earth We created you, and We shall restore you into it, and bring you forth from it a second time.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So We showed Pharaoh all Our signs, but he cried lies, and refused.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’Hast thou come, Moses,’ he said, ’to expel us out of our land

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: by thy sorcery? We shall assuredly bring thee sorcery the like of it; therefore appoint a tryst between us and thee, a place mutually agreeable, and we shall not fail it, neither thou.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’Your tryst shall be upon the Feast Day.’ said Moses. ’Let the people be mustered at the high noon.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Pharaoh then withdrew, and gathered his guile. Thereafter he came again,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: and Moses said to them, ’O beware! Forge not a lie against God, lest He destroy you with a chastisement. Whoso forges has ever failed.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And they disputed upon their plan between them, and communed secretly

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: saying, ’These two men are sorcerers and their purpose is to expel you out of your land by their sorcery, and to extirpate your justest way.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So gather your guile; then come in battle-line. Whoever today gains the upper hand shall surely prosper.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, ’Moses, either thou wilt cast, or we shall be the first to cast.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’No,’ said Moses. ’Do you cast!’ And lo, it seemed to him, by their sorcery, their ropes and their staffs were sliding;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: and Moses conceived a fear within him.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: We said unto him, ’Fear not; surely thou art the uppermost.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Cast down what is in thy right hand, and it shall swallow what they have fashioned; for they have fashioned only the guile of a sorcerer, and the sorcerer prospers not; wherever he goes.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And the sorcerers cast themselves down prostrating. ’We believe,’ they said, ’in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Pharaoh said, ’Have you believed him before I gave you leave? Why, he is the chief of you, the same that taught you sorcery; I shall assuredly cut off alternately your hands and feet, then I shall crucify you upon the trunks of palm-trees; you shall know of a certainty which of us is more terrible in chastisement, and more abiding.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, ’We will not prefer thee over the clear signs that have come to us, nor over Him who originated us. Decide then what thou wilt decide; thou canst only decide touching this present life.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: We believe in our Lord, that He may pardon us our offences, and the sorcery thou hast constrained us to practise; God is better, and more abiding.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Whosoever comes unto his Lord a sinner, for him awaits Gehenna wherein he shall neither die nor live.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And whoso comes unto Him a believer having done deeds of righteousness, those -- for them await the most sublime degrees;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Gardens of Eden, underneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever; that is the recompense of the self-purified.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Also We revealed unto Moses, ’Go with My servants by night; strike for them a dry path in the sea, fearing not overtaking, neither afraid.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Pharaoh followed them with his hosts, but they were overwhelmed by the sea;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: so Pharaoh had led his people astray, and was no guide to them.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy; and We made covenant with you upon the right side of the Mount, and sent down on you manna and quails:

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’Eat of the good things wherewith We have provided you; but exceed not therein, or My anger shall alight on you; and on whomsoever My anger alights, that man is hurled to ruin.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Yet I am All-forgiving to him who repents and believes, and does righteousness, and at last is guided.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’What has sped thee far from thy people, Moses?’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’They are upon my tracks,’ Moses said. ’I have hastened, Lord, only that I may please Thee.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Said He, ’We have tempted thy people since thou didst leave them. The Samaritan has misled them into error.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Then Moses returned very angry and sorrowful to his people, saying, ’My people, did your Lord not promise a fair promise to you? Did the time of the covenant seem so long to you, or did you desire that anger should alight on you from your Lord, so that you failed in your tryst with me?’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’We have not failed in our tryst with thee,’ they said, ’of our volition; but we were loaded with fardels, even the ornaments of the people, and we cast them, as the Samaritan also threw them, into the fire.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: (Then he brought out for them a Calf, a mere body that lowed; and they said, ’This is your god, and the god of Moses, whom he has forgotten.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: What? Did they not see that thing returned no speech unto them, neither had any power to hurt or profit them?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Yet Aaron had aforetime said to them, ’My people, you have been tempted by this thing, no more; surety your Lord is the All-merciful; therefore follow me, and obey my commandment!’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’We will not cease,’ they said, ’to cleave to it, until Moses returns to us.’)

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Moses said, ’What prevented thee, Aaron, when thou sawest them in error,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: so that thou didst not follow after me? Didst thou then disobey my commandment?’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’Son of my mother,’ Aaron said, ’take me not by the beard, or the head! I was fearful that thou wouldst say, "Thou hast divided the Children of Israel, and thou hast not observed my word."

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Moses said, ’And thou, Samaritan, what was thy business?’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’I beheld what they beheld not,’ he said, ’and I seized a handful of dust from the messenger’s track, and cast it into the thing. So my soul prompted me.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: ’Depart!’ said Moses. ’It shall be thine all this life to cry "Untouchable!" And thereafter a tryst awaits thee thou canst not fail to keep Behold thy god, to whom all the day thou wast cleaving! We will surely burn it and scatter its ashes into the sea.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Your God is only the One God; there is no god, but He alone who in His knowledge embraces everything.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So We relate to thee stories of what has gone before, and We have given thee a remembrance from Us.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Whosoever turns away from it, upon the Day of Resurrection He shall bear a fardel,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: therein abiding forever; how evil upon the Day of Resurrection that burden for them!

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: On the day the Trumpet is blown; and We shall muster the sinners upon that day with eyes staring,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: whispering one to another, ’You have tarried only ten nights.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: We know very well what they will say, when the justest of them in the way will say, ’You have tarried only a day.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They will question thee concerning the mountains. Say: ’My Lord will scatter them as ashes;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: then He will leave them a level hollow

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: wherein thou wilt see no crookedness neither any curving.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: On that day they will follow the Summoner in whom is no crookedness; voices will be hushed to the All-merciful, so that thou hearest naught but a murmuring.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Upon that day the intercession will not profit, save for him to whom the All-merciful gives leave, and whose speech He approves.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He knows what is before them and behind them, and they comprehend Him not in knowledge.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And faces shall be humbled unto the Living, the Eternal. He will have failed whose burden is of evildoing;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: but whosoever does deeds of righteousness, being a believer, shall fear neither wrong nor injustice.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Even so We have sent it down as an Arabic Koran, and We have turned about in it something of threats, that haply they may be godfearing, or it may arouse in them remembrance.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So high exalted be God, the true King! And hasten not with the Koran ere its revelation is accomplished unto thee; and say, ’O my Lord, increase me in knowledge.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And We made covenant with Adam before, but he forgot, and We found in him no constancy.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And when We said to the angels, ’Bow yourselves to Adam’; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis; he refused.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Then We said, ’Adam, surely this is an enemy to thee and thy wife. So let him not expel you both from the Garden, so that thou art unprosperous.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: It is assuredly given to thee neither to hunger therein, nor to go naked,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: neither to thirst therein, nor to suffer the sun.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Then Satan whispered to him saying, ’Adam, shall I point thee to the Tree of Eternity, and a Kingdom that decays not?’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So the two of them ate of it, and their shameful parts revealed to them, and they took to stitching upon themselves leaves of the Garden. And Adam disobeyed his Lord, and so he erred.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Thereafter his Lord chose him, and turned again unto him, and He guided him.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Said He, ’Get you down, both of you together, out of it, each of you an enemy to each; but if there comes to you from Me guidance, then whosoever follows My guidance shall not go astray, neither shall he be unprosperous;

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: but whosoever turns away from My remembrance, his shall be a life of narrowness, and on the Resurrection Day We shall raise him blind.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He shall say, ’O my Lord, why hast thou raised me blind, and I was wont to see?’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: God shall say, ’Even so it is. Our signs came unto thee, and thou didst forget them; and so today thou art forgotten.’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So We recompense him who is prodigal and believes not in the signs of his Lord; and the chastisement of the world to come is more terrible and more enduring.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Is it not a guidance to them, how many generations We destroyed before them in whose dwelling-places they walk? Surely in that are signs for men possessing reason.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And but for a word that preceded from thy Lord, and a stated term, it had been fastened.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So be thou patient under what they say, and proclaim thy Lord’s praise before the rising of the sun, and before its setting, and proclaim thy Lord’s praise in the watches of the night, and at the ends of the day; haply thou wilt be well-pleasing.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Stretch not thine eyes to that We have given pairs of them to enjoy - the flower of the present life, that We may try them therein and thy Lord’s provision is better, and more enduring.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And bid thy family to pray, and be thou patient in it; We ask of thee no provision, but it is We who provide thee and the issue ultimate is to godfearing.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They say, ’Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?’ Has there not come to them the clear sign of what is in the former scrolls?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Had We destroyed them with a chastisement aforetime, they would have said, ’Our Lord, why didst Thou not send us a Messenger, so that we might have followed Thy signs before that we were humiliated and degraded?’

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Say: ’Everyone is waiting; so wait, and assuredly you shall know who are the travellers on the even path, and who is guided.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Nigh unto men has drawn their reckoning, while they in heedlessness are yet turning away;

Name: The Prophets
Verse: no Remembrance from their Lord comes to them lately renewed, but they listen to it yet playing,

Name: The Prophets
Verse: diverted their hearts. The evildoers whisper one to another, ’Is this aught but a mortal like to yourselves? What, will you take to sorcery with your eyes open?’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He says: ’My Lord knows what is said in the heavens and the earth, and He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Nay, but they say: ’A hotchpotch of nightmares! Nay, he has forged it; nay, he is a poet! Now therefore let him bring us a sign, even as the ancient ones were sent as Messengers.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Not one city that We destroyed before them believed; what then, will they not believe?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We sent none before thee, but men to whom We made revelation -- question the People of the Remembrance, if you do not know --

Name: The Prophets
Verse: nor did We fashion them as bodies that ate not food, neither were they immortal;

Name: The Prophets
Verse: then We made true the promise We gave them and We delivered them, and whomsoever We would; and We destroyed the prodigal.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Now We have sent down to you a Book wherein is your Remembrance; will you not understand?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: How many a city that was evildoing We have shattered, and set up after it another people!

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Then, when they perceived Our might, behold, they ran headlong out of it.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: ’Run not! Return you unto the luxury that you exulted in, and your dwelling-places; haply you shall be questioned.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, ’Alas for us! We have been evildoers.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So they ceased not to cry, until We made them stubble, silent and still.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: We created not the heaven and the earth, and whatsoever between them is, as playing;

Name: The Prophets
Verse: had We desired to take to Us a diversion We would have taken it to Us from Ourselves, had We done aught.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Nay, but We hurl the truth against falsehood and it prevails over it, and behold, falsehood vanishes away. Then woe to you for that you describe!

Name: The Prophets
Verse: To Him belongs whosoever is in the heavens and the earth; and those who are with Him wax not too proud to do Him service neither grow weary,

Name: The Prophets
Verse: glorifying Him by night and in the daytime and never failing.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Or have they taken gods out of the earth who raise the dead?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Why, were there gods in earth and heaven other than God, they would surely go to ruin; so glory be to God, the Lord of the Throne, above that they describe!

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He shall not be questioned as to what He does, but they shall he questioned.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Or have they taken gods apart from Him? Say: ’Bring your proof! This is the Remembrance of him who is with me, and the Remembrance of those before me. Nay, but the most part of them know not the truth, so therefore they are turning away.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We sent never a Messenger before thee except that We revealed to him, saying, ’There is no god but I; so serve Me.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They say:’ ’The All-merciful has taken to Him a son.’ Glory be to Him! Nay, but they are honoured servants

Name: The Prophets
Verse: that outstrip Him not in speech, and perform as He commands.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He knows what is before them and behind them, and they intercede not save for him with whom He is well-pleased, and they tremble in awe of Him.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: If any of them says, ’I am a god apart from Him’, such a one We recompense with Gehenna; even so We recompense the evildoers.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Have not the unbelievers then beheld that the heavens and the earth were a mass all sewn up, and then We unstitched them and of water fashioned every living thing? Will they not believe?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We set in the earth firm mountains lest it should shake with them, and We set in it ravines to serve as ways, that haply so they may be guided;

Name: The Prophets
Verse: and We set up the heaven as a roof well-protected; yet still from Our signs they are turning away.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: It is He who created the night and the day, the sun and the moon, each swimming in a sky.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: We have not assigned to any mortal before thee to live forever; therefore, if thou diest, will they live forever?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Every soul shall taste of death; and We try you with evil and good for a testing, then unto Us you shall be returned

Name: The Prophets
Verse: When the unbelievers behold thee, they take thee only for mockery: ’Ha, is this the one who makes mention of your gods?’ Yet they in the Remembrance of the All-merciful are unbelievers.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Man was created of haste. Assuredly I shall show you My signs; so demand not that I make haste.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They say, ’And when shall the promise come to pass, if you speak truly?’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: If the unbelievers but knew when that they shall not ward off the Fire from their faces nor from their backs, neither shall they be helped!

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Nay, but it shall come upon them suddenly, dumbfounding them, and they shall not be able to repel it, nor shall they be respited.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Messengers indeed were mocked at before thee, but those that scoffed at them were encompassed by that they mocked at.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Say: ’Who shall guard you by night and in the daytime from the All-merciful?’ Nay, but from the Remembrance of their Lord they are turning away.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Or have they gods that shall defend them apart from Us? Why, they are not able to help themselves, nor shall they be guarded in safety from Us.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Nay, but Ourselves gave these and their fathers enjoyment of days, until their life had lasted long while upon them. What, do they not see how We come to the land, diminishing it in its extremities? Or are they the victors?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Say: ’I warn you only by the Revelation’; but they that are deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: If but a breath of thy Lord’s chastisement touched them, they would surely say, ’Alas for us! We were evildoers.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We shall set up the just balances for the Resurrection Day, so that not one soul shall be wronged anything; even if it be the weight of one grain of mustard-seed We shall produce it, and sufficient are We for reckoners.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: We gave Moses and Aaron the Salvation and a Radiance, and a Remembrance for the godfearing

Name: The Prophets
Verse: such as fear God in the Unseen, trembling because of the Hour.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And this is a blessed Remembrance that We have sent down; so are you now denying it?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: We gave Abraham aforetime his rectitude -- for We knew him --

Name: The Prophets
Verse: when he said to his father and his people, ’What are these statues unto which you are cleaving?’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, ’We found our fathers serving them.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He said, ’Then assuredly you and your fathers have been in manifest error.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, ’What, hast thou come to us with the truth, or art thou one of those that play?’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He said, ’Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who originated them, and I am one of those that bear witness thereunto.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And, by God, I shall assuredly outwit your idols, after you have gone away turning your backs.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So he broke them into fragments, all but a great one they had, for haply they would return to it.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, ’Who has. done this with our gods? Surely he is one of the evildoers.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, ’We heard a young man making mention of them, and he was called Abraham.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, ’Bring him before the people’s eyes; haply they shall bear witness.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, ’So, art thou the man who did this unto our gods, Abraham?’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He said, ’No; it was this great one of them that did it. Question them; if they are able to speak!’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So they returned one to another, and they said, ’Surely it is you who are the evildoers.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Then they were utterly put to confusion saying, ’Very well indeed thou knowest these do not speak.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He said, ’What, and do you serve, apart from God, that which profits you nothing; neither hurts you?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Fie upon you and that you serve apart from God! Do you not understand?’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They said, ’Burn him, and help your gods, if you would do aught.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: We said, ’O fire, be coolness and safety for Abraham!’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: They desired to outwit him; so We made them the worse losers,

Name: The Prophets
Verse: and We delivered him, and Lot, unto the land that We had blessed for all beings.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in superfluity, and every one made We righteous

Name: The Prophets
Verse: and appointed them to be leaders guiding by Our command, and We revealed to them the doing of good deeds, and to perform the prayer, and to pay the alms, and Us they served.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And Lot -- to him We gave judgment and knowledge; and we delivered him from the city that had been doing deeds of corruption; they were an evil people, truly ungodly;

Name: The Prophets
Verse: and We admitted him into Our mercy; he was of the righteous.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And Noah -- when he called before, and We answered him, and delivered him and his people from the great distress,

Name: The Prophets
Verse: and We helped him against the people who cried lies to Our signs; surely they were an evil people, so We drowned them all together.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And David and Solomon -- when they gave judgment concerning the tillage, when the sheep of the people strayed there, and We bore witness to their judgment;

Name: The Prophets
Verse: and We made Solomon to understand it, and unto each gave We judgment and knowledge. And with David We subjected the mountains to give glory, and the birds, and We were doers.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And We taught him the fashioning of garments for you, to fortify you against your violence; then are you thankful?

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And to Solomon the wind, strongly blowing, that ran at his command unto the land that We had blessed; and We had knowledge of everything;

Name: The Prophets
Verse: and of the Satans some dived for him and did other work besides; and We were watching over them.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And Job -- when he called unto his Lord, ’Behold, affliction has visited me, and Thou art the most merciful of the merciful.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So We answered him, and removed the affliction that was upon him, and We gave his people, and the like of them with them, mercy from Us, and a Reminder to those who serve.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And Ishmael, Idris, Dhul Kifl -- each was of the patient,

Name: The Prophets
Verse: and We admitted them into Our mercy; they were of the righteous.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And Dhul Nun -- when he went forth enraged and thought that We would have no power over him; then he called out in the darkness, ’There is no god but Thou. Glory be to Thee! I have done evil.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So We answered him, and delivered him out of grief; even so do, We deliver the believers.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And Zachariah -- when he called unto his Lord, ’O my Lord, leave me not solitary; though Thou art the best of inheritors.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: So We answered him, and bestowed on him John, and We set his wife right for him; truly they vied with one another, hastening to good works, and called upon Us out of yearning and awe; and they were humble to Us.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And she who guarded her virginity, so We breathed into her of Our spirit and appointed her and her son to be a sign unto all beings.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: ’Surely this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord; so serve Me.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: But they split up their affair between them; all shall return to Us.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: And whosoever does deeds of righteousness, being a believer, no unthankfulness shall befall his endeavour; We Ourselves write it down for him.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: There is a ban upon any city that We have destroyed; they shall not return

Name: The Prophets
Verse: till, when Gog and Magog are unloosed, and they slide down out of every slope,

Name: The Prophets
Verse: and nigh has drawn the true promise, and behold, the eyes of the unbelievers staring: ’Alas for us! We were heedless of this; ’nay, we were evildoers.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: ’Surely you, and that you were serving apart from God, are fuel for Gehenna; you shall go down to it.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: If those had been gods, they would never have gone down to it; yet every one of them shall therein abide forever;’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: there shall be sighing for them therein, and naught they shall hear.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: But as for those unto whom already the reward most fair has gone forth from Us,

Name: The Prophets
Verse: they shall be, kept far from it neither shall they hear any whisper of it, and they shall dwell forever in that their souls desired;

Name: The Prophets
Verse: the greatest terror shall not grieve them, and the angels shall receive them: ’This is your day that you were promised.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: On the day when We shall roll up heaven as a scroll is rolled for the writings; as We originated the first creation, so We shall bring it back again -- a promise binding on Us; so We shall do.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: For We have written in the Psalms, after the Remembrance, ’The earth shall be the inheritance of My righteous servants.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Surely in this is a Message delivered unto a people who serve.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: We have not sent thee, save as a mercy unto all beings.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Say: ’It is revealed unto me only that your God is One God; do you then surrender?’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Then, if they should turn their backs, say: ’I have proclaimed to you all equally, even though I know not whether near or far is that you are promised.’

Name: The Prophets
Verse: Surely He knows what is spoken aloud and He knows what you hide.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: I know not; haply it is a trial for you and an enjoyment for a time.

Name: The Prophets
Verse: He said: ’My Lord, judge Thou with truth! And our Lord is the All-merciful; His succour is ever to be sought against that you describe.’

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: O men, fear your Lord! Surely the earthquake of the Hour is a mighty thing;

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: on the day when you behold it, every suckling woman shall neglect the child she has suckled, and every pregnant woman shall deposit her burden, and thou shalt see mankind drunk, yet they are not drunk, but God’s chastisement is terrible.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And among men there is such a one that disputes concerning God without knowledge and follows every rebel Satan,

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: against whom it is written down that whosoever takes him for a friend, him he leads astray, and he guides him to the chastisement of the burning.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: O men, if you are in doubt as to the Uprising, surely We created you of dust then of a sperm-drop, then of a blood clot, then of a lump of flesh, formed and unformed that We may make clear to you. And We establish in the wombs what We will, till a stated term, then We deliver you as infants, then that you may come of age; and some of you die, and some of you are kept back unto the vilest state of life, that after knowing somewhat, they may know nothing. And thou beholdest the earth blackened, then, when We send down water upon it, it quivers, and swells, and puts forth herbs of every joyous kind.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: That is because God -- He is the Truth, and brings the dead to life, and is powerful over everything,

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: and because the Hour is coming, no doubt of it, and God shall raise up whosoever is within the tombs.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And among men there is such a one that disputes concerning God without knowledge or guidance, or an illuminating Book,

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: turning his side to lead astray from God’s way; for him is degradation in this world; and on the Resurrection Day We shall let him taste the chastisement of the burning:

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: ’That is for what thy hands have forwarded and for that God is never unjust unto His servants.’

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And among men there is such a one as serves God upon the very edge -- if good befalls him he is at rest in it, but if a trial befalls him he turns completely over; he loses this world and the world to come; that is indeed the manifest loss.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: He calls, apart from God, upon that which hurts him not, and which neither profits him anything; that is indeed the far error.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: He calls upon him who is likelier to hurt him, rather than to profit him -- an evil protector indeed, he, an evil friend!

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: God shall surely admit those who believe and do righteous deeds into gardens underneath which rivers flow; surely God does that He desires.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Whosoever thinks God will not help him in the present world and the world to come; let him stretch up a rope to heaven, then let him sever it, and behold whether his guile does away with what enrages him.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Even so We have sent it down as signs, clear signs, and for that God guides whom He desires.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Surely they that believe, and those of Jewry, the Sabaeans, the Christians, the Magians and the idolaters -- God shall distinguish between them on the Day of Resurrection; assuredly God is witness over everything.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Hast thou not seen how to God bow all who are in the and all who are in the earth, heavens the sun and the moon, the stars and the mountains, the trees and the beasts, and many of mankind? And many merit the chastisement; and whom God abases, there is none to honour him. God does whatsoever He will.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: These are two disputants who have disputed concerning their Lord. As for the unbelievers, for them garments of fire shall, be cut, and there shall be poured over their heads boiling water

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: whereby whatsoever is in their bellies and their skins shall be melted;

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: for them await hooked iron rods;

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: as often as they desire in their anguish to come forth from it, they shall be restored into it, and: ’Taste the chastisement of the burning!’

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: God shall surely admit those who believe and do righteous deeds into gardens underneath which rivers flow; therein they shall be adorned with bracelets of gold and with pearls, and their apparel there shall be of silk;

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: and they; shall be guided unto goodly speech, and they shall be guided unto the path of the All-laudable.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Those who disbelieve, and bar from God’s way and the Holy Mosque that We have appointed equal unto men, alike him who cleaves to it and the tent-dweller, and whosoever purposes to violate it wrongly, We shall let him taste a painful chastisement.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And when We settled for Abraham the place of the House: ’Thou shall not associate with Me anything. And do thou purify My House for those that shall go about it and those that stand, for those that bow and prostrate themselves;

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: and proclaim among men the Pilgrimage, and they shall come unto thee on foot and upon every lean beast, they shall come from every deep ravine

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: that they may witness things profitable to them and mention God’s Name on days well-known over such beasts of the flocks as He has provided them: "So eat thereof, and feed the wretched poor."

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Let them then finish with their self-neglect and let them fulfil their vows, and go about the Ancient House.’

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: All that; and whosoever venerates the sacred things of God, it shall be better for him with his Lord. And permitted to you are the flocks, except that which is recited to you. And eschew the abomination of idols, and eschew the speaking of falsehood,

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: being men pure of faith unto God, not associating with Him anything; for whosoever associates with God anything, it is as though he has fallen from heaven and the birds snatch him away, or the wind sweeps him headlong into a place far away.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: All that; and whosoever venerates God’s waymarks, that is of the godliness of the hearts.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: There are things therein profitable to you unto a stated term; thereafter their lawful place of sacrifice is by the Ancient House.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: We have appointed for every nation a holy rite, that they may mention God’s Name over such beasts of the flocks as He has provided them. Your God is One God, so to Him surrender. And give thou good tidings unto the humble

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: who, when God is mentioned, their hearts quake, and such as endure patiently whatever visits them, and who perform the prayer, and expend of what We have provided them.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And the beasts of sacrifice -- We have appointed them for you as among God’s waymarks; therein is good for you. So mention God’s Name over them, standing in ranks then, when their flanks collapse, eat of them and feed the beggar and the suppliant. So We have subjected them to you; haply you will be thankful.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: The flesh of them shall not reach God, neither their blood, but godliness from you shall reach Him. So He has subjected them to you, that you may magnify God for that He has guided you. And give thou good tidings unto the good-doers.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Assuredly God will defend those who believe; surely God loves not any ungrateful traitor.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Leave is given to those who fight because they were wronged -- surely God is able to help them --

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: who were expelled from their habitations without right, except that they say ’Our Lord is God.’ Had God not driven back the people, some by the means of others, there had been destroyed cloisters and churches, oratories and mosques, wherein God’s Name is much mentioned. Assuredly God will help him who helps Him -- surely God is All-strong, All-mighty

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: who, if We establish them in the land, perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and bid to honour, and forbid dishonour; and unto God belongs the issue of all affairs.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: If they cry lies to thee, so too before them the people of Noah cried lies, and Ad and Thamood,

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: and the people of Abraham, the people of Lot,

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: and the men of Midian; to Moses also they cried lies. And I respited the unbelievers, then I seized them; and how was My horror!

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: How many a city We have destroyed in its evildoing, and now it is fallen down upon its turrets! How many a ruined well, a tall palace!

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: What, have they not journeyed in the land so that they have hearts to understand with or ears to hear with? It is not the eyes that are blind, but blind are the hearts within the breasts.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And they demand of thee to hasten the chastisement! God will not fail His promise; and surely a day with thy Lord is as a thousand years of your counting.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: How many a city I have respited in its evildoing; then I seized it, and to Me was the homecoming.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Say: ’O men, I am only for you a plain warner.’

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- theirs shall be forgiveness and generous provision.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And those who strive against Our signs to void them -- they shall be the inhabitants of Hell.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: We sent not ever any Messenger or Prophet before thee, but that Satan cast into his fancy, when he was fancying; but God annuls what Satan casts, then God confirms His signs -- surely God is All-knowing, All-wise --

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: that He may make what Satan casts a trial for those in whose hearts is sickness, and those whose hearts are hard; and surely the evildoers are in wide schism;

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: and that they who have been given knowledge may know that it is the truth from thy Lord and believe in it, and so their hearts be humble unto Him; and assuredly God ever guides those who believe to a straight path.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And the unbelievers will not cease to be in doubt of it, until the Hour comes on them suddenly, or there shall come upon them the chastisement of a barren day.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: The Kingdom upon that day shall belong to God, and He shall judge between them. As for those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness, they shall be in Gardens of Bliss.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: But as for the unbelievers, who cried lies to Our signs; for them awaits a humbling chastisement.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And those who emigrated in God’s way and were slain, or died, God shall provide them with a fair provision; and surely God is the best of providers.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: He shall admit them by a gate that is well-pleasing to them; and surely God is All-knowing, All-clement.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: All that; and whosoever chastises after the manner that he was chastised and then again is oppressed, assuredly God will help him; surely God is All-pardoning, All-forgiving.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: That is because God makes the night to enter into the day and makes the day to enter into the night; and that God is All-hearing, All-seeing.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: That is because God -- He is the Truth, and that they call upon apart from Him -- that is the false; and for that God is the All-high, the All-great.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Hast thou not seen how that God has sent down out of heaven water, and in the morning the earth becomes green? God is All-subtle, All-aware.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and in the earth; surely God -- He is the All-sufficient, the All-laudable.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Hast thou not seen how that God has subjected to you all that is in the earth and the ships to run upon the sea at His commandment, and He holds back heaven lest it should fall upon the earth, save by His leave? Surely God is All-gentle to men, All-compassionate.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: It is He who gave you life, then He shall make you dead, then He shall give you life. Surely man is ungrateful.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: We have appointed for every nation a holy rite that they shall perform. Let them not therefore wrangle with thee upon the matter, and do thou summon unto thy Lord; surely thou art upon a straight guidance.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And if they should dispute with thee, do thou say, ’God knows very well what you are doing.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: God shall judge between you on the Day of Resurrection touching that whereon you were at variance.’

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: Didst thou not know that God knows all that is in heaven and earth? Surely that is in a Book; surely that for God is an easy matter.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: They serve, apart from God, that whereon He has sent down never authority and that whereof they have no knowledge; and for the evildoers there shall be no helper.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: And when Our signs are recited to them, clear signs, thou recognisest in the faces of the unbelievers denial; wellnigh they rush upon those who recite to them Our signs. Say: ’Shall I tell you of something worse than that? The Fire -- God has promised it to the unbelievers -- an evil homecoming!’

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: O men, a similitude is struck; so give you ear to it. Surely those upon whom you call, apart from God, shall never create a fly, though they banded together to do it; and if a fly should rob them of aught, they would never rescue it from him. Feeble indeed alike are the seeker and the sought!

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: They measure not God with His true measure; surely God is All-strong, All-mighty.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: God chooses of the angels Messengers and of mankind; surely God is All-hearing, All-seeing.

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: He knows whatsoever is before them and behind them, and unto God all matters are returned.’

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: O men, bow you down and prostrate yourselves, and serve your Lord, and do good; haply so you shall prosper;

Name: The Pilgrimage
Verse: and struggle for God as is His due, for He has chosen you, and has laid on you no impediment in your religion, being the creed of your father Abraham; He named you Muslims aforetime and in this, that the Messenger might be a witness against you, and that you might be witnesses against mankind. So perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and hold you fast to God; He is your Protector -- an excellent Protector, an excellent Helper.
