Name: The Believers
Verse: Prosperous are the believers

Name: The Believers
Verse: who in their prayers are humble

Name: The Believers
Verse: and from idle talk turn away

Name: The Believers
Verse: and at almsgiving are active

Name: The Believers
Verse: and guard their private parts

Name: The Believers
Verse: save from their wives and what their right hands own then being not blameworthy

Name: The Believers
Verse: but whosoever seeks after more than that, those are the transgressors)

Name: The Believers
Verse: and who preserve their trusts and their covenant

Name: The Believers
Verse: and who observe their prayers.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Those are the inheritors

Name: The Believers
Verse: who shall inherit Paradise therein dwelling forever.

Name: The Believers
Verse: We created man of an extraction of clay,

Name: The Believers
Verse: then We set him, a drop, in a receptacle secure,

Name: The Believers
Verse: then We created of the drop a clot then We created of the clot a tissue then We created of the tissue bones then We garmented the bones in flesh; thereafter We produced him as another creature. So blessed be God, the fairest of creators!

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then after that you shall surely die,

Name: The Believers
Verse: then on the Day of Resurrection you shall surely be raised up.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We created above you seven ways, and We were not heedless of creation.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We sent down out of heaven water in measure and lodged it in the earth; and We are able to take it away.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then We produced for you therewith gardens of palms and vines wherein are many fruits for you, and of them you eat,

Name: The Believers
Verse: and a tree issuing from the Mount of Sinai that bears oil and seasoning for all to eat.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And surely in the cattle there is a lesson for you; We give you to drink of what is in their bellies, and many uses there are in them for you, and of them you eat;

Name: The Believers
Verse: and upon them, and on the ships, you are borne.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We sent Noah to his people; and he, said, ’O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He. Will you not be godfearing?"

Name: The Believers
Verse: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, ’This is naught but a mortal like yourselves, who desires to gain superiority over you. And if God willed, He would have sent down angels. We never heard of this among, our fathers, the ancients.

Name: The Believers
Verse: He is naught but a man bedevilled; so wait on him for a time.

Name: The Believers
Verse: He said, ’O my Lord, help me, for that they cry me lies.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then We said to him, ’Make thou the Ark under Our eyes and as We reveal, and then, when Our command comes and the Oven boils, insert in it two of every kind and thy, family -- except for him against whom the word already has been spoken; and address Me not concerning those who have done evil; they shall be drowned.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then, when thou art seated in the Ark and those with thee, say, "Praise belongs to God, who has delivered us from the people of the evildoers."

Name: The Believers
Verse: And say, "’O my Lord, do Thou harbour me in a blessed harbour, for Thou art the best of harbourers."

Name: The Believers
Verse: Surely in that are signs, and surely We put to the test.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Thereafter, after them, We produced another generation,

Name: The Believers
Verse: and We sent amongst them a Messenger of themselves, saying, ’Serve God! You have no god other than He. Will you not be godfearing?’

Name: The Believers
Verse: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, who cried lies to the encounter of the world to come, and to whom We had given ease in the present’ life, ’This is naught but a mortal like yourselves, who eats of what you eat and drinks of what you drink.

Name: The Believers
Verse: If you obey a mortal like yourselves, then you will be losers.

Name: The Believers
Verse: What, does he promise you that when you are dead, and become dust and bones, you shall be brought forth?

Name: The Believers
Verse: Away, away with that you are promised!

Name: The Believers
Verse: There is nothing but our present life; we die, and we live, and we shall not be raised up.

Name: The Believers
Verse: He is naught but a man who has forged against God a lie, and we will not believe him.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: He said, ’O my Lord, help me, for that they cry me lies.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: He said, ’In a little they will be remorseful.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: And the Cry seized them justly, and We made them as scum; so away with the people of the evildoers!

Name: The Believers
Verse: Thereafter, after them, We produced other generations;

Name: The Believers
Verse: no nation outstrips its term, nor do they put it back.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then sent We Our Messengers successively; whenever its Messenger came to a nation they cried him lies, so We caused some of them to follow others, and We made them as but tales; so away with a people who do not believe!

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a manifest authority

Name: The Believers
Verse: unto Pharaoh and his Council; but they waxed proud, and they were a lofty people,

Name: The Believers
Verse: and they said, ’What, shall we believe two mortals like ourselves, whose people are our servants?’

Name: The Believers
Verse: So they cried them lies, and they were among the destroyed.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And We gave Moses the Book, that haply they would be guided;

Name: The Believers
Verse: and We made Mary’s son, and his mother, to be a sign, and gave them refuge upon a height, where was a hollow and a spring:

Name: The Believers
Verse: ’O Messengers, eat of the good things and do righteousness; surely I know the things you do.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Surely this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord; so fear Me.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: But they split in their affair between them into sects, each party rejoicing in what is with them.

Name: The Believers
Verse: So leave thou them in their perplexity for a time.

Name: The Believers
Verse: What, do they think that We succour them with of wealth and children,

Name: The Believers
Verse: We vie in good works for them? Nay, but they are not aware.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Surely those who tremble in fear of their Lord

Name: The Believers
Verse: and those who believe in the signs of their Lord

Name: The Believers
Verse: and those who associate naught with their Lord

Name: The Believers
Verse: and those who give what they give, their hearts quaking that they are returning to their Lord --

Name: The Believers
Verse: those vie in good works, outracing to them.

Name: The Believers
Verse: We charge not any soul save to its capacity, and with Us is a Book speaking truth, and they shall not be wronged.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Nay, but their hearts are in perplexity as to this, and they have deeds besides that that they are doing.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Till, when We seize with the chastisement the ones of them that live at ease, behold, they groan.

Name: The Believers
Verse: ’Groan not today; surely you shall not be helped from Us.

Name: The Believers
Verse: My signs were recited to you, but upon your heels you withdrew,

Name: The Believers
Verse: waxing proud against it, talking foolish talk by night.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: Have they not pondered the saying, or came there upon them that which came not upon their fathers, the ancients?

Name: The Believers
Verse: Or did they not recognise their Messenger and so denied him?

Name: The Believers
Verse: Or do they say, ’He is bedevilled’? Nay, he has brought them the truth, but most of them are averse from the truth.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Had the truth followed their caprices, the heavens and the earth and whosoever in them is had surely corrupted. Nay, We brought them their Remembrance, but from their Remembrance they turned.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Or dost thou ask them for tribute? Yet the tribute of thy Lord is better, and He is the best of providers.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Assuredly thou art calling them to a straight path;

Name: The Believers
Verse: and surely they that believe not in the world to come are deviating from the path.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Did We have mercy on them, and remove the affliction that is upon them, they would persist in their insolence wandering blindly.

Name: The Believers
Verse: We already seized them with the chastisement, yet they abased not themselves to their Lord nor were they humble;

Name: The Believers
Verse: until, when We open against them a door of terrible chastisement, lo, they are sore confounded at it.

Name: The Believers
Verse: It is He who produced for you hearing, and eyes, and hearts; little thanks you show.

Name: The Believers
Verse: It is He who scattered you in the earth, and to Him you shall be mustered.

Name: The Believers
Verse: It is He who gives life, and makes to die, and to Him belongs the alternation of night and day; what, will you not understand?

Name: The Believers
Verse: Nay, but they said the like of what the ancients said.

Name: The Believers
Verse: They said, ’What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we be indeed raised up?

Name: The Believers
Verse: We and our fathers have been promised this before; this is naught but the fairy-tales of the ancients.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: Say: ’Whose is the earth, and whoso is in it, if you have knowledge?’

Name: The Believers
Verse: They will say, God’s.’ Say: ’Will you not then remember?’

Name: The Believers
Verse: Say: ’Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the mighty Throne?’

Name: The Believers
Verse: They will say, ’God’s.’ Say: ’Will you not then be godfearing?’

Name: The Believers
Verse: Say: ’In whose hand is the dominion of everything, protecting and Himself unprotected, if you have knowledge?’

Name: The Believers
Verse: They will say, ’God’s.’ Say: ’How then are you bewitched?

Name: The Believers
Verse: Nay, but We brought them the truth and they are truly liars.

Name: The Believers
Verse: God has not taken to Himself any son, nor is there any god with Him; for then each god would have taken off that he created and some of them would have risen up over others; glory to be God, beyond that they describe,

Name: The Believers
Verse: who has knowledge of the Unseen and the Visible; high exalted be He, above that they associate!

Name: The Believers
Verse: Say: ’O my Lord, if Thou shouldst show me that they are promised,

Name: The Believers
Verse: O my Lord, put me not among the people of the evildoers.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: Assuredly, We are able to show thee that We promise them.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Repel thou the evil with that which is fairer. We Ourselves know very well that they describe.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And say: ’O my Lord, I take refuge in Thee from the evil suggestions of the Satans,

Name: The Believers
Verse: and I take refuge in Thee, O my Lord, lest they attend me.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: Till, when death comes to one of them, he says, ’My Lord, return me;

Name: The Believers
Verse: haply I shall do righteousness in that I forsook.’ Nay, it is but a word he speaks; and there; behind them, is a barrier until the day that they shall be raised up.

Name: The Believers
Verse: For when the Trumpet is blown, that day there shall be no kinship any more between them, neither will they question one another.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then he whose scales are heavy -- they are the prosperers,

Name: The Believers
Verse: and he whose scales are light -- they have lost their souls in Gehenna dwelling forever,

Name: The Believers
Verse: the Fire smiting their faces the while they glower there.

Name: The Believers
Verse: ’What, were My signs not recited to you, and you cried them lies?’

Name: The Believers
Verse: They shall say, ’Our Lord, our adversity prevailed over us; we were an erring people.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Our Lord, bring us forth out of it! Then, if we revert, we shall be evildoers indeed.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: ’Slink you into it,’ He shall say, ’and do not speak to Me.

Name: The Believers
Verse: There is a party of My servants who said, "Our Lord, we believe; therefore forgive us, and have mercy on us, for Thou art the best of the merciful."

Name: The Believers
Verse: But you took them for a laughing-stock, till they made you forget My remembrance, mocking at them.

Name: The Believers
Verse: Now today I have recompensed them for their patient endurance; they are the triumphant.’

Name: The Believers
Verse: He shall say, ’How long have you tarried in the earth, by number of years?’

Name: The Believers
Verse: They shall say, ’We have tarried a day, or part of a day; ask the numberers!’

Name: The Believers
Verse: He shall say, ’You have tarried but a little, did you know.

Name: The Believers
Verse: What, did you think that We created you only for sport, and that you would not be returned to Us?’

Name: The Believers
Verse: Then high exalted be God, the King, the True! There is no god but He? the Lord of the noble Throne.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And whosoever calls upon another god with God, whereof he has no proof, his reckoning is with his Lord; surely the unbelievers shall not prosper.

Name: The Believers
Verse: And say: ’My Lord, forgive and have mercy, for Thou art the best of the merciful.’

Name: Light
Verse: A sura that We have sent down and appointed; and We have sent down in it signs, clear signs, that haply you will remember.

Name: Light
Verse: The fornicatress and the fornicator -- scourge each one of them a hundred stripes, and in the matter of God’s religion let no tenderness for them seize you if you believe in God and the Last Day; and let a party of the believers witness their chastisement.

Name: Light
Verse: The fornicator shall marry none but a fornicatress or an idolatress, and the fornicatress -- none shall marry her but a fornicator or an idolator; that is forbidden to the believers.

Name: Light
Verse: And those who cast it up on women in wedlock, and then bring not four witnesses, scourge them with eighty stripes, and do not accept any testimony of theirs ever; those -- they are the ungodly,

Name: Light
Verse: save such as repent thereafter and make amends; surely God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: Light
Verse: And those who cast it up on their wives having no witnesses except themselves, the testimony of one of them shall be to testify by God four times that he is of the truthful,

Name: Light
Verse: and a fifth time, that the curse of God shall be upon him, if he should be of the liars.

Name: Light
Verse: It shall avert from her the chastisement if she testify by God four times that he is of the liars,

Name: Light
Verse: and a fifth time, that the wrath of God shall be upon her, if he should be of the truthful.

Name: Light
Verse: But for God’s bounty to you and His mercy and that God turns, and is All-wise --

Name: Light
Verse: Those who came with the slander are a band of you; do not reckon it evil for you; rather it is good for you. Every man of them shall have the sin that he has earned charged to him; and whosoever of them took upon himself the greater part of it, him there awaits a mighty chastisement.

Name: Light
Verse: Why, when you heard it, did the believing men and women not of their own account think good thoughts, and say, ’This is a manifest calumny’?

Name: Light
Verse: Why did they not bring four witnesses against it? But since they did not bring the witnesses, in God’s sight they are the liars.

Name: Light
Verse: But for God’s bounty to you and His mercy in the present world and the world to come there would have visited you for your mutterings a mighty chastisement.

Name: Light
Verse: When you received it on your tongues, and were speaking with your mouths that whereof you had no knowledge, and reckoned it a light thing, and with God it was a mighty thing --

Name: Light
Verse: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, ’It is not for us to speak about this; glory be to Thee! This is a mighty calumny’?

Name: Light
Verse: God admonishes you, that you shall never repeat the like of it again; if you are believers.

Name: Light
Verse: God makes clear to you the signs; and God is All-knowing, All-wise.

Name: Light
Verse: Those who love that indecency should be spread abroad concerning them that believe -- there awaits them a painful chastisement in the present world and the world to come; and God knows, and you know not.

Name: Light
Verse: But for God’s bounty to you and His mercy and that God is All-gentle, All-compassionate --

Name: Light
Verse: O believers, follow not the steps of Satan; for whosoever follows the steps of Satan, assuredly he bids to indecency and dishonour. But for God’s bounty to you and His mercy not one of you would have been pure ever; but God purifies whom He will; and God is All-hearing, All-knowing.

Name: Light
Verse: Let not those of you who possess bounty and plenty swear off giving kinsmen and the poor and those who emigrate in the way of God; but let them pardon and forgive. Do you not wish that God should forgive you? God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: Light
Verse: Surely those who cast it up on women in wedlock that are heedless but believing shall be accursed in the present world and the world to come; and there awaits them a mighty chastisement

Name: Light
Verse: on the day when their tongues, their hands and their feet shall testify against them touching that they were doing.

Name: Light
Verse: Upon that day God will pay them in full their just due, and they shall know that God is the manifest Truth.

Name: Light
Verse: Corrupt women for corrupt men, and corrupt men for corrupt women; good women for good men, and good men for good women -- these are declared quit of what they say; theirs shall be forgiveness and generous provision.

Name: Light
Verse: O believers, do not enter houses other than your houses until you first ask leave and, salute the people thereof; that is better for you; haply you will remember.

Name: Light
Verse: And if you find not anyone therein, enter it not until leave is given to you. And if you are told, ’Return,’ return; that is purer for you; and God knows the things you do.

Name: Light
Verse: There is no fault in you that you enter houses uninhabited wherein enjoyment is for you. God knows what you reveal and what you hide.

Name: Light
Verse: Say to the believers, that they cast down their eyes and guard their private parts; that is purer for them. God is aware of the things they work.

Name: Light
Verse: And say to the believing women, that they cast down their eyes’ and guard their private parts, and reveal not their adornment save such as is outward; and let them cast their veils over their bosoms, and not reveal their adornment save to their husbands, or their fathers, or their husbands’ fathers, or their sons, or their husbands’ sons, or their brothers, or their brothers’ sons, or their sisters’ sons, or their women, or what their right hands own, or such men as attend them, not having sexual desire, or children who have not yet attained knowledge of women’s private parts; nor let them stamp their feet, so that their hidden ornament may be known. And turn all together to God, O you believers; haply so you will prosper.

Name: Light
Verse: Marry the spouseless among you, and your slaves and handmaidens that are righteous; if they are poor, God will enrich them of His bounty; God is All-embracing, All-knowing.

Name: Light
Verse: And let those who find not the means to marry be abstinent till God enriches them of His bounty. Those your right hands own who seek emancipation, contract with them accordingly, if you know some good in them; and give them of the wealth of God that He has given you. And constrain not your slave-girls to prostitution, if they desire to live in chastity, that you may seek the chance goods of the present life. Whosoever constrains them, surely God, after their being constrained, is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: Light
Verse: Now We have sent down to you signs making all clear, and an example of those who passed away before you, and an admonition for the godfearing.

Name: Light
Verse: God is the Light of the heavens and the earth; the likeness of His Light is as a niche wherein is a lamp (the lamp in a glass, the glass as it were a glittering star) kindled from a Blessed Tree, an olive that is neither of the East nor of the West whose oil wellnigh would shine, even if no fire touched it; Light upon Light; (God guides to His Light whom He will.) (And God strikes similitudes for men, and God has knowledge of everything.)

Name: Light
Verse: in temples God has allowed to be raised up, and His Name to be commemorated therein; therein glorifying Him, in the mornings and the evenings,

Name: Light
Verse: are men whom neither commerce nor trafficking diverts from the remembrance of God and to perform the prayer, and to pay the alms, fearing a day when hearts and eyes shall be turned about,

Name: Light
Verse: That God may recompense them for their fairest works and give them increase of His bounty; and God provides whomsoever He will, without reckoning.

Name: Light
Verse: And as for the unbelievers, their works are as a mirage in a spacious plain which the man athirst supposes to be water, till, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing; there indeed he finds God, and He pays him his account in full; (and God is swift at the reckoning.)

Name: Light
Verse: or they are as shadows upon a sea obscure covered by a billow above which is a billow above which are clouds, shadows piled one upon another; when he puts forth his hand, wellnigh he cannot see it. And to whomsoever God assigns no light, no light has he.

Name: Light
Verse: Hast thou not seen how that whatsoever is in the heavens and in the earth extols God, and the birds spreading their wings? Each -- He knows its prayer and its extolling; and God knows the things they do.

Name: Light
Verse: To God belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and to Him is the homecoming.

Name: Light
Verse: ’hast thou not seen how God drives the clouds, then composes them, then converts them into a mass, then thou seest the rain issuing out of the midst of them? And He sends down out of heaven mountains, wherein is hail, so that He smites whom He will with it, and turns it aside from whom He will; wellnigh the gleam of His lightning snatches away the sight.

Name: Light
Verse: God turns about the day and the night; surely in that is a lesson for those who have eyes.

Name: Light
Verse: God has created every beast of water, and some of them go upon their bellies, and some of them go upon two feet, and some of them go upon four; God creates whatever He will; God is powerful over everything.

Name: Light
Verse: Now We have sent down signs making all clear; God guides whomsoever He will to a straight path.

Name: Light
Verse: They say, ’We believe in God and the Messenger, and we obey.’ Then after that a party of them turn away; those -- they are not believers.

Name: Light
Verse: When they are called to God and His Messenger that he may judge between them, lo, a party of them are swerving aside;

Name: Light
Verse: but if they are in the right, they will come to him submissively.

Name: Light
Verse: What, is there sickness in their hearts, or are they in doubt, or do they fear that God may be unjust towards them and His Messenger? Nay, but those -- they are the evildoers.

Name: Light
Verse: All that the believers say, when they are called to God and His Messenger, that he may judge between them, is that they say, ’We hear, and we obey’; those -- they are the prosperers.

Name: Light
Verse: Whoso obeys God and His Messenger, and fears God and has awe of Him, those -- they are the triumphant.

Name: Light
Verse: They have sworn by God the most earnest oaths, if thou commandest them they will go forth. Say: ’Do not swear; honourable obedience is sufficient. Surely God is aware of the things you do.’

Name: Light
Verse: Say: ’Obey God, and obey the Messenger; then, if you turn away, only upon him rests what is laid on him, and upon you rests what is laid on you. If you obey him, you will be guided. It is only for the Messenger to deliver the manifest Message.’

Name: Light
Verse: God has promised those of you who believe and do righteous deeds that He will surely make you successors in the land, even as He made those who were before them successors, and that He will surely establish their religion for them that He has approved. for them, and will give them in exchange, after their fear, security: ’They shall serve Me, not associating with Me anything.’ Whoso disbelieves after that, those - they are the ungodly.

Name: Light
Verse: Perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and obey the Messenger -- haply so you will find mercy.

Name: Light
Verse: Think not the unbelievers able to frustrate God in the earth; their refuge is the Fire -- an evil homecoming.

Name: Light
Verse: O believers, let those your right hands own and those of you who have not reached puberty ask leave of you three times -- before the prayer of dawn, and when you put off your garments at the noon, and after the evening prayer -- three times of nakedness for you. There is no fault in you or them, apart from these, that you go about one to the other. So God makes clear to you the signs; and God is All-knowing, All-wise.

Name: Light
Verse: When your children reach puberty, let them ask leave, as those before them asked leave. So God makes clear to you His signs; and God is All-knowing, All-wise.

Name: Light
Verse: Such women as are past child- bearing and have no hope of marriage -- there is no fault in them that they put off their clothes, so be it that they flaunt no ornament; but to abstain is better for them; and God is All-hearing, All-knowing.

Name: Light
Verse: There is no fault in the blind, and there is no fault in the lame, and there is no fault in the sick, neither in yourselves, that you eat of your houses, or your fathers’ houses, or your mothers’ houses, or your brothers’ houses, or your sisters’ houses, or the houses of your uncles or your aunts paternal, or the houses of your uncles or your aunts maternal, or that whereof you own the keys, or of your friend; there is no fault in you that you eat all together, or in groups separately. But when you enter houses, greet one another with a greeting from God, blessed and good. So God makes clear to you the signs; haply you will understand.

Name: Light
Verse: Those only are believers, who believe in God and His Messenger and who, when they are with him upon a common matter, go not away until they ask his leave. Surely those who ask thy leave -- those are they that believe in God and His Messenger; so, when they ask thy leave for some affair of their own, give leave to whom thou wilt of them, and ask God’s forgiveness for them; surely God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

Name: Light
Verse: Make not the calling of the Messenger among yourselves like your calling one of another. God knows those of you who slip away surreptitiously; so let those who go against His command beware, lest a trial befall them, or there befall them a painful chastisement.

Name: Light
Verse: Why, surely to God belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth; He ever knows what state you are upon; and the day when they shall be returned to Him, then He will tell them of what they did; and God knows everything.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Blessed be He who has sent down the Salvation upon His servant, that he may be a warner to all beings;

Name: The Criterion
Verse: to whom belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth; and He has not taken to Him a son, and He has no associate in the Kingdom; and He created every thing, then He ordained it very exactly.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Yet they have taken to them gods, apart from Him, that create nothing and themselves are created, and have no power to hurt or profit themselves, no power of death or life or raising up.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: The unbelievers say, ’This is naught but a calumny he has forged, and other folk have helped him to it.’ So they have committed wrong and falsehood.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: They say, ’Fairy-tales of the ancients that he has had written down, so that they are recited to him at the dawn and in the evening.’

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Say: ’He sent it down, who knows the secret in the heavens and earth; He is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.’

Name: The Criterion
Verse: They also say, ’What ails this Messenger that he eats food, and goes in the markets? Why has an angel not been sent down to him, to be a warner with him?

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Or why is not a treasure thrown to him, or why has he not a Garden to eat of?’ The evildoers say, ’You are only following a man bewitched!’

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Behold, how they strike similitudes for thee, and go astray, and are unable to find a way!

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Blessed be He who, if He will, shall assign to them better than that -- gardens underneath which rivers flow, and he shall assign to thee palaces.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Nay, but they cry lies to the Hour; and We have prepared for him who cries lies to the Hour a Blaze.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: When it sees them from a far place, they shall hear its bubbling and sighing.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: And when they are cast, coupled in fetters, into a narrow place of that Fire, they will call out there for destruction.

Name: The Criterion
Verse: ’Call not out today for one destruction, but call for many!’

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Say: ’Is that better, or the Garden of Eternity, that is promised to the godfearing, and is their recompense and homecoming?’

Name: The Criterion
Verse: Therein they shall have what they will dwelling forever; it is a promise binding upon thy Lord, and of Him to be required.

Name: The Criterion

Name: The Criterion

Name: The Criterion

Name: The Criterion

Name: The Poets
Verse: Not by the Satans has it been brought down;

Name: The Poets
Verse: it behoves them not, neither are they able.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly, they are expelled from hearing.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So call thou not upon another god with God, lest thou shouldst be one of those that are chastised.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And warn thy clan, thy nearest kin.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Lower thy wing to those who follow thee, being believers;

Name: The Poets
Verse: then, if they disobey thee, say, ’I am quit of that you do.’

Name: The Poets
Verse: Put thy trust in the All-mighty, the All-compassionate

Name: The Poets
Verse: who sees thee when thou standest

Name: The Poets
Verse: and when thou turnest about among those who bow.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Surely He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Shall I tell you on whom the Satans come down?

Name: The Poets
Verse: They come down on every guilty impostor.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They give ear, but most of them are liars.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And the poets -- the perverse follow them;

Name: The Poets
Verse: hast thou not seen how they wander in every valley

Name: The Poets
Verse: and how they say that which they do not?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Save those that believe, and do righteous deeds, and remember God oft, and help themselves after being wronged; and those who do wrong shall surely know by what overturning they will he overturned.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Ta Sin. Those are the signs of the Koran and a Manifest Book,

Name: The Ant
Verse: a guidance, and good tidings unto the believers

Name: The Ant
Verse: who perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and have sure faith in the Hereafter.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have decked out fair for them their works, and they wander blindly;

Name: The Ant
Verse: those are they whom an evil chastisement awaits, and they will be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Thou receivest the Koran from One All-wise, All-knowing.

Name: The Ant
Verse: When Moses said to his people ’I observe a fire, and will bring you news of it, or I will bring you a flaming brand, that haply you shall warm yourselves.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: So, when he came to it, he was called: ’Blessed is he who is in the fire, and he who is about it. Glory be to God, the Lord of all Being!

Name: The Ant
Verse: Moses, behold, it is I, God, the All-mighty, the All-wise.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Cast down thy staff.’ And when he saw it quivering like a serpent he turned about, retreating, and turned not back. ’Moses, fear not; surely the Envoys do not fear in My presence,

Name: The Ant
Verse: save him who has done evil, then; after evil, has changed into good; All-forgiving am I, All-compassionate.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Thrust thy hand in thy bosom and it will come forth white without evil-among nine signs to Pharaoh and his people; they are an ungodly people.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: But when Our signs came to them visibly, they said, ’This is a manifest sorcery’;

Name: The Ant
Verse: and they denied them, though their souls acknowledged them, wrongfully and out of pride. Behold, how was the end of the workers of corruption!

Name: The Ant
Verse: And We gave David and Solomon knowledge and they said, ’Praise belongs to God who has preferred us over many of His believing servants.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: And Solomon was David’s heir, and he said, ’Men, we have been taught the speech of the birds, and we have been given of everything; surely this is indeed the manifest bounty.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: And his hosts were mustered to Solomon, jinn, men and birds, duly disposed;

Name: The Ant
Verse: till, when they came on the Valley of Ants, an ant said, ’Ants, enter your dwelling-places, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you, being unaware!’

Name: The Ant
Verse: But he smiled, laughing at its words, and he said, ’My Lord, dispose me that I may be thankful for Thy blessing wherewith Thou hast blessed me and my father and mother, and that I may do righteousness well-pleasing to Thee; and do Thou admit me, by Thy mercy, amongst Thy righteous servants.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: And he reviewed the birds; then he said, ’How is it with me, that I do not see the hoopoe? Or is he among the absent?

Name: The Ant
Verse: Assuredly I will chastise him with a terrible chastisement, or I will slaughter him, or he bring me a clear authority.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: But he tarried not long, and said, ’I have comprehended that which thou hast not comprehended, and I have come from Sheba to thee with a sure tiding.

Name: The Ant
Verse: I found a woman ruling over them, and she has been given of everything, and she possesses a mighty throne.

Name: The Ant
Verse: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun, apart from God; Satan has decked out fair their deeds to them and he has barred them from the way, and therefore they are not guided,

Name: The Ant
Verse: so that they prostrate not themselves to God, who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and earth; and He knows what you conceal and what you publish.

Name: The Ant
Verse: God: there is no god but He, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: Said he, ’Now We will see whether thou hast spoken truly, or whether thou art amongst those that lie.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Take this letter of mine, and cast it unto them, then turn back from them and see what they shall return ’

Name: The Ant
Verse: She said, ’O Council, see, a letter honourable has been cast unto me.

Name: The Ant
Verse: It is from Solomon, and it is "In the Name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Rise not up against me, but come to me in surrender." ’

Name: The Ant
Verse: She said, ’O Council, pronounce to me concerning my affair; I am not used to decide an affair until you bear me witness.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: They said, ’We possess force and we possess great might. The affair rests with thee; so consider what thou wilt command.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: She said, ’Kings, when they enter a city, disorder it and make the mighty ones of its inhabitants abased. Even so they too will do.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Now I will send them a present, and see what the envoys bring back.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: But when he came to Solomon he said, ’What, would you succour me with wealth, and what God gave me is better than what He has given you? Nay, but instead you rejoice in your gift!

Name: The Ant
Verse: Return thou to them; we shall assuredly come against them with hosts they have not power to resist, and we shall expel them from there, abased and utterly humbled.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: He said, ’O Council, which one of you will bring me her throne, before they come to me in surrender?’

Name: The Ant
Verse: An efreet of the jinns said, ’I will bring it to thee, before thou risest from thy place; I have strength for it

Name: The Ant
Verse: and I am trusty.’ Said he who possessed knowledge of the Book, ’I will bring it to thee, before ever thy glance returns to thee.’ Then, when he saw it settled before him, he said, ’This is of my Lord’s bounty that He may try me, whether I am thankful or ungrateful. Whosoever gives thanks gives thanks only for his own soul’s good, and whosoever is ungrateful -- my Lord is surely All-sufficient, All-generous.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: He said, ’Disguise her throne for her, and we shall behold whether she is guided or if she is of those that are not guided.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: So, when she came, it was said, ’Is thy throne like this?’ She said, ’It seems the same.’ ’And we were given the knowledge before her, and we were in surrender,

Name: The Ant
Verse: but that she served, apart from God, barred her, for she was of a people of unbelievers.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: It was said to her, ’Enter the pavilion.’ But when she saw it, she supposed it was a spreading water, and she bared her legs. He said, ’It is a pavilion smoothed of crystal. She said, ’My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, and I surrender with Solomon to God, the Lord of all Being.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: And We sent to Thamood their brother Salih: ’Serve you God!’ And behold, they were two parties, that were disputing one with another.

Name: The Ant
Verse: He said, ’O my people, why do you seek to hasten evil before good? Why do you not ask forgiveness of God? Haply so you will find mercy.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: They said, ’We augur ill of thee and of those that are with thee.’ He said, ’Your augury is with God; nay, but you are a people being proved.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: Now in the city there were nine persons who did corruption in the land, and put not things right;

Name: The Ant
Verse: they said, ’Swear you, one to another, by God, "We will attack him and his family by night, then we will tell his protector, We were not witnesses of the destruction of his family; and assuredly we are truthful men."’

Name: The Ant
Verse: And they devised a device, and We likewise devised a device, while they were not aware;

Name: The Ant
Verse: and behold, how was the end of their device! For We destroyed them and their people all together.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Those are their houses, all fallen down because of the evil they committed; surely in that is a sign for a people who have knowledge.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And We delivered those who believed and were godfearing.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And Lot, when he said to his people, ’What, do you commit indecency with your eyes open?

Name: The Ant
Verse: What, do you approach men lustfully instead of women? No, you are a people that are ignorant.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: And the only answer of his people was that they said, ’Expel the folk of Lot from your city; they are men that keep themselves clean!’

Name: The Ant
Verse: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife; We decreed she should be of those that tarried.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And We rained on them a rain; and evil indeed is the rain of them that are warned.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say: ’Praise belongs to God, and peace be on His servants whom He has chosen.’ What, is God better, or that they associate?

Name: The Ant
Verse: He who created the heavens and earth, and sent down for you out of heaven water; and We caused to grow therewith gardens full of loveliness whose trees you could never grow. Is there a god with God? Nay, but they are a people who assign to Him equals!

Name: The Ant
Verse: He who made the earth a fixed place and set amidst it rivers and appointed for it firm mountains and placed a partition between the two seas. Is there a god with God? Nay, but the most of them have no knowledge.

Name: The Ant
Verse: He who answers the constrained, when he calls unto Him, and removes the evil and appoints you to be successors in the earth. Is there a god with God? Little indeed do you remember.

Name: The Ant
Verse: He who guides you in the shadows of the land and the sea and looses the winds, bearing good tidings before His mercy. Is there a god with God? High exalted be God, above that which they associate!

Name: The Ant
Verse: Who originates creation, then brings it back again, and provides you out of heaven and earth. Is there a god with God? Say: ’Produce your proof, if you speak truly.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say: ’None knows the Unseen in the heavens and earth except God. And they are not aware when they shall be raised;

Name: The Ant
Verse: nay, but their knowledge fails as to the Hereafter; nay, they are in doubt of it; nay, they are blind to it.

Name: The Ant
Verse: The unbelievers say, ’What, when we are dust, and our fathers, shall we indeed be brought forth?

Name: The Ant
Verse: We have been promised this, and our fathers before; this is naught but the fairy-tales of the ancients.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say: ’Journey in the land, then behold how was the end of the sinners.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: Do not sorrow for them, nor be thou straitened for what they devise.

Name: The Ant
Verse: They say, ’When shall this promise come to pass, if you speak the truth?’

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say: ’It may be that riding behind you already is some part of that you seek to hasten on.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Surely thy Lord is bountiful to men; but most of them are not thankful.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Surely thy Lord knows what their hearts conceal, and what they publish.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And not a thing is there hidden in heaven and earth but it is in a Manifest Book.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Surely this Koran relates to the Children of Israel most of that concerning which they are at variance;

Name: The Ant
Verse: it is a guidance, and a mercy unto the believers.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Surely thy Lord will decide between them by His Judgment; He is the All-mighty, the All-knowing.

Name: The Ant
Verse: So put thy trust in God; thou art upon the manifest truth.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Thou shalt not make the dead to hear, neither shalt thou make the deaf to hear the call when they turn about, retreating.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Thou shalt not guide the blind out of their error neither shalt thou make any to hear, save such as believe in Our signs, and so surrender.

Name: The Ant
Verse: When the Word falls on them, We shall bring forth for them out of the earth a beast that shall speak unto them: ’Mankind had no faith in Our signs.’

Name: The Ant
Verse: Upon the day when We shall muster out of every nation a troop of those that cried lies to Our signs, duly disposed,

Name: The Ant
Verse: till, when they are come, He shall say, ’Did you cry lies to My signs, not comprehending them in knowledge, or what have you been doing?’

Name: The Ant
Verse: And the Word shall fall upon them because of the evil they committed, while they speak naught.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Have they not seen how We made the night for them, to repose in it, and the day, to see? Surely in that is a sign for a people who are believers.

Name: The Ant
Verse: On the day the Trumpet is blown, and terrified is whosoever is in the heavens and earth, excepting whom God wills, and every one shall come to Him, all utterly abject;

Name: The Ant
Verse: and thou shalt see the mountains, that thou supposest fixed, passing by like clouds -- God’s handiwork, who has created everything very well. He is aware of the things you do.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Whosoever comes with a good deed, he shall have better than it; and they shall be secure from terror that day.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And whosoever comes with an evil deed, their faces shall be thrust into the Fire: ’Are you recompensed but for what you did?’

Name: The Ant
Verse: I have only been commanded to serve the Lord of this territory which He has made sacred; to Him belongs everything. And I have been commanded to be of those that surrender,

Name: The Ant
Verse: and to recite the Koran. So whosoever is guided, is only guided to his own gain; and whosoever goes astray, say: ’I am naught but a warner.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And say: ’Praise belongs to God. He shall show you His signs and you will recognise them. Thy Lord is not heedless of the things you do.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Ta Sin Mim

Name: The Story
Verse: Those are the signs of the Manifest Book.

Name: The Story
Verse: We will recite to thee something of the tiding of Moses and Pharaoh truthfully, for a people who believe.

Name: The Story
Verse: Now Pharaoh had exalted himself in the land and had divided its inhabitants into sects, abasing one party of them, slaughtering their sons, and sparing their women; for he was of the workers of corruption.

Name: The Story
Verse: Yet We desired to be gracious to those that were abased in the land, and to make them leaders, and to make them the inheritors,

Name: The Story
Verse: and to establish them in the land, and to show Pharaoh and Ha man, and their hosts, what they were dreading from them.

Name: The Story
Verse: So We revealed to Moses’ mother, ’Suckle him, then, when thou fearest for him, cast him into the sea, and do not fear, neither sorrow, for We shall return him to thee, and shall appoint him one of the Envoys.’

Name: The Story
Verse: So then the folk of Pharaoh picked him out to be an enemy and a sorrow to them; certainly Pharaoh and Haman, and their hosts, were of the sinners.

Name: The Story
Verse: Said Pharaoh’s wife, ’He will be a comfort to me and thee. Slay him not; perchance he will profit us, or we will take him for a son.’ And they were not aware.

Name: The Story
Verse: On the morrow the heart of Moses" mother became empty, and she wellnigh disclosed him had We not strengthened her heart, that she might be among the believers;

Name: The Story
Verse: and she said to his sister, ’Follow him,’ and she perceived him from afar, even while they were not aware.

Name: The Story
Verse: Now We had forbidden to him aforetime to be suckled by any foster-mother; therefore she said, ’Shall I direct you to the people of a household who will take charge of him for you and look after him?’

Name: The Story
Verse: So We returned him to his mother, that she might be comforted and not sorrow, and that she might know that the promise of God is true; but most of them do not know.

Name: The Story
Verse: And when he was fully grown and in the perfection of his strength, We gave him judgment and knowledge; even so do We recompense the good-doers.

Name: The Story
Verse: And he entered the city, at a time when its people were unheeding, and found there two men fighting; the one was of his own party, and the other was of his enemies. Then the one that was of his party cried to him to aid him against the other that was of his enemies; so Moses struck him, and despatched him, and said, ’This is of Satan’s doing; he is surely an enemy misleading, manifest.’

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ’My Lord, I have wronged myself. Forgive me!’ So God forgave him, for He is the All-forgiving, the All-compassionate.

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ’My Lord, forasmuch as Thou hast blessed me, I will never be a partisan of the sinners.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Now in the morning he was in the city, fearful and vigilant; and behold, the man who had sought his, succour on the day before cried out to him again. Moses said to him, ’Clearly thou art, a quarreller.’

Name: The Story
Verse: But when he would have assaulted the man who was an enemy to them both, the man said, ’Moses, dost thou’ desire to slay me, even as thou slewest a living ’soul yesterday? Thou only desirest to be a tyrant in the land; thou desirest not to be of them that put things right.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Then came a man from the furthest part of the city, running; he said, ’Moses, the Council are conspiring to slay thee. Depart; I am one of thy sincere advisers.’

Name: The Story
Verse: So he departed therefrom, fearful and vigilant; he said, ’My Lord, deliver me from the people of the evildoers.’

Name: The Story
Verse: And when he turned his face towards Midian he said, ’It may be that my Lord will guide me

Name: The Story
Verse: On the right way. And when he came to the waters of Midian he found a company of the people there drawing water, and he found, apart from them, two women holding back their flocks. He said, ’What is your business?’ They said, ’We may not draw water until the shepherds drive off; and our father is passing old.’

Name: The Story
Verse: So he drew water for them; then he turned away to the shade, and he said, ’O my Lord, surely I have need of whatever good Thou shalt have sent down upon me.

Name: The Story
Verse: Then came one of the two women to him, walking modestly, and said, ’My father invites thee, that he may recompense thee with the wage of thy drawing water for us.’ So when he came to him and had related to him the story, he said, ’Be not afraid; thou hast escaped from the people of the evildoers.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Said one of the two women, ’Father, hire him; surely the best man thou canst hire is the one strong and trusty.’

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ’I desire to marry thee to one of these my two daughters, on condition that thou hirest thyself to me for eight years. If thou completest ten, that shall be of thy own accord; I do not desire to’ press hard ’upon thee. Thou shalt assuredly find me, if God wills, one of the righteous.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Said he, ’So let it be between me and thee. Whichever of the two’ terms I fulfil, it shall be no Injustice to me; and God is guardian of what we say.

Name: The Story
Verse: So when Moses had accomplished the term and departed with his household, he observed on the side of the Mount a fire. He said to his household, ’Tarry you here; I observe a fire. Perhaps I shall bring you news of it, or a faggot from the fire, that haply you shall warm yourselves.’

Name: The Story
Verse: When he came to it, a voice cried from the right of the watercourse, in the sacred hollow, coming from the tree: ’Moses, I am God, the Lord of all Being.’

Name: The Story
Verse: ’Cast down thy staff.’ And when he saw it quivering like a serpent, he turned about retreating, and turned not back. ’Moses, come forward, and fear not; for surely thou art in security.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Insert thy hand into thy bosom, and it will come forth white without evil; and press to thee thy arm, that thou be not afraid. So these shall be two proofs from thy Lord to Pharaoh and his Council; for surely they are an ungodly people.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Said he, ’My Lord, I have indeed slain a living soul among them, and I fear that they will slay me.

Name: The Story
Verse: Moreover my brother Aaron is more eloquent than I. Send him with me as a helper and to confirm I speak truly, for’ I fear they will cry me lies.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Said He, ’We will strengthen thy arm by means of thy brother, and We shall appoint. to you an authority, so that they shall not reach you because of Our signs; you, and whoso follows you, shall be the victors.’

Name: The Story
Verse: So when Moses came to them with Our signs, clear signs, they said, ’This is nothing but a forged sorcery. We never heard of this among our fathers, the ancients.’

Name: The Story
Verse: But Moses said, ’My Lord knows very well who comes with the guidance from Him, and shall possess the Ultimate Abode; surely the evildoers will not prosper.’

Name: The Story
Verse: And Pharaoh said, ’Council, I know not that you have any god but me. Kindle me, Haman, a fire upon the clay, and make me a tower, that I may mount up to Moses’ god; for I think that he is one of the liars.’

Name: The Story
Verse: And he waxed proud in the land, he and his hosts, wrongfully; and they thought they should not be returned to Us.

Name: The Story
Verse: Therefore We seized him and his hosts, and cast their into the sea; so behold how was the end of the evildoers!

Name: The Story
Verse: And We appointed them leaders, calling to the Fire; and on the Day of Resurrection they shall not be helped;

Name: The Story
Verse: and We pursued them in this world with a curse, and on the Day of Resurrection they shall be among the spurned.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We gave Moses the Book, after that We had destroyed the former generations, to be examples and a guidance and a mercy, that haply so they might remember.

Name: The Story
Verse: Thou wast not upon the western side when We decreed to Moses the commandment, nor wast thou of those witnessing;

Name: The Story
Verse: but We raised up generations, and long their lives continued. Neither wast thou a dweller among the Midianites, reciting to them Our signs; but We were sending Messengers.

Name: The Story
Verse: Thou wast not upon the side of the Mount when We called; but for a mercy from thy Lord, that thou mayest warn a people to whom no warner came before thee, and that haply they may remember.

Name: The Story
Verse: Else, did an affliction visit them for that their own hands have forwarded then they might say, ’Our Lord, why didst Thou not send a Messenger to us that we might follow Thy signs and so be among the believers?’

Name: The Story
Verse: Yet when the truth came to them ’from Ourselves, they said, ’Why has he not been given the like’ of that Moses was given?’ But they, did they not disbelieve also in what Moses was given aforetime? They said, ’A pair of sorceries mutually supporting each other.’ They said, ’We disbelieve both.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Say: ’Bring a Book from God that gives better guidance than these, and follow it, if you speak truly.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Then if they do not answer thee, know that they are only following their caprices; and who is further astray than he who follows his caprice without guidance from God? Surely God guides not the people of the evildoers.

Name: The Story
Verse: Now We have brought them the Word; haply they may remember.

Name: The Story
Verse: Those to whom We gave the Book before this believe in it

Name: The Story
Verse: and, when it is recited to them, they say, ’We believe in it; surely it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed, even before’ it we had surrendered.’

Name: The Story
Verse: These shall be given their wage twice over for that they patiently endured, and avert evil with good, and expend of that We have provided them.

Name: The Story
Verse: When they hear idle talk, they turn away from it and say, ’We have our deeds, and you your deeds. Peace be upon your We desire not the ignorant.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Thou guidest not whom thou likest, but God guides whom He wills, and knows very well those that are guided.

Name: The Story
Verse: They say, ’Should we follow the guidance with thee, we shall be snatched from our land.’ Have We not established for them a sanctuary secure, to which are collected the fruits of everything, as a provision from Us? But most of them know not.

Name: The Story
Verse: How many a city We have destroyed that flourished in insolent ease! Those are their dwelling-places, undwelt in after them, except a little; Ourselves are the inheritors.

Name: The Story
Verse: Yet thy Lord never destroyed the cities until He sent in their mother-city a Messenger, to recite Our signs unto them; and We never destroyed the cities, save that their inhabitants were evildoers.

Name: The Story
Verse: Whatever thing you have been given is the enjoyment of the present life and its adornment; and what is with God is better and more enduring.

Name: The Story
Verse: Will you not understand? What, is he to whom We have promised a fair promise, and he receives it, like him to whom We have given the enjoyment of the present life, then he on the Resurrection Day shall be of those that are arraigned?

Name: The Story
Verse: Upon the day when He shall call to them, and He shall say, ’Where now are My associates whom you were asserting?’

Name: The Story
Verse: Those against whom the Word is realized they shall say, ’Our Lord, those whom we perverted, we perverted them even as we ourselves erred. We declare our innocence unto Thee; it was not us that they were serving.’

Name: The Story
Verse: It shall be said, ’Call you now upon your associates!’ And they will call upon them, but they shall not answer them, and they shall see the chastisement-ah, if they had been guided!

Name: The Story
Verse: Upon the day when He shall call to them, and He shall say, ’What answer gave you to the Envoys?’

Name: The Story
Verse: Upon that day the tidings will be darkened for them, nor will they ask each other.

Name: The Story
Verse: But as for him who repents, and believes, and works righteousness, haply he shall be among the prosperers.

Name: The Story
Verse: Thy Lord creates whatsoever He will and He chooses; they have not the choice. Glory be to God! High be He exalted above that they associate!

Name: The Story
Verse: And thy Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they publish.

Name: The Story
Verse: And He is God; there is no god but He. His is the praise in the former as in the latter; His too is the Judgment, and unto Him you shall be returned.

Name: The Story
Verse: Say: ’What think you? If God should make the night unceasing over you, until the Day of Resurrection, what god other than God shall bring you illumination? Will you not hear?’

Name: The Story
Verse: Say: ’What think you? If God should make the day unceasing over you, until the Day of Resurrection, what god other than God shall bring you night to repose in? Will you not see?

Name: The Story
Verse: Of His mercy He has appointed for you night and day, for you to repose in and seek after His bounty, that haply you will be thankful.’

Name: The Story
Verse: Upon the day when He shall call. to them, and He shall say, ’Where now are My associates whom you were asserting?’

Name: The Story
Verse: And We shall draw out from every nation a witness, and say, ’Produce your proof!’ Then will they know that Truth is God’s, and there shall go astray from them that they were forging.

Name: The Story
Verse: Now Korah was of the people of Moses; he became insolent to them, for We had given him treasures such that the very keys of them were too heavy a burden for a company of men endowed with strength. When his people said to him, ’Do not exult; God loves not those that exult;

Name: The Story
Verse: but seek, amidst that which God has given thee, the Last Abode, and forget not thy portion of the present world; and do good, as God has been good to thee.’ And seek not to work corruption in the earth; surely God loves not the workers of corruption.’

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ’What I have been given is only because of a knowledge that is in me.’ What, did he not know that God bad destroyed before him generations of men stronger than he ill might, and more numerous in multitude? And yet the sinners shall not be questioned concerning their sins.

Name: The Story
Verse: So he went forth unto his people in his adornment. Those who desired the present life said, ’Would that we possessed the like of that Korah has been given! Surely he is a man of mighty fortune.

Name: The Story
Verse: But those to whom knowledge had been given said, ’Woe upon you! The reward of God is better for him who believes, and works righteousness; and none shall receive it except the steadfast.’

Name: The Story
Verse: So We made the earth to swallow him and his dwelling and there was no host to help him, apart from God, and he was helpless;

Name: The Story
Verse: and in the morning those who had longed to be in his place the day before were saying, ’Ah, God outspreads and straitens His provision to whomsoever He will of His servants. Had God not been gracious to us, He would have made us to be swallowed too. Ah, the unbelievers do not prosper,

Name: The Story
Verse: That is the Last Abode; We appoint it for those who desire not exorbitance in the earth, nor corruption. The issue ultimate is to the godfearing.

Name: The Story
Verse: Whoso brings a good deed shall have better than it; and whoso brings an evil deed those who have done evil deeds shall only be recompensed for that they were doing.

Name: The Story
Verse: He who imposed ’the Recitation upon thee. shall surely restore thee to a place of homing. Say: ’My Lord’ knows very well who comes with guidance, and who is in manifest error.

Name: The Story
Verse: Thou didst not hope that the Book should be cast unto thee, except it be as a mercy from thy Lord; so be thou not a partisan of the unbelievers.

Name: The Story
Verse: Let them not bar thee from the signs of God, after that they have been sent down to thee. And call upon thy Lord, and be thou’ not of the idolaters.

Name: The Story
Verse: And call not upon another god with God; there is no god but He. All things perish, except His Face. His is the Judgment, and unto Him you shall be returned.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Alif Lam Mim

Name: The Spider
Verse: Do the people reckon that they will be left to say ’We believe,’ and will not be tried?

Name: The Spider
Verse: We certainly tried those that were before them, and assuredly God knows those who speak truly, and assuredly He knows the liars.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Or do they reckon, those who do evil deeds, that they will outstrip Us? Ill they judge!

Name: The Spider
Verse: Whoso looks to encounter God, God’s term is coming; He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Whosoever struggles, struggles only to his own gain; surely God is All-sufficient nor needs any being.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who believe, and do righteous deeds, We shall surely acquit them of their evil deeds, and shall recompense them the best of what they were doing.

Name: The Spider
Verse: We have charged man, that he be kind to his parents; but if they strive with thee to make thee associate with Me that whereof thou hast no knowledge, then do not obey them; unto Me you shall return, and I shall tell you what you were doing.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who believe, and do righteous deeds assuredly We shall admit them among the righteous.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Some men there are who say, ’We believe in God,’ but when such a man is hurt in God’s cause, he makes the persecution of men as it were God’s chastisement; then if help comes from thy Lord, he will say ’We were with you.’ What, does not God know very well what is in the breasts of all beings?

Name: The Spider
Verse: God surely knows the believers, and He knows the hypocrites.

Name: The Spider
Verse: The unbelievers say to the believers, ’Follow our path, and let us carry your offences’; yet they cannot carry anything, even of their own offences; they are truly liars.

Name: The Spider
Verse: They shall certainly carry their loads, and other loads along with their loads, and upon the Day of Resurrection they shall surely be questioned concerning that they were forging.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, and he tarried among them a thousand years, all but fifty; so the Flood seized them, while they were evildoers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Yet We delivered him, and those who were in the ship, and appointed it for a sign unto all beings.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And Abraham, when he said to his people, ’Serve God, and fear Him; that is better for you, did you know.

Name: The Spider
Verse: You only serve, apart from God, idols and you create a calumny; those you serve, apart from God, have no power to provide for you. So seek after your provision with God, and serve Him, and be thankful to Him; unto Him you shall be returned.

Name: The Spider
Verse: ’But if you cry me lies, nations cried lies before you; and it is only for the Messenger to deliver the Manifest Message.’

Name: The Spider
Verse: (Have they not seen how God originates creation, then brings it back again? Surely that is an easy matter for God.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Say: Journey in the land, then behold how He originated creation; then God causes the second growth to grow; God is powerful over everything,

Name: The Spider
Verse: chastising whom He will, and having mercy on whomsoever He will, and unto Him you shall be turned.

Name: The Spider
Verse: You are not able to frustrate Him either in the earth or in heaven; and you have not, apart from God, either protector or helper.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who disbelieve in God’s signs and the encounter with Him -- they despair of My mercy, and there awaits them a painful chastisement.)

Name: The Spider
Verse: But the only answer of his people was that they said, ’Slay him, or burn him!’ Then God delivered him from the fire; surely in that are signs for a people who believe.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And he said, ’You have only taken to yourselves idols, apart from God, as a mark of mutual love between you in the present life; then upon the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another, and you will curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will have no helpers.’

Name: The Spider
Verse: But Lot believed him; and he said, ’I will flee to my Lord; He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.’

Name: The Spider
Verse: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and We appointed the Prophecy and the Book to be among his seed; We gave him his wage in this world, and in the world to come he shall be among the righteous.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And Lot, when he said to his people ’Surely you commit such indecency as never any being in all the world committed before you.

Name: The Spider
Verse: What, do you approach men, and cut the way, and commit in your assembly dishonour?’ But the only answer of his people was that they said, ’Then bring us the chastisement of God, if thou speakest truly.’

Name: The Spider
Verse: He said, ’My Lord, help me against the people that work corruption.’

Name: The Spider
Verse: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, ’We shall destroy the people of this city, for its people are evildoers.’

Name: The Spider
Verse: He said, ’Lot is in it.’ They said, ’We know very well who is in it; assuredly We shall deliver him and his family, except his wife; she has become of those that tarry.’

Name: The Spider
Verse: When that Our messengers came to Lot he was troubled on their account and distressed for them; but they said, ’Fear not, neither sorrow, for surely we shall deliver thee and thy family, except thy wife; she has become of those that tarry.

Name: The Spider
Verse: We shall send down upon the people of this city wrath out of heaven for their ungodliness.’

Name: The Spider
Verse: And indeed, We have left thereof a sign, a clear sign? unto a people who understand.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And to Midian their brother Shuaib; he said, ’O my people, serve God, and look you for the Last Day; and do not mischief in the land, working corruption.’

Name: The Spider
Verse: But they cried lies to him; so the earthquake seized them, and morning found them in their habitation fallen prostrate.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And Ad, and Thamood -- it has become clear to you from their dwelling-places; and Satan decked out fair to them their works, and barred them from the way, though they saw clearly.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And Korah, and Pharaoh, and Haman; Moses came to them with the clear signs, but they waxed proud in the earth, yet they outstripped Us not.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Each We seized for his sin; and of them against some We loosed a squall of pebbles and some were seized by the Cry, and some We made the earth to swallow, and some We drowned; God would never wrong them, but they wronged themselves.

Name: The Spider
Verse: The likeness of those who have taken to them protectors, apart from God, is as the likeness of the spider that takes to itself a house; and surely the frailest of houses is the house of the spider, did they but know.

Name: The Spider
Verse: God knows whatever thing they call upon apart from Him; He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those similitudes -- We strike them for the people, but none understands them save those who know.

Name: The Spider
Verse: God created the heavens and the earth with the truth; surely in that is a sign to the believers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Recite what has been revealed to thee of the Book, and perform the prayer; prayer forbids indecency and dishonour. God’s remembrance is greater; and God knows the things you work.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Dispute not with the People of the Book save in the fairer manner, except for those of them that do wrong; and say, ’We believe in what has been sent down to us, and what has been sent down to you; our God and your God is One, and to Him we have surrendered.’

Name: The Spider
Verse: Even so We have sent down to thee the Book. Those to whom We have given the Book believe in it; and some of these believe in it; and none denies Our signs but the unbelievers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Not before this didst thou recite any Book, or inscribe it with thy right hand, for then those who follow falsehood would have doubted.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Nay; rather it is signs, clear signs in the breasts of those who have been given knowledge; and none denies Our signs but the evildoers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: They say, ’Why have signs not been gent down upon him from his Lord?’ Say: ’The signs are only with God, and I am only a plain warner.

Name: The Spider
Verse: What, is it not sufficient for them that We have sent down upon thee the Book that is recited to them? Surely in that is a mercy, and a reminder to a people who believe.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Say: ’God suffices as a witness between me and you.’ He knows whatsoever is in the heavens and earth. Those who believe in vanity and disbelieve in God -- those, they are the losers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And they demand of thee to hasten the chastisement! But for a stated term the chastisement would have come upon them; but it shall come upon them suddenly, when they are not aware.

Name: The Spider
Verse: They demand of thee to hasten the chastisement! Lo, Gehenna encompasses the unbelievers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Upon the day the chastisement shall overwhelm them from above them and from under their feet, and He shall say, ’Taste now what you were doing!’

Name: The Spider
Verse: O My servants who believe, surely My earth is wide; therefore Me do you serve!

Name: The Spider
Verse: Every soul shall taste of death; then unto Us you shall be returned.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who believe, and do righteous deeds, We shall surely lodge them in lofty chambers of paradise, underneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever; and excellent is the wage of those who labour,

Name: The Spider
Verse: such men as are patient, and put their trust in their Lord.

Name: The Spider
Verse: How many a beast that bears not its own provision, but God provides for it and you! He is the All-hearer, the All-knower.

Name: The Spider
Verse: If thou askest them, ’Who created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon?’ they will say, ’God.’ How then are they perverted?

Name: The Spider
Verse: God outspreads and straitens His provision to whomsoever He will of His servants; God has knowledge of everything.

Name: The Spider
Verse: If thou askest them, ’Who sends down out of heaven water, and therewith revives the earth after it is dead?’ they will say, ’God.’ Say: ’Praise belongs to God.’ Nay, but most of them have no understanding.

Name: The Spider
Verse: This present life is naught but a diversion and a sport; surely the Last Abode is Life, did they but know.

Name: The Spider
Verse: When they embark in the ships, they call on God, making their religion sincerely His; but when He has delivered them to the land, they associate others with Him,

Name: The Spider
Verse: that they may be ungrateful for what We have given them, and take their enjoyment; they will soon know!

Name: The Spider
Verse: Have they not seen that We have appointed a sanctuary secure, while all about them the people are snatched away? What, do they believe in vanity, and do they disbelieve in God’s blessing?

Name: The Spider
Verse: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie, or cries lies to the truth when it comes to him? What, is there not in Gehenna a lodging for the unbelievers?

Name: The Spider
Verse: But those who struggle in Our cause, surely We shall guide them in Our ways; and God is with the good-doers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Alif Lam Mim

Name: The Romans
Verse: The Greeks have been vanquished

Name: The Romans
Verse: in the nearer part of the land; and, after their vanquishing, they shall be the victors

Name: The Romans
Verse: in a few years. To God belongs the Command before and after, and on that day the believers shall rejoice

Name: The Romans
Verse: in God’s help; God helps whomsoever He will; and He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

Name: The Romans
Verse: The promise of God! God fails not His promise, but most men do not know it.

Name: The Romans
Verse: They know an outward part of the present life, but of the Hereafter they are heedless.

Name: The Romans
Verse: What, have they not considered within themselves? God created not the heavens and the earth, and what between them is, save with the truth and a stated term; yet most men disbelieve in the encounter with their Lord.

Name: The Romans
Verse: What, have they not journeyed in the land and beheld how was the end of those before them? They were stronger than themselves in might, and they ploughed up the earth and cultivated it more than they themselves have cultivated it; and their Messengers came to them with the clear signs; and God would never wrong them, but themselves they wronged.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Then the end of those that did evil was evil, for that they cried lies to the signs of God and mocked at them.

Name: The Romans
Verse: God originates creation, then brings it back again, then unto Him you shall be returned.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Upon the day when the Hour is come, the sinners shall be confounded

Name: The Romans
Verse: no intercessors shall they have amongst their associates, and they shall disbelieve in their associates.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Upon the day when the Hour is come, that day they shall be divided;

Name: The Romans
Verse: as for those who believed, and did deeds of righteousness, they shall walk with joy in a green meadow,

Name: The Romans
Verse: but as for those who disbelieved, and cried lies to Our signs and the encounter of the Hereafter, they shall be arraigned into the chastisement.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So glory be to God both in your evening hour and in your morning hour.

Name: The Romans
Verse: His is the praise in the heavens and earth, alike at the setting sun and in your noontide hour.

Name: The Romans
Verse: He brings forth the living from the dead, and brings forth the dead from the living, and He revives the earth after it is dead; even so you shall be brought forth.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that He created you of dust; then lo, you are mortals, all scattered abroad.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that He created for you, of yourselves, spouses, that you might repose in them, and He has set between you love and mercy. Surely in that are signs for a people who consider.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and earth and the variety of your tongues and hues. Surely in that are signs for all living beings.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is your slumbering by night and day, and your seeking after His bounty. Surely in that are signs for a people who hear.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs He shows you lightning, for fear and hope, and that He sends down out of heaven water and He revives the earth after it is dead. Surely in that are signs for a people who understand.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that the heaven and earth stand firm by His command; then, when He calls you once and suddenly, out of the earth, lo you shall come forth.

Name: The Romans
Verse: To Him belongs whosoever is in the heavens and the earth; all obey His will.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And it is He who originates creation, then brings it back again, and it is very easy for Him. His is the loftiest likeness in the heavens and the earth; He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.

Name: The Romans
Verse: He has struck for you a similitude from yourselves; do you have, among that your right hands own, associates in what We have provided for you so that you are equal in regard to it, you fearing them as you fear each other? So We distinguish the signs for a people who understand.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Nay, but the evildoers follow their own caprices, without knowledge; so who shall guide those whom God has led astray? They have no helpers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So set thy face to the religion, a man of pure faith -- God’s original upon which He originated mankind. There is no changing God’s creation. That is the right religion; but most men know it not --

Name: The Romans
Verse: turning to Him. And fear you Him, and perform the prayer, and be not of the idolaters,

Name: The Romans
Verse: even of those who have divided up their religion, and become sects, each several party rejoicing in what is theirs.

Name: The Romans
Verse: When some affliction visits mankind, they call unto their Lord, turning to Him; then, when He lets them taste mercy from Him, lo, a party of them assign associates to their Lord,

Name: The Romans
Verse: that they may be ungrateful for what We have given them. ’Take your enjoyment; certainly you will soon know.’

Name: The Romans
Verse: Or have We sent down any authority upon them, such as speaks of that they associate with Him?

Name: The Romans
Verse: And when We let men taste mercy, they rejoice in it; but if some evil befalls them for that their own hands have forwarded, behold, they despair.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Have they not seen that God outspreads and straitens His provision to whom He will? Surely in that are signs for a people who believe.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And give the kinsman his right, and the needy, and the traveller; that is better for those who desire God’s Face; those they are the prosperers.

Name: The Romans
